Title: Data Analyst (Junior 1-3 Years)
Description:
We are looking for a junior Data Analyst/Excel specialist that can help to create data input templates in Excel and Microsoft Forms in order to collect ESG data from different parties. The specifications for the templates and forms from and ESG perspective are clear, but we need help in developing the templates and forms. Besides developing the templates and forms, we want to create some automations with the use of MS Power Platform. The specialist needs deep knowledge on Excel, MS Forms, SharePoint, the MS Power Platform and experience in data collection.




Responsibilities:

Building the ESG data input templates & forms: using Excel, Microsoft Forms, Power Automate or similar readily available technologies to the specifications set by ESG Reporting and ESG Risk
Ensure the temporary data collection ‚Äútool‚Äù will be able to integrate with current and future Ingka Investments and /or Ingka Group, data platform(s), ESG Dashboard to be improved per specifications set by ESG Reporting and ESG Risk




Digital Skills Requirements:

Advanced Microsoft Excel. Able to create semi-advanced forms based on excel (e.g., with macros, protected sheets).
Microsoft Forms. Able to create (semi-advanced) MS forms
SharePoint.Able to design access control for shared document access in SharePoint
Power Platform. Able to create advanced review flows, logic to process incoming documents/forms, in integration with other Microsoft products, e.g., Forms, Outlook
Experience in data collection process

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a dynamic consultancy at the forefront of leveraging data to drive impactful insights and innovations across various sectors. As a Data Analyst at our client‚Äôs company, you will play a major role in transforming raw data into actionable strategies for some of the most influential organizations in banking, government, and non-profit sectors in the Netherlands. Their work spans from enhancing financial security to streamlining governmental processes and empowering non-profits to maximize their outreach.




Your Role




As a Data Analyst, you will harness your expertise in data analysis and visualization to uncover critical insights from customer data. Your responsibilities will include




Developing clear and insightful visualizations to facilitate decision-making.
Collaborating closely with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Proposing enhancements to data quality and infrastructure to sustainably maximize data value.
Engaging with both business stakeholders and IT teams to ensure alignment and effectiveness of data initiatives.




Ideal Candidate




A minimum of 2 years in complex data environments.
Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, Oracle BI, Python, and/or R.
Strong familiarity with SQL and data-related concepts such as ETL, data modeling, and data visualization.
A degree in a relevant field and a passion for turning data into actionable insights.
Dutch speaker




The good part




A competitive salary starting from ‚Ç¨3500 gross per month, depending on experience
Monthly & Annual performance bonuses
Pension plan.
Mobility allowance or company car
Up to 27 days of vacation annually
A lovely work environment where your ideas directly impact success of the company
Opportunities for career advancement and personal development in a flat organizational structure




Do you see yourself in the job description?




Apply directly or send your CV at g.apostolou@jeffersonfrank.com

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: In this role, you will be the key link between Commercial and Finance teams. You will be the Subject Matter Expert responsible for Sales Force Metrics and Performance & KPI tracking. You will also coordinate contract management in collaboration with Sales, Legal, and the EMEA contract management team. Your role involves providing sales, volume, and financial analysis to evaluate business opportunities and generate market intelligence presentations for internal and external use. Occasionally, you may join customer meetings as a consultant. You should possess strong business acumen, combined with analytical and local thinking, to translate data into actionable commercial strategies and reports.




Responsibilities:

Act as the local admin and champion for Salesforce (SFDC).
Gather and share market data and insights (GFK) to detect and share market opportunities.
Conduct commercial customer analysis on category, channel, distribution, and product.
Provide in-depth analysis for Strategic Partner Accounts.
Coordinate and follow up on contract management.
Process third-party sell-out data and update the Customer Performance Dashboard (Excel).
Collaborate closely with National Sales Managers (NSMs) to support SFDC KPI metrics and performance reporting.
Provide volume and financial analysis to evaluate financial results.
Create toolkits for field sales representatives to enhance business opportunities.
Analyze the market for new products and trends, identifying opportunities and potential threats.
Support and implement regional and local strategies with the Benelux commercial team.
Work with Marketing on campaign processes, registration, and tracking.
Handle customer contract administration with local Key Account Management and regional headquarters to ensure a smooth contract process.
Manage and maintain the CRM system as the admin for Salesforce (territory management, user setup, data validation, managing sales reps, reporting, and dashboards).
Handle customer segmentation from a finance perspective, in consultation with the regional manager.
Consult with the EMEA team about data quality and make necessary changes (Cognos, SFDC, Oracle).
Produce ad-hoc reports as needed.




Candidate Profile:

Start as soon as possible, with a one-year contract and potential for permanent hire.
36-40 hours per week.
1-3 years of experience;
Strong knowledge and experience with Excel are a must.
Experience with Salesforce, SQL, and/or Tableau is a plus.
Reports to the Business Controller.
Salary between ‚Ç¨45,000 and ‚Ç¨65,000 depending on experience, with an annual performance bonus of approximately 10%.
30 vacation days.
Background in economics/finance.
Team player who enjoys being in the office, proactive, good at data interpretation and presentation, and enjoys interacting with colleagues and stakeholders.
Fluent in Dutch.
Hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, 2 days at home.
Affinity with medical devices is considered a plus.




Qualifications:

Hard Skills:

Experience with Business and financial analysis
Superior Excel skills (pivot tables, macros, lookups, sum if, complex link files)
Database management (Cognos and preferably Tableau)
Project management
Computer skills (word processing, spreadsheet, database tools, design tools, and presentation/chart applications)
Salesforce
Forecasting and statistical modeling
Advanced database and Excel skills
Cognos reporting and Hyperion (training can be provided)
Relevant degree (business/management/economics/finance)

Soft Skills:

Effective communication across all levels
High accuracy and attention to detail
Fluent in Dutch and English
Commercial mindset
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Teamwork and collaboration
Proactive and self-motivated
Adaptability and flexibility




Desired Skills and Experience

Excel (pivot tables, macros, lookups)

Salesforce (SFDC)

SQL

Tableau

Cognos

Oracle

Hyperion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job title: Data Analyst

Salary: Competitive + annual bonus

Location: Amsterdam

Duration: Permanent

Working model: Hybrid (3 days on-site/ 2 days remotely)

Required languages ‚Äì English (fluent‚Äìmandatory), Dutch (desirable), Spanish (desirable), French (desirable), Italian (desirable), German (desirable)




At TCC Global, we help businesses develop and implement strategies to optimise customer experiences, enhance brand presence, and generate meaningful insights through data analysis. We work with our clients to create personalised marketing campaigns, loyalty programs, and customer engagement initiatives that deliver measurable results.




Primary Purpose & Scope:




Are you passionate about data and eager to dive into a hands-on role where your analytical skills can make a real impact? We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our dynamic Data & Analytics team in Amsterdam. This role is crucial for executing data-driven projects, building insightful models, and optimising our loyalty marketing campaigns. As an internally focused role, you'll work closely with client data to support Campaign Measurement Analytics and evaluate the commercial impact of our marketing campaigns.




Role and Responsibilities:




Execute Data & Analytics Projects: Assist the D&A team in conducting various data analysis projects, ensuring accurate and actionable insights.
Data Exploration and Analysis: Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and correlations. Use statistical analysis techniques and data visualisation tools to communicate your findings effectively. Focus particularly on Measurement and control group development and analysis.
Data Quality and Quantity: Support data collection efforts to enhance procedures and ensure the right amount of data is collected for developing analytical systems and models.
Updated Reports and Data Collection: Develop and maintain a comprehensive master document with data from all programs. Keep project and analytical process documentation current.
Key relationships: You will interact with various internal stakeholders, including Project Management, Commercial Teams, GFT, and Omnichannel teams.




Knowledge, Skills & Experience:




Educational Background: Recent graduate with a degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or a related field.
Technical Skills: Experience with statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate and analyse large data sets.
Machine Learning: Familiarity with various machine learning techniques.
Statistical Techniques: Knowledge of advanced statistical methods (regression, distributions, statistical tests) and their applications.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical abilities with meticulous attention to detail.
Teamwork and Communication: Ability to work collaboratively and effectively communicate with different departments.
Technical Experience: Experience with cloud platforms and BI tools.
Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential. Competency in Dutch, Spanish, French, Italian or German is a plus.




If you are enthusiastic about leveraging data to drive business decisions and looking for an opportunity to grow in a supportive environment, we encourage you to apply.




For more information and to be considered for this role, click ‚ÄòApply‚Äô.




We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
ü™ê Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

‚ú® Malt is also‚Ä¶


a tech company with a human approach
a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France




Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! ü™ê

At Malt we believe that Ambition is the Way, so all lists of missions and responsibilities are non-exhaustive.

Explore your future career üî≠

You would be part of Malt‚Äôs data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ‚ú®


Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt




About You üßë‚ÄçüöÄ


You have a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting‚Ä¶)
You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you‚Äôve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts‚Ä¶ You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau‚Ä¶)
You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
You are fluent in English
You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow




What makes you different from others? ü´µ


You have good business acumen, but you also have a ‚Äúhacker‚Äù mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player




How to join the mission? üöÄ


Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)




Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally üí´


Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you‚Äôll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): ‚Ç¨9/day on your Swile card
Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
RTT: From 8 to 12 days off per year
Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
Malt sabbatical: Every three years, all Malters are entitled to a one month fully paid sabbatical leave
Free books: If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt‚Äôs business, just tell us the books you‚Äôd like to read, and we‚Äôll order them for you‚Äîwithout any questions asked or approval processes to follow
Remote work: Hybrid policy balancing on-site and home office
Team building events organized every year




Ready? Get your ticket to Malt ü™ê

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Amsterdam | 12 month | Deta-Vast




Only candidates who are open to Payroll and Deta-Vast are considered for this position




Data Analysis, SQL, Excel, BI Tools, Dutch Speaking, Finance, Stakeholder Management




Are you a junior/medior Data Analyst looking for a role within the finance industry?




Amoria Bond is currently looking for an accomplished Data Analyst for one of our clients, a leading leasing company based in Amsterdam area.




Skills & Experience:




Data Analysis
SQL
Excel
BI Tools
Stakeholder Management
Dutch Speaking




About the Role:




12 month initial contract
Contract to hire / Deta-Vast
Hybrid working




Are you the Data Analyst we are looking for? Send your CV and contact details to

Kieran.Hyde@amoriabond.com and I will contact you as soon as I can!




Data Analysis, SQL, Excel, BI Tools, Dutch Speaking, Finance, Stakeholder Management




We will endeavour to respond to your application ASAP. However, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications, due to high volumes of enquiries. This is sometimes the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. We apologise for this and can reassure you that we will keep your details and contact you in the future should any suitable positions arise.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Ring Europe is looking for a talented marketing analyst, capable of discovering new data insights, designing key KPIs, creating impactful data visualization and bringing our marketing analytics to the next level.

As our Marketing analyst, you will be responsible for key analytical projects and business intelligence in the marketing domain. You will have hands-on experience in digital marketing platforms such as Google, Meta and Bing and are knowledgeable about the latest developments in SEO and digital ads in the industry. You are a marketer at heart but you are also a data expert, writing complex database queries to explore internal / external data sources in order to validate business hypotheses.

This role resides in the BI and Analytics team. You will closely co-work with the Marketing and Business Development teams, along with other business stakeholders, ensuring that Ring optimises its marketing investment to achieve the best return.

Key job responsibilities

Working closely with the marketing, web analytics and business development teams, you will solve unique analytical problems and find answers to questions that require tenacious problem-solving skills and creativity.

What You'll Do


Enhance existing marketing measurement and design KPIs to best measure marketing effectiveness and budget efficiency
Collaborate closely with the marketing team to dive deep into areas such as SEO, funnel analysis and attribution models that will enhance marketing performance using data analytics; then make actionable recommendations
Research industry best practices, the latest tracking trends (such as cookies) and analytical measurement tools
Create and maintain marketing-related Tableau dashboards
Work with the data engineering team to maintain and enhance the internal marketing data platform and data models
Explore and review internal and external marketing data sources to ensure data quality; devise mechanisms and tools to monitor data integrity on a large scale
Conduct ad hoc research and root cause analyses in fields such as user behaviour and web traffic
Assist with preparing quarterly business review documents
Coordinate & facilitate data supply to CMO


Basic Qualifications


Experience in tax, finance or a related analytical field
Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
Experience in business or financial analysis
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with Excel
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in financial/business analysis


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Ring of Security B.V.

Title: Data Analytics/Data Science Intern
Description:
Job Brief:

The Data Analysis Intern is expected to fully engage in routine, remote and on-site work and collaboration with the team.

VentureDive Overview

Founded in 2012 by veteran technology entrepreneurs from MIT and Stanford, VentureDive is the fastest growing technology company in the region that develops and invests in products and solutions that simplify and improve lives of people world-wide. We aspire to create a technology organization and an entrepreneurial ecosystem in the region that are recognized as second to none in the world.

Key Responsibilities

The resource is supposed to build a Dashboard in a BI solution and be able to transfer some older reports from old solutions to new solution.

Required Qualifications and Experience:


Comfort with mathematics and statistics
Candidate should have Data Analytics/ Data Sciences skillset for CQM project
Someone ideally having BS in Data Sciences or Computer science with majors in Data Science or Data Analytics
Anyone doing a same degree and is in last year of university
Solid programming skills in R and SQL, knowledge of Python, Scala, Java a plus
Can easily break apart data components, analyze data for patterns and utilize visualization tools to successfully tell an engaging story (e.g., R, Tableau, Power BI)
Effective Time Management
Business Acumen
Strong Analytical skills
Effective Communication (verbal + written)\

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst (Dutch Speaking)




Do you have a passion for designing and creating powerful and insightful reports and APIs? Do you want to work with the latest BI technologies and collaborate with a dedicated team of experts? Then you might be the perfect candidate for the position of BI Analyst at our client.




About Our Client

At Our Client, the principle of "people first" is central, a belief deeply rooted in their identity. We recognize the immense power of people, which drives our commitment to both our employees and customers. Our mission is to transform complex organizational tasks into user-friendly software accessible to everyone. At Our Client, we not only develop software tools; we create solutions that enrich businesses and society by achieving more with less effort.




What does the role of Business Intelligence Analyst consist of?

As a BI Analyst, you will be part of the Business Intelligence and Data Analytics team, where you report to the BI Team Lead and deliver high-quality reporting solutions using AWS technologies.

In this role, you play a crucial part by being responsible for analyzing, creating, and transforming large datasets to generate actionable business insights. You oversee the design and implementation of a scalable and integrated reporting architecture, ensure seamless data integration, and maintain accuracy in reporting. Your efforts will focus on data analysis, creating reports, and enhancing our client API.

You will have intensive contact with our users and internal stakeholders, including consultants, developers, and our product manager, to assist them further and proactively collect feedback to continuously improve our software and find optimal solutions through data analysis. Due to these responsibilities, it is essential that you have excellent communication skills, feeling comfortable speaking and writing in English. It is a challenging role in which you will make a significant contribution to the further development and success of our client BI software.




What do we ask of you?

Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex tasks and translate them into practical business insights and solutions
You are analytical, detail-oriented, and have a strong preference for creating excellent documentation
You collaborate well with others, working with internal teams to find solutions, but also have no problem independently tackling and completing tasks
You have the ability to translate technical data insights into easily understandable information for both technical and non-technical audiences
You are eager to share the knowledge you have gained from your analyses with the team and the rest of the organization, including customers
Strong experience with data storage, data modeling, and analytical techniques, creating complex reports and dashboards
Experience with reporting tools such as Amazon Quicksight, Power BI, Tableau
You have the ability to gather, interpret, identify gaps, and translate business reporting needs into reporting solutions, dashboards, reports, and insights for our customers
Experience with developing and optimizing SQL queries is desirable but not essential
Contribute to strategic decision-making to improve efficiency and customer experience
Familiarity with how APIs work and the ability to create functional API requirements is desirable but not essential.




What do we offer you as a Business Intelligence Analyst?

The Product Development Organization within our Client and consists of eight international teams. As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will be part of this wonderful organization and join the Business Intelligence and Data Analytics team. You will find yourself in a no-nonsense culture, where you are seen as a person, and where helping and supporting each other is central: "Together we achieve more than alone". The Product Development team faces many challenges in a growing market, where we make smart choices together. You will have the opportunity to shape and execute your tasks independently and help us succeed in delivering reporting capabilities to our customers. Within Our Client, there are many opportunities for further development, career advancement, and growth in a variety of roles. On certain days, the option to work remotely is available, complemented by the opportunity to come to the office.




Employment: 32-40 hours

Plenty of opportunities for professional and personal development.

Above-average employment conditions with a salary between ‚Ç¨ 4,500 - 6,000 gross per month, depending on experience.

Interested? Contact Charles from Guidewell @ 06 19 69 81 77 or send an email to info@guidewell.nl

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we‚Äôre hiring a Data Analyst to join us!




Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.




We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.




Our values

We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!




What you will do




The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.




You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.




Responsibilities




Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework




Qualifications




Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
Experience with DBT.
Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing




Perks & Benefits at Tiqets




Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
Pension scheme and travel compensation
Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
Hybrid working model
Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
Reimbursement home workspace necessities




Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can‚Äôt wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.

Title: Data Analyst - Advertising
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol is always advancing its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and 50,000 trading partners. Our advertising propositions help shoppers discover products and advertisers reach customers ‚Äì this is where you‚Äôll make a difference. Data informs decisions, frames conversations, and changes perceptions. You‚Äôll ensure it‚Äôs used effectively and responsibly.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important. With the rapid expansion of our team, technology, and initiatives, our data needs are no exception. We need meaningful metrics, insightful analyses, and reliable predictive models to keep scaling effectively. This is where you‚Äôll make your mark.

What You‚Äôll Do As a Data Analyst

You‚Äôll join 15 analysts in Bol‚Äôs advertising analytics organisation. Together you share a mission of making people performant through analytics. This role is for the versatile analyst who is equally comfortable working with data and engaging with stakeholders. You‚Äôll work with stakeholders to identify high value use cases for analytics, use SQL, Python, and Tableau to then create metrics, do analysis, and make predictions, and support the business in making better decisions.


You work closely with stakeholders (Leadership, Product teams, Sales teams, Operation teams) to gather requirements.
You‚Äôre curious and develop deep domain knowledge to create meaningfull language around our data for business stakeholders.
You prioritize, design, and perform analysis and/or dashboards.
You deliver insights and predictions through engaging dashboards and presentations.
You develop extensive domain knowledge to effectively manage and analyse advertising KPIs.
You write high quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code that can be reused by colleagues and scales easily as data volumes increase.


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


If you strongly value clarity No, if innovating, autonomy, and ambiguity sound terrifying to you.
You only want to process data No, if you only want to process data and prefer someone else to handle project and stakeholder management.
If you believe analysts don‚Äôt need domain knowledge No, if you don't want to dive into the world of advertising. Curiosity and willingness to learn about our domain and customers are key to your success.
You‚Äôre an analytics professional Yes, if you have 1+ year experience delighting business users with your SQL skills. Python scripting is a strong plus. If you're a recent master's graduate with basic coding skills, feel free to apply
Obsess over building the right things Yes, if you believe output does not equal outcome and judge success by value creation.
You get (and create) energy by working with others Yes, if you can translate technical information into language anyone can understand. You enjoy working with both data and people.


It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Reporting Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Company

Versuni has a simple yet powerful purpose of turning houses into homes. As a house of brands Versuni is home to the brands: Philips, Saeco, Gaggia, Preethi, Philips Walita, L'OR Barista and Senseo. Through meaningful innovation, we improve the lives of people, helping them to lead healthier and happier lives every day. We are looking for a highly motivated, progressive thinker who works with a growth mindset. If you love innovation, challenges and fast-paced ideation, this role may be for you.

You Have The Opportunity To

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Reporting Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, checking, and transforming data from various sources, maintaining data pipelines for automated reporting, and ensuring the timely and consistent delivery of accurate reports. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the data organization, business, and finance sides to meet reporting needs and enhance data-driven decision-making processes.

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Reporting Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, checking, and transforming data from various sources, maintaining data pipelines for automated reporting, and ensuring the timely and consistent delivery of accurate reports. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the data organization, business, and finance sides to meet reporting needs and enhance data-driven decision-making processes.

Your Role & Responsibilities


Collect, clean, check, and transform data from various sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Maintain data pipelines for automated reporting, ensuring seamless data flow and integration.
Maintain accurate monthly reporting schedules to ensure timely and consistent report generation and delivery to stakeholders.
Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders in the data organization, business, and finance teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver insights.
Design, develop, and optimize reports to support business needs and provide actionable insights.
Monitor and troubleshoot data quality issues, implementing corrective measures to ensure high data standards.
Assist in the development and maintenance of documentation for data processes, pipelines, and reporting standards.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights to support business decision-making.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve reporting processes and tools, leveraging best practices and industry standards.


To succeed in this role, you should have the following qualifications and experience:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, Statistics, or economics related field.
2-4 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, project management or a related role.
Proficiency with data visualization tools (Power BI, Quick Sight, SAC).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Knowledge of data governance and data security principles.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment and embrace continuous learning.


Why should you join Versuni?

We are proud of the products we make. As a leading player in domestic appliances, we offer sustainable products across kitchen appliances, coffee, air, garment, and home care. The successful product ranges include the renowned Airfryer, Espresso Machine with LatteGo, the PerfectCare Elite Steam Generator, Air Purifier and SpeedPro Max vacuum cleaner. We are also known as home to such brands as Philips Walita, Saeco, Gaggia and Preethi.

In Versuni we work with contagious positivism. We believe that inclusion comes before diversity and all voices are heard. When you join our closely connected and diverse team, you'll be joining a global family. Like all families, we grow together and support each other. In our drive for digital transformation success, we partner to grow and deliver. We celebrate our wins together.

Our company is headquartered in The Netherlands, and has innovation, manufacturing, and commercial centers across the globe, with presence in over 100 countries. We employ approximately 7,000 talented individuals who bring innovation to customers and consumers.

Our goal is for you to grow every day, and to support you to become the very best version of yourself. We are committed to providing the highest levels of consumer satisfaction, underpinned by our quality approach. We make conscious choices caring for people‚Äôs homes and our planet. We grow responsibly and sustainably.

Sustainability is an important factor for Versuni. We have been 100% carbon neutral in our operations since 2020, but this is just the start of our plan. We know everything we use today will affect the planet tomorrow. For the past century, we've innovated to make products faster, better, and more energy efficient. A better future is possible with a plan that‚Äôs built to last.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst at Diemen HQ, Netherlands. Hybrid. Fulltime.




people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees, and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today‚Äôs technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




how you will contribute

As a Senior Data Analyst at Randstad, you will leverage your excellent analytical skills and keen eye for detail to drive impactful data insights. In this role, you will go beyond the numbers to be the voice of data, effectively communicating with decision-makers, product owners, and team leaders.

You will thrive in our fast-paced corporate environment, adapting quickly to new challenges and finding pragmatic solutions. You will take ownership of your work, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all your analyses. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable insights will play a crucial role in guiding strategic decisions and driving the success of our initiatives.




what you will be doing

Within this role, via Randstad Market Insights (RMI), you will enable colleagues to make data driven decisions and conclusions by making data accessible and understandable. Behind the scenes you will set up and execute data analysis on a variety of internal and external data sources as well as build dashboards to generate actionable insights, keep track of the key data quality metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.




who will you work with

As part of the RMI team, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientists, a product owner, a scrum master, and junior data analysts based in the Global Competency Center (GCC). Additionally, you will work alongside a senior data engineer, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of data across various projects.

In this guiding role, you will mentor and support junior data analysts, fostering their growth and development within the team. Your responsibilities will involve working with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, translating these requirements into actionable insights, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data solutions.




what you will bring

Your communication, visualization, and storytelling skills are well-developed, allowing you to effectively translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives for various audiences. With a track record in data analysis, preferably within a market intelligence or similar corporate environment, you excel in collaborative settings and are an excellent team player.

You possess fluency in data visualization and business intelligence (BI) tools enabling you to create insightful and impactful visual representations of data as well as proficiency in SQL. Additionally, you have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), enhancing your ability to manage and analyze data in modern, scalable environments.

Your demonstrated ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.




what‚Äôs in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;

Hybrid work (based twice a week in Diemen HQ) with sporadic travel requirements
Competitive salary
An additional flexible benefit budget
Attractive bonus scheme
Option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan
Option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays
Attractive mobility arrangements
Opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave
Growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment
Working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed
An environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated




We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our Internal Talent Acquisition Partner Jenny Roberts (jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk)




The recruitment procedure consists of a screening, a 30 minute online behavioural assesment and at least two interviews.




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
THIS IS YOUR JOB

As Data Analyst at Effectory you will be improving the working lives of millions of people by leveraging employee data to help companies make better decisions, optimize operations, gain insights, and achieve strategic objectives. In this role you can apply your knowledge of analyzing and interpreting HR- and employee-data in a variety of ways.

This role divides its time between the Product Development and Consulting with separate but overlapping responsibilities. Formally you will be part of the Data Team, that is part of Product Development.

The role of Data Analyst has 3 areas of responsibility:

Product Development (50%)

Collaborating with our data scientist, you will develop data-driven enhancements for our products and services, leveraging our data in innovative ways. Your contributions can include constructing predictive and descriptive models that empower our customers to better understand, interpret, and act on their survey results.

This role involves tasks such as data collection, pre-processing, and conducting various types of exploratory analysis using survey data, metadata, and web analytics. You will have the creative freedom to incorporate additional external data as needed. Making data visible through dashboards and reports is crucial for our product's success, and you will design innovative dashboards based on the data you collect and analyze, providing valuable insights to our customers.

Data Analysis for Thought Leadership (25-40%)

For 2024 and beyond, our team of consultants aims to strengthen our thought leadership capability. Building on our historical data, benchmarks, and numerous studies, we have a wealth of relevant and interesting data to share more (pro-)actively, something our customers expect from us and frequently inquire about.As a Data Analyst you will collaborate closely with our Consultant - Thought Leader to investigate hypotheses and create relevant insights. We share these insights with our marketing and sales teams, use them to present during events as well as for our customer facing teams, helping them in both their commercial and advisory tasks.

Custom Data Analysis for Customers (10-25%)

Although we do not actively offer custom data analyses to customers, around 30 enterprise customers per year request custom analyses based on our research, sometimes in combination with their own data. This sometime involves doing an intake with the customer and possibly also an explanation of the findings.

THIS IS YOU

You Are An Experienced Data Analyst With At Least 3 Years Relevant Work Experience. You Have a Master‚Äôs Degree, With a Quantitative Character, Like For Instance Econometrics, Mathematics, Or Data Science. Next To That


You have experience with modern data analysis tooling such as Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, SQL, Databricks.
Experience in the different phases of the analysis life cycle: data collection, extraction, cleaning and preparation, statistical methods for analysis, visualization and reporting and data modeling predicting
Strong analytical skills and a proactive, results-oriented mindset.
Good communication skills in English.
If you have experience in the field of HR/Employee data that is a plus


THIS IS US

Effectory is Europe‚Äôs leading employee feedback solution. With our platform, HR and management we collect employee feedback throughout the employee journey. This feedback is transformed into people analytics that informs strategies to boost productivity, engagement and retention. Built on 25 years‚Äô experience, our 200 specialists in Amsterdam and Munich support more than 1,200 organizations in 110 countries. Now more than ever, HR is an integral part of business strategy, which is why our feedback solution is tailor-made for strategic HR.

Effectory‚Äôs mission

We are dedicated to improving the working world by giving employees a voice and making sure their feedback has an impact. Our experts work with HR teams and managers around the world, using employee feedback to overcome some of their biggest people-oriented challenges. From software engineers to HR specialists, every day Effectory‚Äôs people work to improve the working world, and we are looking for talented individuals who also want to be part of this mission.

This Is What We Offer


A monthly salary (the range for this position is around‚ÄØ‚Ç¨ 45.000 - ‚Ç¨ 65.000 gross a year based on full-time employment depending on your experience).
An annual bonus scheme.
25 holidays for FTEs, and flexible public holiday options.
A fun and interactive onboarding program to get to know our company and some of your new colleagues.
A learning budget to spend on your own personal development. We also provide extensive professional and personal development opportunities and organize yearly summer and winter schools.
Flexible working: you will be able to work max 60% of your contract hours from home (or any other location in the Netherlands).
Budget to set up your home office.
Yearly Body & Mind budget to spend on anything that energizes (or relaxes) you.
Annual events, such as our Winter Party, Summer Party & the legendary Big Day.
Additional monthly compensation for working from home.
The option to work abroad for up to 4 months, and to take an unpaid sabbatical.
You get your birthday off work and can also take a day to volunteer for a cause of your choice.


This is a part-time position for 32 hours (4 days) and with a start date as soon as possible.

Please note that we cannot provide visa sponsorship or relocation for this position.

This Is How It Works


‚ÄØYou want this job: submit your application via the link below
‚ÄØWe are intrigued: join a phone or video call to get to know each other a bit better and to ask questions
‚ÄØWe all think it went well: we now meet live (or in a video call) to get to know each other a bit better
‚ÄØWe want to see you in action:‚ÄØyou complete a case/assessment (if applicable)
‚ÄØThe final hurdle: we agree on terms & conditions, we sign and you start!

Title: Data Analyst - AI
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for an AI team for one of the biggest banks in the Netherlands. They are looking for someone with strong technical skills, an innovative mindset, feel for business and entrepreneurial drive. You'll work directly with entrepreneurs and business counterparts to bring data solutions from idea to production. They are looking for creative and passionate people with a "go get it" mentality. Their Data Analysts are multi-skilled and have strong coding, system design and visualisation skills combined with an understanding of the business that they put to use within the context of data analytics.

Ideal Profile


You have a Master degree or higher in a quantitative field
You have 2-5 years of relevant work experience
You are up to date on the latest developments within data and dashboarding and can guide others in finding optimal solutions
You are familiar with the 'tools of the trade', eg SQL, Python, Databricks, PowerBI, Git
You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are a self-starter.


About Levy Professionals

Since 2000, we have been delivering professional solutions to organizations ranging from tech start-ups to global players. From our offices in Amsterdam and London, we have built an international and local network of experienced salaried professionals, driven by our passion for connecting skills with projects. Over the years we have filled over 1,700 applications and today we have consistently recruited and seconded 250+ professionals from 14 countries who have been deployed on a variety of projects. Our strength is the way we see and treat people. This will always be an important factor in our strategy for the coming years.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
HTML:
Als Data Scientist kom jij te werken in het innovatieteam van de organisatie. In het team is de plek waar samenwerking met de business uiteenlopende experimenten doen om waarde creeÃàren met data. Op dit moment wordt gewerkt aan een AI-programma dat uit diverse moonshots en tientallen use cases bestaat. Op deze manier lossen we concrete problemen uit de organisatie op, ontwikkelen we AI-skills en introduceren we een moderne data infrastructuur. Je krijgt je eigen cases, die je samen met collega‚Äôs en stakeholders uit de business realiseert. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het automatiseren van het transactiekostenanalyseproces voor vreemde valuta, digitalisering van portfolio management, het maken van een voorspelmodellen of het toepassen van AI om de problemen op de arbeidsmarkt van zorg en welzijn op te lossen. Maar ook het uitdenken van manieren om met data de klantbeleving te verbeteren hoort hierbij.


Je komt te werken binnen een team dat bestaat uit een vaste kern van 15 man/vrouw, aangevuld met collega‚Äôs binnen en buiten de organisatie met data expertise, die een bijdrage leveren aan experimenten. Het innovatieteam ontwikkelt zich tot het datahart van de organisatie, waar we experimenteren met data technology, en waarvoor we op het moment fundamentele verbeteringen.


Je bent een Data Scientist die bevlogen is met data en ervoor gaat om het maximale uit data te halen. Je denkt vanuit de klant en in het oplossen van concrete problemen. Deze overtuiging weet jij ook nog eens uit te dragen naar de rest van de organisatie. Verder herken jij je in het volgende profiel:

  • Afgeronde WO-opleiding en een exacte richting, zoals bijvoorbeeld software engineering, informatica, (toegepaste) wiskunde;
  • Wij zijn op zoek naar een junior data-scientist die zich graag wilt ontwikkelen;
  • Kennis van Python en ervaring met werken met cloud oplossingen (Azure platform) is een pluspunt;
  • Je gaat proactief de organisatie in op zoek naar meer vraagstukken die er liggen, om de visie voor datamanagement uit te dragen naar de organisatie;
  • Je kan zowel individueel als in een (multidisciplinair) team werken aan projecten in een dynamische omgeving.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bynder goes far beyond managing digital assets. Our digital asset management platform enables teams to conquer the chaos of proliferating content, touchpoints, and relationships in order to thrive.

With powerful and intuitive solutions that embrace the way people want to work, and a richly integrated ecosystem, We are the brand ally that unifies and transforms the creation and sharing of assets, inspiring teams, delighting customers, and elevating businesses.

Our 500+ employees, known as ‚ÄòByndies‚Äô, together constitute the world‚Äôs most extensive pool of digital asset management expertise. We enable more than 1.7M users across more than 3,700 organizations, including Spotify, Puma, Five Guys and Icelandair.

Founded in 2013, we have eight offices around the globe, including the Netherlands, USA, Spain, UK, Australia and UAE. For more information, visit www.bynder.com.

Bynder's Internal Analytics platform is essential for streamlining our product and business growth by providing best-in-class data and insights to our stakeholders precisely when they need it. We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst who will contribute to the technical and analytical efforts of our team, ensuring data-driven decisions and solutions.

Responsibilities

Data Analysis: Conduct thorough data analysis to extract meaningful insights, identify trends, and support decision-making processes across the organization.

Product Analytics: Conduct in-depth product analytics to identify key trends, user behaviors, and areas for improvement. Collaborate with product teams to drive data-informed decisions and enhance overall product performance.

Report Generation: Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like DBT, Snowflake, and ThoughtSpot to provide stakeholders with actionable insights.

Collaboration: Work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value. Collaborate with other teams in Bynder‚Äôs Data Group to ensure data consistency and accuracy.

Technical Contribution: Utilize your technical skills to manage and manipulate large datasets, ensuring data quality and integrity. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and tools to continuously improve our data practices.

Qualifications

Experience: Minimum of 3 years in data analytics, with hands-on experience in analyzing and interpreting complex data sets.

Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and Python is essential. Experience in DBT, data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake) or machine learning is a plus.

Communication: Strong communication skills to effectively convey insights and collaborate with team members and stakeholders.

Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work with internal stakeholders and engineers to deliver exceptional outputs.

Join us to leverage your analytical expertise to drive Bynder‚Äôs growth through data and analytics. If you have a passion for data and an aptitude for technical problem-solving, we want to hear from you!

Why you'll love Bynder!

At Bynder, innovation is in our DNA. We've worked hard to build an environment that promotes creative thinking and self-initiative within a culture of fun. It‚Äôs common to find colleagues hanging out after work - if you believe in "be nice, work hard, have fun", you'll have an office full of friends.

What we have:


Challenging and inspiring work environment
Flat hierarchy where your voice will be truly heard
Opportunity to initiate your own projects
An experienced team is ready to welcome you anytime
Unlimited vacation policy
Competitive monthly compensation
Apple gear
Daily lunch
Drinks at the Bynder Bar :-)
Amazing office in the heart of Amsterdam



Our Commitment:

Bynder Love is the principle that guides the way we grow our teams, support our employees, and celebrate our differences. At Bynder we strive to create a culture that embraces every Byndie because differences in background, experience, and perspective make Bynder even better. At Bynder a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees, whatever their ethnicity, color, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or physical and mental ability are valued and respected. Our commitment is for all Byndies to have the freedom to be their true authentic selves.

Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder‚Äôs commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
For our client, we are looking for a Senior Consultant Data & Analytics.




As a Senior Consultant in our Data & Analytics team, your role will be part technical guru and part communication expert. We are looking for an experienced data analytics professional with 3-5 years previous experience in similar roles.




Your role will be very diverse:

Data Analysis: You'll employ your analytical skills to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets. Your ability to see beyond numbers and identify trends will play a crucial role in driving strategic decisions.
Technical Liaison: With an ability to converse fluently with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, you'll act as the translator between business needs and data solutions. One moment you might be deep in data modelling discussions, and the next explaining its implications to a business executive. You have to like translating business requirements into actionable and effective technical strategies that align with company objectives!
Visual Storyteller: Your knack for clear visualization will transform raw data into understandable narratives that drive informed decision-making processes.
Technical Mastery: Proficiency in at least two of the following coding languages/tools is expected: SQL, Alteryx, Celonis, PowerBI/Tableau, Python, Databricks. Experience with SAP is also a pre - we need someone who can navigate these tools and platforms like their hometown!
Mentorship Role: As a senior consultant, your experience will not only contribute to project and client success but also guide junior consultants on their journey towards becoming seasoned professionals.




Ideal candidates are those with robust technical skills complemented by stellar communication abilities - because effective data analysis isn't just about number crunching; it's about making those numbers speak to everyone regardless of their background or expertise level.




We would love to hear from you if:

You are passionate about leveraging data to drive decision-making, enjoy collaborating across teams and love being part of an organization that values curiosity, learning and growth.
You have a Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a comparable discipline. Applicants with a Business Administration or related degree should have prior experience in data analysis work.
You have 3-5 years experience as a data analyst, data scientist, data consultant or any related area.
You are great working with at least two of these coding languages/tools: SQL, Alteryx, Celonis, PowerBI/Tableau, Python, Databricks. SAP knowledge is a pre.
You have 2+ years of experience with actively facilitating client meetings, conducting workshops and presentations.
You have great communication and presentation capabilities and are adept at simplifying complex data insights for audiences without a technical background.
You are able to communicate (speak and write) in the Dutch and English language.




This opportunity promises challenges that stimulate, colleagues who inspire and a career path full of potential milestones (and certainly some fun along the way too!).

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Are you interested in joining one of the most data-rich environments in The Netherlands? KLM, having carried over 93 million passengers in 2023, provides direct flights to over 160 destinations and boasts a loyal frequent flyer customer base of over 16 million. The KLM Digital Marketing department operates across 70 countries, driving traffic, bookings, and revenue on KLM.com. This offers a vast landscape for skill application, personal growth, and learning opportunities.

As a Global Marketing Data Analyst, you will join the Quantitative Marketing team, a highly motivated group focused on optimizing the customer journey, assessing the value of various channels (such as search, email, display), and tackling a wide range of data-related topics.

What will you do?


Power up our marketing insights: Take charge of conceptualizing, coordinating, and initiating the creation of visually stunning and actionable dashboards that unlock the potential of our data.
Be the data champion: Set up and own end-to-end data pipelines for marketing sources, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of all relevant data.
Unleash the power of analytics: Implement strategic tagging on klm.com to capture valuable data within our Customer Data Platform (CDP) and cutting-edge marketing platforms. Your expertise will drive effective targeting and personalized experiences.
Chart the path to success: Collaborate with marketing teams to develop robust strategies for performance measurement, leveraging first-party tracking and attribution methodologies.
Connect the dots: Build a cohesive and harmonized marketing data landscape across various tools, channels, and teams. Your expertise will ensure seamless integration, unlocking valuable insights and driving data-informed decisions.
Analytics ally: Be the trusted analyst of choice for colleagues seeking analytical support. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, providing expert guidance and delivering data-driven solutions that fuel growth and innovation.


Where do you land?

As a part of KLM's Digital Marketing department, you will be an integral member of the Quantitative Marketing team. In this position, you will collaborate with data scientists and data engineers, fostering close partnerships with teams responsible for different online marketing channels, campaign management, and digital product development. Additionally, you will engage with stakeholders beyond the department. Reporting to the Head of Quantitative Marketing, you will work together to oversee the roadmap with the shared goal of enhancing data-driven decision-making capabilities.

Your profile

Tell you what to do? We prefer not to! Your passion lies in discovering how things work, and you excel at it. Moreover, you possess a remarkable talent for swiftly identifying opportunities for improvement. When it comes to discussions with colleagues, you actively engage to maximize your work and enhance the customer experience. Working proactively and independently on your tasks is second nature to you.

You Also Have The Following


Academic excellence: We prefer candidates with an academic thinking and working level, ideally holding a university degree in business (analytics), marketing, economics, or a comparable field.
SQL proficiency: Experience in writing SQL queries is essential for this role. Your ability to extract and manipulate data will be crucial in uncovering valuable insights.
Affinity with online marketing: A strong interest and understanding of online marketing concepts will enable you to effectively contribute to marketing strategies and campaigns.
Data tools and cloud platforms: Experience with data tools and working with cloud platforms is highly desirable. Familiarity with platforms such as Google Cloud will give you a head start.
Visualization skills: Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau will allow you to transform complex data sets into visually compelling and easy-to-understand dashboards.
Project management experience: While not mandatory, previous experience in project management will be advantageous as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute and deliver on various projects.
Programming knowledge: Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R will be beneficial in manipulating and analyzing large datasets.
Google Analytics (or similar): Knowledge of web analytics tools like Google Analytics is preferred. Understanding user behavior and tracking campaign performance will be an asset in this role.


What Do We Offer


A challenging role at an unique employer in the Netherlands;
A gross salary between ‚Ç¨3.712,92 and ‚Ç¨5.304,17 per month;
Plenty of room for personal development and wonderful career opportunities;
A good pension scheme and 8 percent holiday pay;
An end of the year bonus of 8,33%;
25 days of paid holiday and 5 extra days off;
Great discounts on airline tickets (if you have been in service for at least 6 months);
A travel expenses scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol;
Discount of your health insurance;
A personal budget for sustainable employability.


Ready for your next destination?

Don‚Äôt wait any longer and apply for this function before the final boarding call on 07/26/2024! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks, you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and ‚Äìpossibly- an assessment and security research.Did you know that according to research, women are less likely to apply than men when they don't meet all the job requirements? What a shame. Because, in our view, 'the perfect candidate' is a myth. So, if you have the drive to grow in aspects of this role, we look forward to your application. A file check (for ex-KLM-employees) and/or a reference check can be part of the application procedure. By applying for this vacancy you consent to these checks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we‚Äôre facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.
