At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Ben jij een gedreven en enthousiaste Data Analist met een passie voor het analyseren, modelleren en interpreteren van gegevens? Dan maken wij graag kennis met jou!


Binnen Visma | Raet maken we impact. Wat hebben ziekenhuizen, overheidsinstellingen en scholen met elkaar gemeen? De kans is groot dat ze onze HR-oplossingen gebruiken. Visma | Raet is namelijk leverancier van software die het leven van HR-professionals makkelijker en leuker maakt. We helpen organisaties om medewerkers blij te maken.


Zo bouw je met ons mee


Ter versterking van het Data Insights & Automation team zijn we op zoek naar een enthousiaste Data Analist die ons helpt om onze data driven organisatie naar het volgende niveau te tillen door gegevens te analyseren, modelleren en interpreteren. Door de samenwerking met verschillende afdelingen wordt bepaald hoe ons data platform verder kan groeien. Uitstekend ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden spreken voor zich. Je presenteert jezelf sterk. Je bent alert op aspecten als kwaliteit, documentatie, architectuur, standaarden en het afwegen van korte ‚Äì en lange termijn overwegingen. Samen met collega‚Äôs onderzoek en visualiseer je data die ons helpt om doelstellingen waar te maken. Samen met onze data engineers zorg je ervoor dat de benodigde data in een bruikbare vorm beschikbaar gesteld wordt. Jullie structureren, interpreteren, documenteren en zorgen voor tests zodat de kwaliteit aantoonbaar goed is. Zo speel jij een cruciale rol in het realiseren van onze bedrijfsdoelen.


Daarnaast beschik jij over:


  • HBO of WO werk-en denkniveau;
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren en presenteren van data-analyses;
  • Ervaring met het achterhalen van de echte behoefte achter een vraag en het vertalen hiervan naar concrete deliverables;
  • Ervaring met datavisualisatietools (Tableau / Power BI) is een pr√©;
  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.


Dit heb je ervoor nodig en breng je mee


Je beschikt over uitstekend ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden. Contacten en relaties met jouw collega‚Äôs zijn essentieel voor succes en zoekt deze samenwerking dan ook op. Naast deze vaardigheden, ben je goed in:


  • Methodische aanpak en analytische vaardigheden;
  • Je hebt oog voor kwaliteit, documentatie, architectuur, standards, gebruiksvriendelijkheid, afweging korte/lange termijn, onderhoudbaarheid en security;
  • Kennis en ervaring met SQL;
  • Agile development & Delivery practices en tools;
  • Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels in woord en geschrift;
  • Relational en dimensional modeling, data mapping, ETL / ELT;
  • Opsplitsen van complexe problemen in overzichtelijke deelproblemen.


Wat je ziet en wat je krijgt


Je krijgt de kans om een belangrijke rol te zijn in het succes van Visma | Raet en de tevredenheid van onze klanten en medewerkers. Ook draag je bij aan het verbeteren van de huidige processen en zorgt hiermee dat we effectief blijven opereren. Ook jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling is hierin erg belangrijk. Daarom bieden we je de mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontplooien, zowel als analist als op persoonlijk vlak.


Wat je van ons kan verwachten


We vragen veel van je, maar daar staat tegenover dat je werkt met professionele, gedreven en leuke collega‚Äôs van alle leeftijden en ervaringsniveaus. Binnen Visma | Raet werken we gedeeltelijk vanuit huis. Wanneer je vanuit kantoor werkt, is dat op ons hoofdkantoor in Amersfoort met zo‚Äôn 400 andere collega‚Äôs. Je werkt binnen het Data Insights & Automation team samen met enkele business analisten en data engineers. Je werkt met mooie producten die daadwerkelijk waarde leveren voor de klanten. Uiteraard hebben we een goed inwerkprogramma voor je klaar liggen. Verder kan je verwachten:


  • Een rol met impact in een internationale werkende, snel veranderende organisatie;
  • Volop kansen om te groeien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak door middel van kennissessies;
  • Een uitstekend bruto salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨4.000 en ‚Ç¨5.500 afgestemd op je ervaring;
  • Een interessante bonusregeling van 2 %;
  • Interessante vitaliteitsprogramma‚Äôs met a.s.r. Vitality;
  • Een open en fijne cultuur met veel vrijheid en ruimte voor je eigen initiatief;
  • Standplaats Amersfoort, goed bereikbaar met ov en auto;
  • Laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
  • Grote kansen op succes bij een marktleider;
  • De mogelijkheid om flexibel en thuis te werken;
  • Een goede thuiswerkregeling en thuiswerkvergoeding om jouw werkplek mee in te richten;
  • 28 vakantiedagen per jaar en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Een fulltime dienstverband.


Direct solliciteren en meer weten


Wil je onderdeel uitmaken van het gedreven team en druk je graag je stempel op het het succes van Visma | Raet? Solliciteer dan direct! Wil je eerst nog wat meer weten? Neem dan contact op met Cheryl Bihari (Talent Acquisition Partner) via cheryl.bihari@visma.com.


Een online assessment en referentiecheck is onderdeel van de procedure. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld, wij vullen deze vacature in zonder tussenkomst van externe bureaus.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Newcraft you‚Äôll delve into the data of our A-brand clients in order to improve their channel conversions. You‚Äôre a crucial link in the digital acceleration of our top brand clients.

What You‚Äôll Be Working On

Together with your fellow Commerce team members, you will make sure our clients achieve digital growth. You will collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities that improve the online customer journey. In this process, you collaborate closely with the client to ensure that your knowledge and skills are effectively transferred.

Your Responsibilities


Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
Advise and convince teams at every level.
Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.


Qualifications


A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.


Who You Are


Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
Self-starting.
Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
Fluent in Dutch and English.


About Us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you‚Äôll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We‚Äôre passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Over de vacature


Over de functie

Als medior/senior data analist ben je samen met het team verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren en oppakken van complexe dataverzoeken vanuit de organisatie. Je draagt daarnaast bij aan de verdere ontwikkeling van de data omgeving, data kwaliteit en processen. Het is belangrijk dat je zelfstartend bent en je ruime ervaring hebt met het aan elkaar knopen van datasets in sql.


Over de organisatie

Dit bedrijf is gevestigd in Den Haag. Deze organisatie heeft in totaal circa 140 IT collega‚Äôs. De IT afdeling zit midden in een transitie. Jij zal terechtkomen in het BIDS (BI & Data science) team. In dit team werken ongeveer 25 collega‚Äôs die zich focussen op Frontend of op Backend. Dit bedrijf ziet dat de informatie(technologie) een steeds grotere rol gaat spelen binnen de behandeling van pati√´nten en speelt hier doormiddel van data een grote rol in.


Wie ben jij

  • Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke rol;
  • Bachelor of master;
  • Ervaring met SQL en de microsoft stack;
  • Ervaring met r en of python is een mooie plus
  • Ervaring met de zorgsector is een pr√©.

(Sluit jij wellicht niet helemaal perfect aan op bovengenoemde eisen, maar spreekt de functie je wel aan? Laat het mij dan ook zeker weten. Ik kom graag met je in contact om te bespreken of je profiel wellicht toch interessant voor hun kan zijn).


Wat bieden we je

  • Marktconform salaris, afhankelijk van werkervaring (tot ‚Ç¨5300 per maand) op basis van 36 uur;
  • 32 en 36 uur mogelijk;
  • Een 13e maand;
  • 166 vakantie-uren en 35 extra vakantie uren;
  • Vrijheid om jouw werkdag in te delen;
  • Een goed pensioen.


Interesse?

Kan jij je vinden in de bovenstaande beschrijving en wil je een stap maken in je carri√®re? Neem dan contact op met mij via m.bodaar@elevationpartners.nl Stuur je een recent CV mee? Dan kunnen we meteen kijken of jouw ervaring aansluit bij het opgestelde profiel.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're Creative Fabrica, a fast-scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.




Our mission




Enable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating, and sharing. The ‚ÄòCreative Inspiration Flywheel‚Äô




This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.




About the platform




We launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 8 years, we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!




We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, over 20 million listed products, and 20000+ active designers.




Our focus is to create a platform for designers to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.




Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. Suppose you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions. In that case, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.




In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.




What you will do:




Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency.
Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making.
Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies.
Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes.




What you will bring:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience.
Strong programming skills in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and data analysis tools.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.




Nice to have:




Experience in complex modeling.
Strong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R, and/or other relevant tools.
Experience and/or understanding of DBT (Data Build Tool).




Let us take care of you.




Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills, and ambition should be fairly compensated.
Top-Notch Tools and Gear: You'll be equipped with everything you need: a top-of-the-line laptop, the latest collaboration tools, and stylish accessories to match.
Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the center, working here means delicious lunches cooked by our very own chefs, plus access to our own CF library to keep the learning going.
And a great team: We work hard and have fun together. On Fridays, we kick off the weekend together at the local bar, but there's more; we regularly organize events and company trips, creating opportunities to bond and build meaningful connections.




Is this you?




Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.




You can apply by clicking the "Apply now" button.




Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
In de rol van Data-/BI-specialist ben je d√© collega met kennis op het gebied van Business Intelligence en Data Analytics.


Je gaat aan de slag met het omtoveren van data naar informatie. Hierbij maak je gebruik van analysetechnieken en je eigen kennis en kunde. Door jouw sociale vaardigheden begrijp je de context en de daaruit voortkomende vraag naar informatie van je collega. Je weet deze vraag door je technische vaardigheden te relateren aan de techniek om de gevraagde informatie beschikbaar te krijgen. Je zet hier databases voor op en ontwikkelt informatieproducten zoals dashboards inclusief het modelleren en visualiseren van de data.


Soms is de data nog niet beschikbaar. Je houdt je daarom ook bezig met het automatiseren van

bedrijfsprocessen en het meedenken over welke tooling en technieken van toegevoegde waarde

zijn om effici√´nt en effectief van data informatie te maken. Niet enkel stel je informatie beschikbaar, je zorgt er ook voor dat deze informatie betrouwbaar is √©n ook van waarde is voor onze directe klant. Dit kan betekenen dat je gebruikers van informatie bijbrengt wat informatie-gestuurd werken is, hoe de gebruiker dit in zijn/haar context kan toepassen, door blijft vragen tot een duidelijke schets van het ‚Äúprobleem‚Äù, je analyses verricht die leiden tot inzichten, je adviseert over welke technische aspecten dienen te veranderen om mee te gaan in de ontwikkeling van analytics en meer!


Wat onze opdrachtgever van je verwacht

Bij onze opdrachtgever krijg je veel ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Wel is het fijn als je in ieder geval:

  • Beschikt over HBO werk- en denkniveau;
  • Ervaring hebt met het ontwikkelen en beheren van informatieproducten, bij voorkeur PowerBI (informatietaxonomie, modellering en visualisatie);
  • Ervaring hebt met en kennis van programmeren, zoals SQL, Python en R;
  • Kennis hebt van het optimaliseren van data processen en alle bijbehorende rapportages
  • en data analyses;
  • Een actieve bijdrage kunt leveren aan de visieontwikkeling van het data-/IV-beleid.


Wat is het aanbod qua voorwaarden

  • Uitstekend salaris;
  • Dertiende maand en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Opleidingen;
  • Netwerk van professionals;
  • Modern keuzeplan arbeidsvoorwaarden;
  • Goede pensioenvoorziening;
  • We werken hybride, thuis en op kantoor te Amsterdam
  • Uitzicht op vast contract.


You need to speak Dutch fluently.


Interesse?

Reageer dan via 06-46335559 of mail jouw gegevens naar jmulder@serenit.nl!

Title: Global BI & Analytics Internship
Description:
GLOBAL BI & ANALYTICS INTERNSHIP

AMSTERDAM, COTY HQ

At Coty, we are seeking a motivated Global BI & Analytics Intern to join our team. This internship is designed for students who are eager to dive into the world of data and analytics on a global scale. The ideal candidate has a strong passion for data, an analytical mindset, and a desire to contribute to the global adoption of analytics tools such as Power BI within the organization. As an intern, you will work with our Business Facing BI team at our Headquarters in Amsterdam-Zuid, the Netherlands. The internship will begin in September 2024.

About Coty

We‚Äôre Coty, one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, and skin and body care. Coty is the global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics. Coty‚Äôs products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. Coty and its brands are committed to a range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment.

About

About the Business Facing BI Team in Amsterdam

The Business Facing BI team plays a pivotal role in implementing a variety of business intelligence and data analytics solutions to enable data-driven decision-making globally. Despite our small size, we are a diverse team with bases in both Amsterdam and New York City. We are committed to continuous learning and the adoption of cutting-edge technologies in the data space, cultivating a dynamic work environment where innovation propels Coty‚Äôs success through insightful data analysis.

What We Offer

At Coty, we offer an exceptional opportunity for our Global BI & Analytics intern to gain hands-on experience specifically with Power BI in a vibrant and dynamic environment. This internship provides exposure to complex BI projects utilizing Power BI, enabling significant business transformations. The intern will receive direct mentorship from the Business Facing Power BI Manager, fostering both personal and professional growth. Additionally, you'll benefit from an inclusive, supportive work environment that encourages collaboration and innovation with Power BI at its core. This is a unique chance to deepen your expertise in a key BI tool and to network with global professionals, potentially opening doors for future opportunities within the industry.

Requirements


Student (Bachelor/Master), it is important that you remain enrolled with your university.
Demonstrated passion for data and an interest in specializing in Power BI.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency with numbers.
Familiarity with data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, and R is highly advantageous.
Keen eye for detail to ensure high-quality, aesthetically pleasing outputs.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English


Period

This internship is full-time (40 hours per week), for a duration of 5-6 months and starts from August/September 2024. Remote working is possible up to 50% of your time, in alignment with your line manager. You will receive an internship allowance and NS Business Card if you do not have a student public transport card. The internship can be combined with a thesis but be aware that this will largely have to be done in your own time.

Interested?

At Coty, we believe in equality and inclusion for all, and stand together with those fighting for freedom, justice, and equal rights regardless of who you are or who you love.

Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you‚Äôre the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible ‚Äì we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Please send us your motivation letter together with your CV, stating your availability and for how long.

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Ervaring: 4+ jaar

Salaris: vanaf ‚Ç¨ 3.526

Uren: 32-40 uur

Locatie: bij de klant, Ciratum HQ en/of thuis



Data, data en nog meer data

Onze klanten hebben en werken met data, veeeeeeeel data. Veel van deze data zit verstopt en blijft hiermee ongebruikt. Best zonde vind je niet? Aan jou om die data uit de krochten van de systemen te trekken en op zoek te gaan naar mogelijkheden om deze data in te zetten om de business (nog) beter te maken. Je gaat als het ware op zoek naar de schatten in deze verzameling aan data. Concreet kan je denken aan het verzamelen en structuren van data, het controleren en het verwerken van data waarbij je deze omzet naar informatie.


Naast dat je onze klanten helpt om meer datagedreven te werken, ga je meebouwen aan onze IT-tak. Beter gezegd, hoe wij onze kennis en expertise op het gebied van data analyse verder kunnen uitbreiden; intern en extern. Met elkaar ga je uitvinden wat jullie willen leren en hoe jullie dit gaan doen. Je neemt hierin de trekkende rol op je en vindt het leuk om onze junioren hierin mee te nemen.



Wie ben jij?

  • Je vindt het leuk om te werken met grote data sets en het uitvoeren van analyses;
  • Je hebt ervaring met Python, PowerBI, Azure en/of AWS;
  • Je houdt van het delen van je kennis, maar wil ook graag nieuwe dingen leren;
  • Je wilt graag meebouwen aan onze IT start-up;
  • Je bent op zoek naar een club collega‚Äôs waar aandacht, binding en betrokkenheid centraal staat.



Wat krijg je van ons?

  • Salaris vanaf ‚Ç¨ 3.526 (o.b.v. 40 uur) afhankelijk van jouw kennis ervaring;
  • Elektrische leaseauto, opleidingsbudget, team- en samenwerkdagen en andere leuke uitjes;
  • De mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen met behulp van o.a. leerpaden, opleidingen en een coach-consultant;
  • Starten wanneer jij wil, maar hoe eerder, hoe beter.



Great Place To Work

W√©er een keurmerk? Dacht het niet, want een Great Place To Work word je niet zomaar. Sinds 2020 zijn wij een Great Place To Work-Certified en daar zijn wij natuurlijk super trots op! Door deze certificering weten wij dat onze collega‚Äôs met trots, plezier en vertrouwen aan ‚Äôt werk gaan. Zo vindt 96% van onze collega‚Äôs Ciratum alles overziend een Great Place To Work. Middels dit onderzoek weten wij precies wat er speelt. The good and the bad. En dat is ok√©, want zo kunnen wij dagelijks hard werken aan onze organisatiecultuur. Zo bouwen wij samen verder üß°.



#samenverder?

Als jouw datahart sneller is gaan kloppen na het lezen van deze vacature, kunnen wij maar √©√©n ding zeggen: solliciteer! Heb je toch nog wat vragen? Jo√´lle beantwoordt ze graag. Ze is te bereiken via werkenbij@ciratum.nl.

Title: Customer Intelligence Analyst
Description:
RetailSonar is a fast-growing SAAS company specializing in geomarketing for large retail and service companies. RetailSonar has offices already in 4 countries (Belgium, The Netherlands, France, Germany) and is technologically readiness for further scaling up toward European market leadership. Therefore we are looking for a Customer Intelligence Analyst to join our colleagues in the Dutch office in Utrecht.




Our unique RetailSonar platform is fed by state of the art AI technology and up-to-date marketdata, which is the base of our very accurate performance prediction.

RetailSonar is looking for suitable Dutch candidates to join its existing team of Customer Intelligence Analysts.




Your future colleagues have a great affinity with big data, data processing and predictive modelling. Our employees are true multitaskers: they work simultaneously on multiple projects at major retailers and service providers.




Your responsibilities:

Your daily tasks include validating and analysing customer data, platform configuration and building powerful predictive models.
You maintain frequent contact with the customers you work for.
Customer satisfaction is our number one priority. We achieve this by delivering high-quality end results and going the extra mile. Our analysts rise to any challenge and dare to think out-of-the-box.




Moreover, our employees are real team players: together, they always succeed in communicating the most important conclusions and insights to the client in a structured manner. Constructive feedback is important to us and we help each other to get the best out of ourselves. Every day again!




About you:

Preferably, you hold an master's degree in technical/economical or business area which is complemented by a master's degree in data technology (e.g. Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Informatics)
A first experience in a data driven position is a strong plus
You have a sharp, analytical mind
You have a passion for data processing (SQL, Excel, Access, SAS, ...)
You have enough courage, enthusiasm, persuasiveness and a corresponding language skill (NL-EN) to speak to the highest management at our (international) customers
A strong backbone that enables you to transform stressful situations into positive energy
A real team player who can also work well independently




What we have to offer:




A varied position with a steep and challenging learning curve in a particularly innovative and extremely exciting field within retail: geomarketing & customer intelligence.
A competitive salary package that is topped off every semester by a team bonus and individual bonus that encourage you to get the most out of yourself and your team.
The opportunity to be part of a young, close-knit and highly driven international team that enthusiastically builds successful, ground-breaking solutions.
A committed and personal organisation that values a good work-life balance.
A very personal coaching program that offers you ample opportunity to further explore your own interests.
The opportunity to work with executives and experts from the largest retail companies and governments. The ideal way to broaden your world.
Regular team events and trips to Belgium and beyond.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Consultant: werken als Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Bi Consultant of Data Scientist?




Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging met afwisseling √©n een goede werk-priv√©balans? Dan zou Datamo wel eens de plek voor jou kunnen zijn! Bij Datamo haal je het beste uit jezelf door veel kennis en ervaring op te doen bij toonaangevende organisaties. Samen met jou stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, zodat je specifieke expertise kunt opdoen en de gewenste opleidingen kunt volgen.




Ontvang bij Datamo een compleet pakket, zoals een salaris tot ‚Ç¨ 7.000 bruto per maand, jaarlijks 35 vrij op te nemen dagen, en bepaal zelf hoe je naar je opdrachtgevers reist met behulp van een mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor eigen vervoer of een leaseauto (zoals een Tesla Model 3).




De functie

Als Data Consultant bij Datamo krijg je de kans om jouw talenten te benutten en waardevolle ervaring op te doen bij diverse spraakmakende opdrachtgevers als financi√´le instellingen zoals de ING of overheidsorganisaties zoals ministeries of overige organisaties zoals KLM, NS en nog veel meer. Bij Datamo werk je op projectbasis, van 3 maanden tot 1 jaar, of indien gewenst zelfs langer. Je werkt in diverse rollen, zoals Data Engineer, Data Analyst of Data Scientist, afhankelijk van jouw voorkeur, ervaring en expertise. Voor wat jouw specifieke opdracht betreft zullen wij verschillende keuzes aan je voorleggen. Jij bepaalt uiteindelijk helemaal zelf welke opdracht je gaat uitvoeren, want wij willen niets liever dan dat jij op een plek zit die helemaal bij je past




Jouw taken

Het exacte takenpakket hangt volledig af van de opdracht die je gaat vervullen en natuurlijk ook van de organisatie waarvoor je aan de slag gaat.




Onderstaande taken kun je onder andere verwachten bij verschillende rollen als Data Consultant:

‚Ä¢ Data analyseren om belangrijke patronen en trends te ontdekken

‚Ä¢ Data Clustering, Data Mining en Data Visualisatie.

‚Ä¢ Gesprekspartner zijn voor eindgebruikers om visualisaties optimaal te maken

‚Ä¢ Data integreren voor het optimaliseren van analyses.

‚Ä¢ Advies verstrekken over het effectief gebruiken van data voor besluitvorming.

‚Ä¢ Rapporten opstellen om complexe data inzichtelijk te maken voor collega‚Äôs.

‚Ä¢ Het ontwikkelen van producten en innovatieve modellen goed laten samengaan met software-oplossingen.




Wie zoeken wij?

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste en leergierige collega die het leuk vindt projectmatig ervaring op te doen in diverse branches, organisaties en functies. Daarnaast:

Heb je minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring.
Ben je in het bezit van een hbo-/wo-diploma.
Ben je in staat goede relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden met onze opdrachtgevers.
Weet jij wel raad met Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, Power BI (Tableau, Qlik), SQL, Excel en Azure/AWS.
Beschik je over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Heb je een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (schrijven en spreken).




Wat kun je verwachten van Datamo?

Datamo is onderdeel van de grotere ‚ÄòThuis van‚Äô-formule, wat betekent dat je onderdeel bent van een grotere organisatie bestaande uit 75 collega‚Äôs, die werkzaam zijn bij Datamo (Data Specialisten), Entrador (Business Analisten), Specktor (Product Owners) en Strates (Roostersoftware Specialisten). Onderling delen we kennis en netwerk met elkaar. Allen met dezelfde normen en waarden: het cre√´ren van een thuisgevoel, het beste uit iedereen halen door jou zo goed mogelijk te faciliteren.




Datamo is een platte organisatie, je vindt bij ons geen onnodige directie of managementlagen, maar wel korte communicatielijnen. Jouw potentieel en geluk staan centraal, en wij willen jou daar graag in ondersteunen. Je bent bij ons zeker geen nummer, maar wel een hele belangrijke collega!

En laten we eerlijk zijn, bij Datamo wordt ‚Äúdata crunchen‚Äù ineens een stuk gezelliger. We combineren vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling met sociale activiteiten, zodat je niet alleen groeit in je vakgebied, maar ook in je connecties binnen het team. We organiseren regelmatig groepsactiviteiten waarbij geldt dat je niet moet, maar mag deelnemen!

Last but not least‚Ä¶ Bij Datamo is de balans tussen werk en priv√© erg belangrijk. Niet voor niets geven we je 35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar en overwerken staat niet in ons vocabulaire.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een uitstekend salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨ 4.500 en ‚Ç¨ 7.000 bruto per maand bestaande uit een vast en een variabel component;
35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar;
Een meer dan goede pensioenregeling;
Mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor flexibel zakelijk vervoer: NS, fiets, taxi, Uber, deelauto, je eigen auto etc. en/of te besteden voor een eigen leaseauto.
Een MacBook Air;
Een maandelijkse telefoonvergoeding;
Gezellige uitjes, georganiseerd door en voor Datamo collega‚Äôs!
Waardevolle (in-house) trainings- en kennissessies;
Goede opleidingsmogelijkheden, ‚Äò‚Äôthe sky is the limit‚Äô‚Äô;
Meerdere interessante bonusregelingen voor bijvoorbeeld het aandragen van nieuwe collega‚Äôs.
Een fijne werkplek in ons monumentale pand in het centrum van het mooie Amersfoort.




Enthousiast geworden?

Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Solliciteer nu en haal alles uit jouw carri√®re met interessante projecten en kansen om je vaardigheden te ontwikkelen!

Wil je eerst vrijblijvend met een van je toekomstige collega‚Äôs praten over waarom je bij Datamo zou willen werken en wat zij doen qua opdrachten? Dat kan natuurlijk ook! We brengen je graag in contact!.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Je nieuwe baan

Wat ga je allemaal doen?

As a Data Analyst at Schenk Tanktransport, you will play a key role in the digital transformation of our company. In this position, you are responsible for unlocking, analyzing, and visualizing data, elevating our business operations to the next level. You work at the intersection of Business Intelligence, IT, and various business units such as Operations, HR, and Finance. You report directly to the Business Intelligence Manager and help shape our data strategy. Your analyses and reports form the basis for strategic decisions and process optimizations. You ensure a structured approach to our data flows and prepare us for a future where data plays an increasingly important role.



Creating and optimizing data structures: You build and improve data structures that are usable across the organization
Data modeling: You model data to support strategic, operational, and financial decision-making
Data visualization: You create dynamic and insightful reports with Power BI that are essential for management and the business



Wat we jou bieden

As a Data Analyst at Schenk Tanktransport, located in a dynamic environment, we offer you a challenging role where you can make a direct impact on our business processes. You will be working in an innovative company that invests in technology and innovation. Besides an inspiring workplace, we offer you an attractive salary package that matches your experience and expertise. We understand that good employment conditions contribute to your job satisfaction and personal development. Therefore, we are committed to creating an environment where you can grow and excel.



You will have an attractive salary between EUR 4,300 and EUR 5,500, based on your knowledge and experience
You benefit from an attractive bonus scheme
You will have access to extensive training opportunities
You will receive 27.5 vacation days and 8% holiday allowance
You will receive an excellent pension plan through Zwitserleven
Transport cost coverage
Hybrid work environment



Become part of our innovative team and help shape the future of Schenk Tanktransport with your expertise in data analysis!

Wat we van jou verwachten

To be successful as a Data Analyst at Schenk Tanktransport, you should be well-versed in the world of Microsoft Business Intelligence tools such as Azure Data Factory, and you have a strong foundation in SQL. Your analytical skills enable you to understand complex issues and provide actionable insights. You are proactive, enjoy collaborating with diverse teams, and have excellent communication skills to clearly share your findings with stakeholders.



You have a completed bachelor's or master's degree in Business, Analytics, Economics, Computer Science, or a relevant field
At least 5 years of experience as a data analyst or in a similar role
Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Business Intelligence tools, SQL and Experience with data visualization and modeling Power BI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, curiosity, and proactivity. Excellent collaboration and communication skills, project management skills, and the ability to manage multiple tasks
Experience with security and access management in Azure and Power BI is a plus. Knowledge of SharePoint is an advantage

Title: Junior Data Analist, Den Haag
HTML:
Als Junior Data / Informatie Analist kom je te werken bij een overheidsinstantie die de kernwaarden van de democratie hoog in het vaandel heeft en sterk nastreeft. Daarnaast staat deze organisatie voor een vaardig en sterk openbaar bestuur en een overheid waar burgers op kunnen vertrouwen. Zij leveren hun bijdrage aan het kunnen wonen in betaalbare, veilige en energiezuinige woningen in een buurt waar ieder individu meetelt en meedoet.

Binnen deze organisatie wordt er gewerkt aan verschillende dataprojecten. Zowel voor de interne bedrijfsvoering als voor extern gebruik. De komst van de ‚ÄòData Community‚Äô binnen deze organisatie, vormt de verbindende factor tussen de verschillende dataprojecten die worden uitgevoerd.

Deze rol is eveneens mogelijk op interim basis.

Standplaats

Den Haag, op kantoor en gedeeltelijk hybride vanuit huis.

Salaris

Salarisindicatie van ‚Ç¨3.000,- tot ‚Ç¨3.500,- bruto per maand. Afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring, met kans om door te groeien.

Wij zoeken

  • Je bent in het bezit van een hbo-diploma;
  • Je hebt minimaal 1+ jaar werkervaring als Data / Informatie Analist (stage voldoet ook);
  • Je hebt kennis van- en ervaring met Python, SQL, Power BI, Tableau en Excel;
  • Je bent woonachtig in Nederland;
  • Je hebt uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.

Wij bieden

  • Een maand proeftijd;
  • 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Pensioen;
  • ‚Ç¨50,- bruto onkostenvergoeding per maand;
  • Opleidingsbudget;
  • 25 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime dienstverband;
  • Eigen laptop;
  • Abonnementsvergoeding mobiele telefoon;

Als Junior Data / Informatie Analist zal je jouw werkzaamheden, in samenwerking, gaan uitvoeren binnen een team dat bestaat uit diverse data specialisten. Dit zijn ervaren professionals waar jij als junior/starter heel veel van kan leren!

Jij zal je bezig gaan houden met het uitvoeren van verschillende taken en onderwerpen omtrent data (-analyse). Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het analyseren van processen en systemen en het uitzetten en opvolgen van acties t.b.v. procesoptimalisatie. Of het uitwerken, afstemmen en implementeren van verbeterinitiatieven om knelpunten op te lossen, de operatie te versnellen/vereenvoudigen en risico‚Äôs te verminderen.

Ben jij klaar om aan het begin van je carri√®re de uitdaging aan te gaan bij een grote overheidsinstantie, waar je naast het opdoen van (werk-)ervaring, ook de mogelijkheid krijgt om veel te kunnen leren van ervaren dataspecialisten? Ga als starter aan de slag bij de overheid!

Reageer direct!

Ben je enthousiast geworden over de functie Junior Data / Informatie Analist? Graag ontvangen we je motivatiebrief en cv. Je kunt deze sturen via de button "Solliciteer nu" op deze pagina.. Voor meer informatie kun je bellen naar Masora Lilipaly, bereikbaar op 020-2117610.

Functie-voorstel

Als Junior Data / Informatie Analist zal je jouw werkzaamheden, in samenwerking, gaan uitvoeren binnen een team dat bestaat uit diverse data specialisten. Dit zijn ervaren professionals waar jij als junior/starter heel veel van kan leren!

Jij zal je bezig gaan houden met het uitvoeren van verschillende taken en onderwerpen omtrent data (-analyse). Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het analyseren van processen en systemen en het uitzetten en opvolgen van acties t.b.v. procesoptimalisatie. Of het uitwerken, afstemmen en implementeren van verbeterinitiatieven om knelpunten op te lossen, de operatie te versnellen/vereenvoudigen en risico‚Äôs te verminderen.

Ben jij klaar om aan het begin van je carri√®re de uitdaging aan te gaan bij een grote overheidsinstantie, waar je naast het opdoen van (werk-)ervaring, ook de mogelijkheid krijgt om veel te kunnen leren van ervaren dataspecialisten? Ga als starter aan de slag bij de overheid!

Reageer direct!

Title: Data Engineer / Analyst
Description:
Job Description: Data Engineer/Analyst

Location: Amsterdam

Type: Freelance

Duration: 1 Year




Responsibilities:

Develop and manage backend data pipelines.
Build and maintain dashboards in Google BigQuery and Looker.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements.
Optimize data workflows using Airflow.
Ensure code quality and version control with Git.
Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines using CircleCI.
Utilize dbt for data transformation and modeling.




Required Skills:

Proficiency in Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Experience with Apache Airflow.
Strong knowledge of Git.
Familiarity with dbt for data modeling.
Experience with CircleCI for continuous integration and deployment.
Proficient in Google BigQuery and SQL.
Experience with Looker for data visualization and dashboard creation.




Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Engineer and Analyst.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Ability to work independently in a freelance capacity.

Title: Financial Intelligence Specialist - Power BI
Description:
SystemsAccountants is currently recruiting a Financial Intelligence Specialist to join a tech start-up based close Amsterdam.




The employing company has created a business intelligence solution that links powerful performance management tooling with PowerBI, that help optimise reporting and dashboarding capabilities. Since it recently established, the organisation is now in 16 countries delivering solutions to nearly 40 clients.




The role offers hybrid working; international projects; the opportunity to work in cutting edge financial intelligence technology; as well as career growth in a fast growing international business.

Potential candidates should apply if they have:




Expert user of Power BI (2 plus years)
A strong understanding of finance and accounting process.
An analytical mindset and the potential to grow into a business consultancy role.
Dutch speaking is a preference.
Interest in technology, ideally with exposure to BI, reporting, dashboarding or analytics related tooling




For more information on this and other financial systems. data or analytics roles, please contact Johnny@systemsaccountants.com

Title: Investment Data Analyst
HTML:
Skill Farm Members are invited to apply for the following role:

Responsibilities:

Collecting, validating and delivering accurate and timely market data throughout the bank to value trading positions such as Interest Rate or FX derivatives, commodity and credit products;

Discussing with traders in hubs such as Hong Kong, London, New York or Sao Paulo what the best setup for their valuation instrument is;

Looking for continuous improvements of processes by automation or simplification.

You drive change in the team by focusing on implementing new technology that can help make our processes more efficient.

Skills & Qualifications:

You hold a master's degree with a focus on Finance, Economics or Econometrics or a degree in another discipline but with a keen interest in the financial sector;

You can demonstrate your knowledge on financial products that are valued at fair value;

You have a tangible interest in IT related systems and processes;

You have a tangible interest in the management of data

You are able to clearly express your ideas in English both orally and in written form;

CFA, FRM, PRM or equivalent is considered an asset or willingness to work towards one;

Optimaliseren van bestelalgoritmen en voorraadbeheer.

Het bedrijf is een snelgroeiende webshop in telefoonhoesjes en accessoires, gevestigd in een ruim en gezellig pand. Je wordt onderdeel van een team van 25 enthousiaste medewerkers die samen streven naar effici√´ntie en kwaliteit.

Title: Data Analyst .
HTML:
What are you going to do?

As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Analytics Team. This team works with development teams to provide overviews of the various applications hosted within the Nedap Tech Platform, advises them on specific insights gained from the data analysis and visualisations created, and focuses on the operability of the platform. To do this, we work with the teams and business unit management (e.g. BU leads, tribe leads, developers) to ensure that the platform supports their needs and requirements and removes complexity.

Your passion for complex datasets and ability to transform this into actionable insights play a crucial role in supporting the organisation's data processing and analytics needs.

Responsibilities

 Your responsibilities

  • Use monitoring tools such as Datadog to ensure the performance, reliability and availability of data pipelines;
  • Helping teams identify and address bottlenecks, performance issues and optimise data processing workflows;
  • Visualising dashboards to quickly understand running applications, highlight risk areas and provide detailed information for deployment and support teams during upgrades;
  • Helping teams gain insight into their applications and how to make best use of available data;
  • Collaborate with development teams to understand the application and what can be seen as critical support information;
  • Collaborate with support teams to understand recurring issues and workflows;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements;
  • Provide technical expertise and guidance to team members on data analytics best practices;
  • Share knowledge by giving demos and workshops to the various teams;
  • Have the opportunity to grow into AI and Machine Learning skills in the future as the team expands in this area.

Your team

The Nedap Tech Platform focuses on supporting development teams within the Nedap business units with all aspects of the software development process such as tooling, frameworks, deployment and insights. We believe that combining the various domains into a cohesive product offers development teams a seamless experience, allowing them to focus on what matters most to them: delivering business value.

You will join our Analytics Team. This is a small and enthusiastic team which is currently still in its start-up phase. As a result, there is plenty of room for your own input and there are plenty of career opportunities in the future towards roles such as, for example, data engineer, data scientist or machine learning specialist. These experienced and enthusiastic data fanatics understand better than anyone that data must first be turned into information, are happy to provide advice and thus enable the Nedap business units and their teams to quickly gain insight into any application and/or proposition.

Our offer

As a Data Analyst at Nedap, you will make a valuable contribution to our goal: making people happier and more successful in their professional lives. In addition to your salary, you are entitled to a thirteenth month, a good pension scheme, and profit sharing with the opportunity to become a shareholder of Nedap. At Nedap, everything revolves around trust and autonomy. You determine your own working hours and vacation days. We also highly value personal and professional growth. You will receive a comprehensive introduction, and we encourage you to continuously develop yourself.

Curious about all our terms of employment? Read more here .

Required

 Required experience and skills

For you as a Data Analyst, it is important to be able to see the big picture. You will be in contact with different development teams, each with their own challenges. This means you must have excellent problem-solving and communication skills and be able to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Furthermore, you recognise yourself in the following:

  • You have 3-5 years' experience as a Data Analyst or in similar roles such as BI Developer, Data Engineer and Data Specialist;
  • You have mastered the Python language and have applied it within the context of data analysis;
  • You have experience in a communicative role, where you have experience with various stakeholders and/or internal customers;
  • You have experience in building reports and dashboards.
  • You have a good command of the Dutch language.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bynder goes far beyond managing digital assets. Our digital asset management platform enables teams to conquer the chaos of proliferating content, touchpoints, and relationships in order to thrive.

With powerful and intuitive solutions that embrace the way people want to work, and a richly integrated ecosystem, We are the brand ally that unifies and transforms the creation and sharing of assets, inspiring teams, delighting customers, and elevating businesses.

Our 500+ employees, known as ‚ÄòByndies‚Äô, together constitute the world‚Äôs most extensive pool of digital asset management expertise. We enable more than 1.7M users across more than 3,700 organizations, including Spotify, Puma, Five Guys and Icelandair.

Founded in 2013, we have eight offices around the globe, including the Netherlands, USA, Spain, UK, Australia and UAE. For more information, visit www.bynder.com.

Bynder's Internal Analytics platform is essential for streamlining our product and business growth by providing best-in-class data and insights to our stakeholders precisely when they need it. We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst who will contribute to the technical and analytical efforts of our team, ensuring data-driven decisions and solutions.

Responsibilities

Data Analysis: Conduct thorough data analysis to extract meaningful insights, identify trends, and support decision-making processes across the organization.

Product Analytics: Conduct in-depth product analytics to identify key trends, user behaviors, and areas for improvement. Collaborate with product teams to drive data-informed decisions and enhance overall product performance.

Report Generation: Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations using tools like DBT, Snowflake, and ThoughtSpot to provide stakeholders with actionable insights.

Collaboration: Work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value. Collaborate with other teams in Bynder‚Äôs Data Group to ensure data consistency and accuracy.

Technical Contribution: Utilize your technical skills to manage and manipulate large datasets, ensuring data quality and integrity. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and tools to continuously improve our data practices.

Qualifications

Experience: Minimum of 3 years in data analytics, with hands-on experience in analyzing and interpreting complex data sets.

Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and Python is essential. Experience in DBT, data warehouses (e.g. Snowflake) or machine learning is a plus.

Communication: Strong communication skills to effectively convey insights and collaborate with team members and stakeholders.

Collaboration: Demonstrated ability to work with internal stakeholders and engineers to deliver exceptional outputs.

Join us to leverage your analytical expertise to drive Bynder‚Äôs growth through data and analytics. If you have a passion for data and an aptitude for technical problem-solving, we want to hear from you!

Why you'll love Bynder!

At Bynder, innovation is in our DNA. We've worked hard to build an environment that promotes creative thinking and self-initiative within a culture of fun. It‚Äôs common to find colleagues hanging out after work - if you believe in "be nice, work hard, have fun", you'll have an office full of friends.

What we have:


Challenging and inspiring work environment
Flat hierarchy where your voice will be truly heard
Opportunity to initiate your own projects
An experienced team is ready to welcome you anytime
Unlimited vacation policy
Competitive monthly compensation
Apple gear
Daily lunch
Drinks at the Bynder Bar :-)
Amazing office in the heart of Amsterdam



Our Commitment:

Bynder Love is the principle that guides the way we grow our teams, support our employees, and celebrate our differences. At Bynder we strive to create a culture that embraces every Byndie because differences in background, experience, and perspective make Bynder even better. At Bynder a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace is one where all employees, whatever their ethnicity, color, sex, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or physical and mental ability are valued and respected. Our commitment is for all Byndies to have the freedom to be their true authentic selves.

Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder‚Äôs commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.

Just as we are never finished innovating, Bynder‚Äôs commitment to being An Even Better Bynder is a constant, evolving commitment that includes education, listening, and action.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
For our client, we are looking for a Senior Consultant Data & Analytics.




As a Senior Consultant in our Data & Analytics team, your role will be part technical guru and part communication expert. We are looking for an experienced data analytics professional with 3-5 years previous experience in similar roles.




Your role will be very diverse:

Data Analysis: You'll employ your analytical skills to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets. Your ability to see beyond numbers and identify trends will play a crucial role in driving strategic decisions.
Technical Liaison: With an ability to converse fluently with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, you'll act as the translator between business needs and data solutions. One moment you might be deep in data modelling discussions, and the next explaining its implications to a business executive. You have to like translating business requirements into actionable and effective technical strategies that align with company objectives!
Visual Storyteller: Your knack for clear visualization will transform raw data into understandable narratives that drive informed decision-making processes.
Technical Mastery: Proficiency in at least two of the following coding languages/tools is expected: SQL, Alteryx, Celonis, PowerBI/Tableau, Python, Databricks. Experience with SAP is also a pre - we need someone who can navigate these tools and platforms like their hometown!
Mentorship Role: As a senior consultant, your experience will not only contribute to project and client success but also guide junior consultants on their journey towards becoming seasoned professionals.




Ideal candidates are those with robust technical skills complemented by stellar communication abilities - because effective data analysis isn't just about number crunching; it's about making those numbers speak to everyone regardless of their background or expertise level.




We would love to hear from you if:

You are passionate about leveraging data to drive decision-making, enjoy collaborating across teams and love being part of an organization that values curiosity, learning and growth.
You have a Bachelor or Master Degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a comparable discipline. Applicants with a Business Administration or related degree should have prior experience in data analysis work.
You have 3-5 years experience as a data analyst, data scientist, data consultant or any related area.
You are great working with at least two of these coding languages/tools: SQL, Alteryx, Celonis, PowerBI/Tableau, Python, Databricks. SAP knowledge is a pre.
You have 2+ years of experience with actively facilitating client meetings, conducting workshops and presentations.
You have great communication and presentation capabilities and are adept at simplifying complex data insights for audiences without a technical background.
You are able to communicate (speak and write) in the Dutch and English language.




This opportunity promises challenges that stimulate, colleagues who inspire and a career path full of potential milestones (and certainly some fun along the way too!).

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Are you interested in joining one of the most data-rich environments in The Netherlands? KLM, having carried over 93 million passengers in 2023, provides direct flights to over 160 destinations and boasts a loyal frequent flyer customer base of over 16 million. The KLM Digital Marketing department operates across 70 countries, driving traffic, bookings, and revenue on KLM.com. This offers a vast landscape for skill application, personal growth, and learning opportunities.

As a Global Marketing Data Analyst, you will join the Quantitative Marketing team, a highly motivated group focused on optimizing the customer journey, assessing the value of various channels (such as search, email, display), and tackling a wide range of data-related topics.

What will you do?


Power up our marketing insights: Take charge of conceptualizing, coordinating, and initiating the creation of visually stunning and actionable dashboards that unlock the potential of our data.
Be the data champion: Set up and own end-to-end data pipelines for marketing sources, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of all relevant data.
Unleash the power of analytics: Implement strategic tagging on klm.com to capture valuable data within our Customer Data Platform (CDP) and cutting-edge marketing platforms. Your expertise will drive effective targeting and personalized experiences.
Chart the path to success: Collaborate with marketing teams to develop robust strategies for performance measurement, leveraging first-party tracking and attribution methodologies.
Connect the dots: Build a cohesive and harmonized marketing data landscape across various tools, channels, and teams. Your expertise will ensure seamless integration, unlocking valuable insights and driving data-informed decisions.
Analytics ally: Be the trusted analyst of choice for colleagues seeking analytical support. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, providing expert guidance and delivering data-driven solutions that fuel growth and innovation.


Where do you land?

As a part of KLM's Digital Marketing department, you will be an integral member of the Quantitative Marketing team. In this position, you will collaborate with data scientists and data engineers, fostering close partnerships with teams responsible for different online marketing channels, campaign management, and digital product development. Additionally, you will engage with stakeholders beyond the department. Reporting to the Head of Quantitative Marketing, you will work together to oversee the roadmap with the shared goal of enhancing data-driven decision-making capabilities.

Your profile

Tell you what to do? We prefer not to! Your passion lies in discovering how things work, and you excel at it. Moreover, you possess a remarkable talent for swiftly identifying opportunities for improvement. When it comes to discussions with colleagues, you actively engage to maximize your work and enhance the customer experience. Working proactively and independently on your tasks is second nature to you.

You Also Have The Following


Academic excellence: We prefer candidates with an academic thinking and working level, ideally holding a university degree in business (analytics), marketing, economics, or a comparable field.
SQL proficiency: Experience in writing SQL queries is essential for this role. Your ability to extract and manipulate data will be crucial in uncovering valuable insights.
Affinity with online marketing: A strong interest and understanding of online marketing concepts will enable you to effectively contribute to marketing strategies and campaigns.
Data tools and cloud platforms: Experience with data tools and working with cloud platforms is highly desirable. Familiarity with platforms such as Google Cloud will give you a head start.
Visualization skills: Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau will allow you to transform complex data sets into visually compelling and easy-to-understand dashboards.
Project management experience: While not mandatory, previous experience in project management will be advantageous as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute and deliver on various projects.
Programming knowledge: Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R will be beneficial in manipulating and analyzing large datasets.
Google Analytics (or similar): Knowledge of web analytics tools like Google Analytics is preferred. Understanding user behavior and tracking campaign performance will be an asset in this role.


What Do We Offer


A challenging role at an unique employer in the Netherlands;
A gross salary between ‚Ç¨3.712,92 and ‚Ç¨5.304,17 per month;
Plenty of room for personal development and wonderful career opportunities;
A good pension scheme and 8 percent holiday pay;
An end of the year bonus of 8,33%;
25 days of paid holiday and 5 extra days off;
Great discounts on airline tickets (if you have been in service for at least 6 months);
A travel expenses scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol;
Discount of your health insurance;
A personal budget for sustainable employability.


Ready for your next destination?

Don‚Äôt wait any longer and apply for this function before the final boarding call on 07/26/2024! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks, you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and ‚Äìpossibly- an assessment and security research.Did you know that according to research, women are less likely to apply than men when they don't meet all the job requirements? What a shame. Because, in our view, 'the perfect candidate' is a myth. So, if you have the drive to grow in aspects of this role, we look forward to your application. A file check (for ex-KLM-employees) and/or a reference check can be part of the application procedure. By applying for this vacancy you consent to these checks.
Show more
HTML:
Are you interested in joining one of the most data-rich environments in The Netherlands? KLM, having carried over 93 million passengers in 2023, provides direct flights to over 160 destinations and boasts a loyal frequent flyer customer base of over 16 million. The KLM Digital Marketing department operates across 70 countries, driving traffic, bookings, and revenue on KLM.com. This offers a vast landscape for skill application, personal growth, and learning opportunities.

As a Global Marketing Data Analyst, you will join the Quantitative Marketing team, a highly motivated group focused on optimizing the customer journey, assessing the value of various channels (such as search, email, display), and tackling a wide range of data-related topics.

What will you do?

  • Power up our marketing insights: Take charge of conceptualizing, coordinating, and initiating the creation of visually stunning and actionable dashboards that unlock the potential of our data.
  • Be the data champion: Set up and own end-to-end data pipelines for marketing sources, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of all relevant data.
  • Unleash the power of analytics: Implement strategic tagging on klm.com to capture valuable data within our Customer Data Platform (CDP) and cutting-edge marketing platforms. Your expertise will drive effective targeting and personalized experiences.
  • Chart the path to success: Collaborate with marketing teams to develop robust strategies for performance measurement, leveraging first-party tracking and attribution methodologies.
  • Connect the dots: Build a cohesive and harmonized marketing data landscape across various tools, channels, and teams. Your expertise will ensure seamless integration, unlocking valuable insights and driving data-informed decisions.
  • Analytics ally: Be the trusted analyst of choice for colleagues seeking analytical support. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, providing expert guidance and delivering data-driven solutions that fuel growth and innovation.

Where do you land?

As a part of KLM's Digital Marketing department, you will be an integral member of the Quantitative Marketing team. In this position, you will collaborate with data scientists and data engineers, fostering close partnerships with teams responsible for different online marketing channels, campaign management, and digital product development. Additionally, you will engage with stakeholders beyond the department. Reporting to the Head of Quantitative Marketing, you will work together to oversee the roadmap with the shared goal of enhancing data-driven decision-making capabilities.

Your profile

Tell you what to do? We prefer not to! Your passion lies in discovering how things work, and you excel at it. Moreover, you possess a remarkable talent for swiftly identifying opportunities for improvement. When it comes to discussions with colleagues, you actively engage to maximize your work and enhance the customer experience. Working proactively and independently on your tasks is second nature to you.

You Also Have The Following

  • Academic excellence: We prefer candidates with an academic thinking and working level, ideally holding a university degree in business (analytics), marketing, economics, or a comparable field.
  • SQL proficiency: Experience in writing SQL queries is essential for this role. Your ability to extract and manipulate data will be crucial in uncovering valuable insights.
  • Affinity with online marketing: A strong interest and understanding of online marketing concepts will enable you to effectively contribute to marketing strategies and campaigns.
  • Data tools and cloud platforms: Experience with data tools and working with cloud platforms is highly desirable. Familiarity with platforms such as Google Cloud will give you a head start.
  • Visualization skills: Proficiency in visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau will allow you to transform complex data sets into visually compelling and easy-to-understand dashboards.
  • Project management experience: While not mandatory, previous experience in project management will be advantageous as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute and deliver on various projects.
  • Programming knowledge: Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R will be beneficial in manipulating and analyzing large datasets.
  • Google Analytics (or similar): Knowledge of web analytics tools like Google Analytics is preferred. Understanding user behavior and tracking campaign performance will be an asset in this role.

What Do We Offer

  • A challenging role at an unique employer in the Netherlands;
  • A gross salary between ‚Ç¨3.712,92 and ‚Ç¨5.304,17 per month;
  • Plenty of room for personal development and wonderful career opportunities;
  • A good pension scheme and 8 percent holiday pay;
  • An end of the year bonus of 8,33%;
  • 25 days of paid holiday and 5 extra days off;
  • Great discounts on airline tickets (if you have been in service for at least 6 months);
  • A travel expenses scheme and free use of the bus network around Schiphol;
  • Discount of your health insurance;
  • A personal budget for sustainable employability.

Ready for your next destination?

Don‚Äôt wait any longer and apply for this function before the final boarding call on 07/26/2024! A motivation letter is no longer required; we will simply ask you a couple of questions during your online application. Within two weeks, you will receive a message from us. Your application procedure consists of two interviews and ‚Äìpossibly- an assessment and security research.Did you know that according to research, women are less likely to apply than men when they don't meet all the job requirements? What a shame. Because, in our view, 'the perfect candidate' is a myth. So, if you have the drive to grow in aspects of this role, we look forward to your application. A file check (for ex-KLM-employees) and/or a reference check can be part of the application procedure. By applying for this vacancy you consent to these checks.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we‚Äôre facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Ben jij een gedreven en enthousiaste Data Analist met een passie voor het analyseren, modelleren en interpreteren van gegevens? Dan maken wij graag kennis met jou!


Binnen Visma | Raet maken we impact. Wat hebben ziekenhuizen, overheidsinstellingen en scholen met elkaar gemeen? De kans is groot dat ze onze HR-oplossingen gebruiken. Visma | Raet is namelijk leverancier van software die het leven van HR-professionals makkelijker en leuker maakt. We helpen organisaties om medewerkers blij te maken.


Zo bouw je met ons mee


Ter versterking van het Data Insights & Automation team zijn we op zoek naar een enthousiaste Data Analist die ons helpt om onze data driven organisatie naar het volgende niveau te tillen door gegevens te analyseren, modelleren en interpreteren. Door de samenwerking met verschillende afdelingen wordt bepaald hoe ons data platform verder kan groeien. Uitstekend ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden spreken voor zich. Je presenteert jezelf sterk. Je bent alert op aspecten als kwaliteit, documentatie, architectuur, standaarden en het afwegen van korte ‚Äì en lange termijn overwegingen. Samen met collega‚Äôs onderzoek en visualiseer je data die ons helpt om doelstellingen waar te maken. Samen met onze data engineers zorg je ervoor dat de benodigde data in een bruikbare vorm beschikbaar gesteld wordt. Jullie structureren, interpreteren, documenteren en zorgen voor tests zodat de kwaliteit aantoonbaar goed is. Zo speel jij een cruciale rol in het realiseren van onze bedrijfsdoelen.


Daarnaast beschik jij over:


  • HBO of WO werk-en denkniveau;
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren en presenteren van data-analyses;
  • Ervaring met het achterhalen van de echte behoefte achter een vraag en het vertalen hiervan naar concrete deliverables;
  • Ervaring met datavisualisatietools (Tableau / Power BI) is een pr√©;
  • Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.


Dit heb je ervoor nodig en breng je mee


Je beschikt over uitstekend ontwikkelde communicatieve vaardigheden. Contacten en relaties met jouw collega‚Äôs zijn essentieel voor succes en zoekt deze samenwerking dan ook op. Naast deze vaardigheden, ben je goed in:


  • Methodische aanpak en analytische vaardigheden;
  • Je hebt oog voor kwaliteit, documentatie, architectuur, standards, gebruiksvriendelijkheid, afweging korte/lange termijn, onderhoudbaarheid en security;
  • Kennis en ervaring met SQL;
  • Agile development & Delivery practices en tools;
  • Goede beheersing van Nederlands en Engels in woord en geschrift;
  • Relational en dimensional modeling, data mapping, ETL / ELT;
  • Opsplitsen van complexe problemen in overzichtelijke deelproblemen.


Wat je ziet en wat je krijgt


Je krijgt de kans om een belangrijke rol te zijn in het succes van Visma | Raet en de tevredenheid van onze klanten en medewerkers. Ook draag je bij aan het verbeteren van de huidige processen en zorgt hiermee dat we effectief blijven opereren. Ook jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling is hierin erg belangrijk. Daarom bieden we je de mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontplooien, zowel als analist als op persoonlijk vlak.


Wat je van ons kan verwachten


We vragen veel van je, maar daar staat tegenover dat je werkt met professionele, gedreven en leuke collega‚Äôs van alle leeftijden en ervaringsniveaus. Binnen Visma | Raet werken we gedeeltelijk vanuit huis. Wanneer je vanuit kantoor werkt, is dat op ons hoofdkantoor in Amersfoort met zo‚Äôn 400 andere collega‚Äôs. Je werkt binnen het Data Insights & Automation team samen met enkele business analisten en data engineers. Je werkt met mooie producten die daadwerkelijk waarde leveren voor de klanten. Uiteraard hebben we een goed inwerkprogramma voor je klaar liggen. Verder kan je verwachten:


  • Een rol met impact in een internationale werkende, snel veranderende organisatie;
  • Volop kansen om te groeien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak door middel van kennissessies;
  • Een uitstekend bruto salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨4.000 en ‚Ç¨5.500 afgestemd op je ervaring;
  • Een interessante bonusregeling van 2 %;
  • Interessante vitaliteitsprogramma‚Äôs met a.s.r. Vitality;
  • Een open en fijne cultuur met veel vrijheid en ruimte voor je eigen initiatief;
  • Standplaats Amersfoort, goed bereikbaar met ov en auto;
  • Laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
  • Grote kansen op succes bij een marktleider;
  • De mogelijkheid om flexibel en thuis te werken;
  • Een goede thuiswerkregeling en thuiswerkvergoeding om jouw werkplek mee in te richten;
  • 28 vakantiedagen per jaar en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Een fulltime dienstverband.


Direct solliciteren en meer weten


Wil je onderdeel uitmaken van het gedreven team en druk je graag je stempel op het het succes van Visma | Raet? Solliciteer dan direct! Wil je eerst nog wat meer weten? Neem dan contact op met Cheryl Bihari (Talent Acquisition Partner) via cheryl.bihari@visma.com.


Een online assessment en referentiecheck is onderdeel van de procedure. Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld, wij vullen deze vacature in zonder tussenkomst van externe bureaus.

Title: Data analyst
Description:
As a Data Analyst at Newcraft you‚Äôll delve into the data of our A-brand clients in order to improve their channel conversions. You‚Äôre a crucial link in the digital acceleration of our top brand clients.

What You‚Äôll Be Working On

Together with your fellow Commerce team members, you will make sure our clients achieve digital growth. You will collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative data to discover opportunities that improve the online customer journey. In this process, you collaborate closely with the client to ensure that your knowledge and skills are effectively transferred.

Your Responsibilities


Collect, plan and execute data driven online optimization programs.
Initiate hypothesis-driven A/B tests with the aim of improving visitor to buyer conversion.
Translate data into comprehensible visualizations using Google Analytics, Tableau or a similar program.
Advise and convince teams at every level.
Create and guide implementation of measurement plans for both web and app.
Involving various teams in your optimization plans, regardless of their level of digital maturity.


Qualifications


A background of 1-3 years in analytics in a commercial online setting.
Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Python, or R, and a strong inclination toward these technologies.
Familiarity with the Google Marketing Platform, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and Looker Studio is beneficial.
Bonus points for experience in A/B testing and familiarity with customer feedback tools like Optimizely, VWO, Hotjar, or Usabilla.
If you know your way around visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, that would make you a superstar.


Who You Are


Proactive, analytical and eager to learn.
Self-starting.
Good communication skills; you can translate complex data into a comprehensive story.
Fluent in Dutch and English.


About Us

At Newcraft, you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can collaborate with colleagues to improve and optimize client campaigns. We encourage continuous growth and development and expect you to stay up-to-date with the latest developments in the email marketing world.

Together, you‚Äôll make a difference, and enjoyment is an integral part of the job. We‚Äôre passionate about what we do, about each other, and for whom we work.
