Our company mission is to provide a highly supportive, team-oriented, and employee-focused work environment for the highest caliber of Intel and IT professionals to support DoD/IC in Europe and Asia, with an emphasis on long-term relationships and quality over quantity, resulting in a positive company culture and strong reputation.

Title: IT System Engineer Voice & Data Network (m/f/d)
Description:
Many innovations have come from IT. And it is precisely this value creation within the bigger picture that makes our global IT so special: bright minds working on artificial intelligence and inspiring moments on the Internet of Things. With state-of-the-art infrastructure, collaboration and agility, Festo offers its employees numbering more than 20,000 globally the opportunity to grab digitisation firmly with both hands. We‚Äôre heading to the next level of digital transformation. Are you coming with us? Welcome to Festo.

IT System Engineer Voice & Data Network (m/f/d)

Your Job


Planning, design and implementation of voice and data communication networks
Network monitoring/management, including monitoring and baselining of the network status
Ensuring active network operation (on-call duty) and ensuring high availability (switching, routing, WLAN, security, cloud)
Detection and elimination of bottlenecks (bandwidths, number of ports, KPIs, ...)
Implementation and operation of the specified security policy
Development and implementation of processes to ensure the conformity of the network configuration
Evaluating, testing, planning and operating new network technologies and integrating them into the existing infrastructure


Your Qualifications


Successfully completed studies in computer science / communications engineering or comparable qualification
Several years of professional experience in the field of network operation (NOC)
Sound knowledge of common network technologies (routing, switching, security, SD-WAN/LAN, VPN, WLAN, VoIP, QoS, NAT)
Knowledge of working with products from renowned network suppliers (Cisco, MS Teams Voice, Audiocodes)
Sound knowledge of network analysis and troubleshooting (baselining, monitoring, protocol analysis) as well as knowledge of network security (802.1X, NAC, microsegmentation)
Sound programming knowledge (DevNet, Python, Ansible, Terraform) as well as sound cloud knowledge (AWS, Azure)
Ideally certifications (CCNP, CCDP) and knowledge of MS Teams Voice
Team orientation, independent working style and complex problem-solving skills
Communication and conflict resolution skills as well as flexibility


You Can Expect The Following With Us


The good feeling working for a family-owned company with a safe and solid financial basis
Freedom to explore, innovate and realise your own ideas
Competitive compensation with attractive perks and other benefits
Respect and appreciation for each other - regardless of gender, nationality, disability, age and identity
Lifelong learning with great conditions for individual further development
Flexible working models depending on the respective workplace for a good balance of work and private life
Highly modern working environment, infrastructure and communication technologies
Great family and health services for your well-being

Title: Super Computing Engineer (w/m/d)
Description:
How brave are you? We are a high-tech company providing machine tools and laser technology, and are looking for people who can face new challenges with a fresh mind. As an independent family company, we offer you the freedom and trust to put your brave ideas into practice. With you on board, we would like to power ahead with the digital networking of the manufacturing industry. Our passion and creative drive ensure that we are an innovative force ‚Äì across the globe at over 80 TRUMPF locations.

Ihre Aufgaben


Administration, Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung des aktuellen TRUMPF Supercomputing Framework, um die Nutzung weiter im Konzern zu verbreiten
Durchf√ºhrung von Projekten in cross-funktionalen Teams mithilfe agiler Methoden im Spannungsfeld zwischen IT und Entwicklung
Unterst√ºtzung der Entwickler in den Entwicklungsabteilungen bei der Umsetzung ihrer FEM-Simulationen, Machine Learning Algorithmen oder Quantensimulationen auf den Supercomputing Instanzen
Mitarbeit in Projekten als Supercomputing Spezialist mit den Aufgaben Analyse, Requirement Engineering, Konzeption und Implementierung von numerischen Simulationen verschiedener Fachrichtungen (Simulationsmodellierung, Implementierung von Simulationen, etc.)
√úbernahme von Verantwortung als Service Manager von Supercomputing Anwendungen bei TRUMPF
Durchf√ºhrung von Schulungen & Workshops, Gew√§hrleistung von Anwendersupport und Beratung der Fachbereiche bei der Entwicklung von Use Cases im internationalen Umfeld



Was wir suchen


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im MINT-Bereich oder vergleichbaren F√§chern sowie mehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung in diesem Bereich
Fundierte Erfahrung in den Bereichen Supercomputing und/oder FEM-Simulation, Machine Learning oder Quantum Simulation sowie den hierzu relevanten Programmiersprachen (Python, C++ oder Fortran) und Frameworks (z.B. Ansys, TensorFlow etc.)
Kenntnisse √ºber aktuelle L√∂sungen und Trends im Bereich Supercomputing, numerische Simulation, Machine Learning sowie Quantum Simulation w√ºnschenswert
Erfahrung im Bereich der Azure Cloud, Data Bricks Spark, Azure Machine Learning sowie im Cloud-Umfeld sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Was wir bieten


Hochmoderne Arbeitsumgebung mit neuester Technologie
Fr√ºhe Verantwortungs√ºbernahme und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben
Umfangreiches Schulungs- und Weiterbildungsangebot
Aktiv gef√∂rderte Work-Life-Balance, z. B. mit Sport- und Fitnessprogrammen
Respektvolle und wertsch√§tzende Unternehmenskultur



Haben wir Sie √ºberzeugt?

Bitte richten Sie Ihre Onlinebewerbung an Lena Domeyer. F√ºr R√ºckfragen erreichen Sie uns / unser Recruiting Team unter lena.domeyer@trumpf.com. Alle unsere ausgeschriebenen Stellen sind aktuell noch zu besetzen. Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus datenschutzrechtlichen Gr√ºnden keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen d√ºrfen. Auf unserer Karriereseite finden Sie alle FAQs rund um Ihre Bewerbung bei uns.

Title: Staff Data Engineer (Fintech team) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world

Get to Know Our Team

Fintech is one of the fastest growing areas in Agoda and we are rapidly expanding our tech team. We work closely with the finance business team and our Fintech product owners to reduce risk, drive efficiencies and move on new market opportunities in this exciting field. We have a wide range of projects from traditional finance or cutting-edge customer fintech. For example, reconciliation using Big Data technologies, growing and optimizing customer payments options, tax calculations in milli-second response times and a mesh of supplier payment options like vertical credit cards. Its a hot field and the perfect mix of data engineering and backend engineering.

The Opportunity

We are looking for engineers with experience in the fintech area. This can be a year or two at a fintech startup right through to an expert in this domain. You might have a background as ‚Äò back end ‚Äô or ‚Äòdata‚Äô engineer , either way we are looking for smart engineers who can be super agile, move fast and have an eye for detail. We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you are skilled in any of the technologies we work with and excited at building new fintech technology.

In this Role, you will get to


Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data systems
Build, administer and scale data processing pipelines
Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Scala, Spark, java, Golang, Python3, scripting (Bash/Python), Hadoop, SQL, S3 etc
Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data systems
Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality
Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
8+ years of experience in Data engineering
Good experience in Apache Spark
Expert level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala
Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable
A good understanding of data architecture principles preferred
Any other experience with Big Data technologies / tools
SQL experience
Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
Systems administration skills in Linux


It‚Äôs great if you have


Good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems
Experience working with Open-source products
Python/Shell scripting skills
Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

Title: Cloud Data Engineer AWS / Google Cloud (all genders)
Description:
Wir geh√∂ren zu den Top-Adressen in der IT-Welt und fokussieren uns auf die Optimierung der Kerngesch√§fts¬≠prozesse unserer Kunden. Durch den smarten Einsatz ma√ügeschneiderter IT-L√∂sungen unterst√ºtzen wir unsere Kunden dabei, das Beste aus ihrem Business und aktuellen Technologien herauszuholen. Unseren Erfolg aber erreichen wir nur durch eins: die Menschen bei adesso! Sie bringen Ideen, fachliches Know how und Technologien zusammen. Gemeinsam programmieren wir (deine) Zukunft bei adesso.

Standorte

Aachen, K√∂ln, D√ºsseldorf, Essen, Paderborn, Bonn, M√ºnster, Hamburg, Stuttgart, Dortmund, Hannover, Frankfurt, N√ºrnberg, Potsdam, Leipzig, M√ºnchen, Ulm, Karlsruhe, Dresden, Walldorf, Jena, Bremen, Berlin, Saarbr√ºcken, Rostock, Siegen, Stralsund, Kiel, Augsburg, Neum√ºnster, Koblenz

DEINE ROLLE - DAS WARTET AUF DICH

Wir haben Bock auf Daten! Du auch? Dann bist du bei adesso genau richtig!

Das Competence Center Cloud Data Platforms ist verantwortlich f√ºr die Umsetzung komplexer Big Data und Cloud Analytics Datenprojekte mit Fokus auf AWS und Google Cloud. In deiner Rolle als Cloud Data Engineer bist du Teil eines innovativen und stetig wachsenden Data Engineering Teams, dabei profitierst du von deinen erfahrenen Teammitgliedern und bildest dich fortw√§hrend in aktuellen Cloud Technologien weiter.

Im Detail √ºbernimmst du dabei folgende Aufgaben:


Konzeption und Implementierung von performanten und skalierbaren Cloud Datenplattformen
Implementieren von komplexen Cloud Analytics L√∂sungen mit den Analytics Services der gro√üen Hyperscaler AWS und GCP
Engineering von Container basierten Analytics Plattformen und effizienten CI/CD Pipelines
Stetige Weiterbildungen in Technologien aus dem Softwareentwicklungsumfeld, um unsere Kunden als Consultant professionell beraten zu k√∂nnen


DEINE SKILLS - DAS BRINGST DU MIT


"Bock auf Daten‚Äú: Mit viel Begeisterung eignest du dir gerne neues Wissen zu Applikationen, Technologien und Tools im Cloud Analytics Kontext an.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung und Praxiserfahrung im Consulting sowie dem Softwareengineering.
Du hast bereits praktische (Projekt-)Erfahrungen mit den Datenservices des Cloud √ñkosystem (AWS, GCP, sowie Kafka, Spark, Databricks) gesammelt - belegt durch Herstellerzertifizierungen und/oder nachgewiesene Projekterfahrung.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber Erfahrungen in der Softwareentwicklung mit Java, Scala oder Python und hast in diesem Zusammenhang auch Erfahrung mit Buildtools und CI/CD Pipelines, wie z.B. Maven, Git oder Gitlab sammeln k√∂nnen.
Eine hohe Ergebnis- und Kundenorientierung, offene und zielgruppengerechte Kommunikation, sowie gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden dein Profil ab.


Unser Versprechen: Du wirst dich bei uns wohlf√ºhlen! Kollegial, famili√§r und auf Augenh√∂he ‚Äì wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Diversit√§t und verschiedene Blickwinkel werden bei uns genauso gesch√§tzt wie du als Mensch. Das und viel mehr steht f√ºr unser ganz besonderes Wir-Gef√ºhl. F√ºr das es sogar ein Wort gibt: adessi.

Unsere Kultur und das Zusammenarbeiten sind gepr√§gt von gegenseitiger Wertsch√§tzung, Anerkennung und Unterst√ºtzung. Das verbindet uns hierarchie√ºbergreifend ‚Äì auch im Home-Office. So belegen wir zum wiederholten Mal den 1. Platz beim Wettbewerb ‚ÄûDeutschlands Beste Arbeitgeber in der ITK‚Äú!. Das Bosch PreMaster Programm ist ein zweistufiges Qualifizierungsprogramm f√ºr engagierte Bachelor-Absolvent:innen, die das Ziel haben, ein Masterstudium zu absolvieren. Nach dem Bachelor bietet die erste Phase im Rahmen eines Gap Years von bis zu 12 Monaten praktische Erfahrung, um die fachlichen und unternehmerischen Zusammenh√§nge kennenzulernen.   • Tauche ein in die spannende Welt eines Product Owners und √ºbernehme die Verantwortung f√ºr Teilprojekte.

Title: PreMaster Programm - Strategie und Change Management
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Bei Bosch gestalten wir Zukunft mit hochwertigen Technologien und Dienstleistungen, die Begeisterung wecken und das Leben der Menschen verbessern. Unser Versprechen an unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter steht dabei felsenfest: Wir wachsen gemeinsam, haben Freude an unserer Arbeit und inspirieren uns gegenseitig. Willkommen bei Bosch.

Die Robert Bosch GmbH freut sich auf deine Bewerbung!

Stellenbeschreibung


Werde Teil unseres funktions√ºbergreifenden Teams und habe das Design sowie die Optimierung von Benutzeroberfl√§chen und Workflows f√ºr B2C-Prozesse im Blick. So gew√§hrleistest du ein nahtloses und intuitives Erlebnis sowohl f√ºr unsere Kundschaft als auch f√ºr interne Benutzer:innen.
Du f√ºhrst Nutzerforschungen, Usability-Tests und die Entwicklung von Personas durch, um Einblicke in das Nutzerverhalten, die Pr√§ferenzen sowie Schmerzpunkte zu gewinnen.
Zudem arbeitest du mit dem Produktmanagement, Entwicklerinnen sowie Entwicklern und Stakeholder zusammen. Gemeinsam mit ihnen definierst du Benutzeranforderungen, priorisierst Funktionen und erstellst User Stories sowie Journey Maps.
Dar√ºber hinaus setzt du dich im gesamten Unternehmen f√ºr nutzerzentrierte Designprinzipien sowie Best Practices ein und leitest deine Kolleginnen und Kollegen in UX-Methoden sowie -Techniken an.
Auch mit Entwicklungsteams arbeitest du eng zusammen, um die erfolgreiche Umsetzung der Entw√ºrfe zu gew√§hrleisten und f√ºhrst nach der Markteinf√ºhrung Evaluierungen durch. Hierbei misst du die Benutzerfreundlichkeit und die Effektivit√§t.
Nicht zuletzt h√§ltst du dich √ºber Branchentrends, neue Technologien und Best Practices im UX-Design auf dem Laufenden. Mithilfe dieses Wissens treibst du kontinuierliche Verbesserungen und Innovationen voran.


Qualifikationen


Ausbildung: abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Bachelor) im Bereich Betriebswirtschaft, Organisationspsychologie, Change Management, Kommunikation, Design, UX oder vergleichbarer Studiengang und die konkrete Absicht ein Masterstudium aufzunehmen
Erfahrungen und Know-how: ausgezeichnetes Kommunikations- und Pr√§sentationsgeschick sowie die F√§higkeit, Gestaltungsentscheidungen zu erl√§utern und f√ºr die Bed√ºrfnisse der Nutzerinnen sowie Nutzer einzutreten
Pers√∂nlichkeit und Arbeitsweise: du bist empathisch und kundenorientiert, denn mit deiner Leidenschaft f√ºr das Verstehen von Nutzerbed√ºrfnissen und das L√∂sen komplexer Probleme durch Design hebst du dich hervor; durch deine kreative und innovative Denkweise f√§llt es dir leicht, mit anderen zu kollaborieren und im Team zu arbeiten; du bist f√§hig, Konsens zu schaffen und die Abstimmung zwischen verschiedenen Interessengruppen voranzutreiben; du zeichnest dich durch deine Anpassungsf√§higkeit aus, bist belastbar und findest dich in einem schnelllebigen Umfeld gut zurecht
Begeisterung: Begeisterung f√ºr den Einsatz von Design, um das Gesch√§ft voranzutreiben und das Leben unserer Kundschaft sowie Nutzerinnen bzw. Nutzer zu verbessern
Sprachen: sehr gutes Englisch und Deutsch in Wort und Schrift, weitere Sprachkenntnisse w√ºnschenswert


Zus√§tzliche Informationen

Das Bosch PreMaster Programm ist ein zweistufiges Qualifizierungsprogramm f√ºr engagierte Bachelor-Absolvent:innen, die das Ziel haben, ein Masterstudium zu absolvieren. Nach dem Bachelor bietet die erste Phase im Rahmen eines Gap Years von bis zu 12 Monaten praktische Erfahrung, um die fachlichen und unternehmerischen Zusammenh√§nge kennenzulernen. Die zweite Phase umfasst das Masterstudium und beinhaltet weitere Events und Seminare sowie Betreuung durch pers√∂nliches Mentoring auf dem Weg zum erfolgreichen Abschluss.

Wir bieten flexible Arbeitsmodelle wie mobiles Arbeiten. Spreche uns gerne dazu an.

Vielfalt und Inklusion sind f√ºr uns keine Trends, sondern fest verankert in unserer Unternehmenskultur. Daher freuen wir uns √ºber alle Bewerbungen: unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Alter, Behinderung, Religion, ethnischer Herkunft oder sexueller Identit√§t.

Title: SAP S/4HANA Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a SAP S/4HANA Engineer (f/m/d) to join our Business Services division starting at the earliest possible opportunity.

Your Responsibilities

Responsibility - You will be part of the SAP S/4HANA Product Team and help to maintain a sustainable S/4HANA Public Cloud solution. Your focus will be on either developing and maintaining reporting and analytics within SAP S/4HANA, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud; managing security, roles, and authorisations within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud environment; or overseeing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud environments and their integration into our Business Operation Solution ecosystem.

Management - You will act as a technical and process expert and work with business analysts, developers, and deployment teams to guide and resolve issues. Depending on the focus, this includes either SAP S/4HANA Cloud reporting technologies, security and authorisation concepts or environment and integration technologies.

Analysis - You will analyse the impact of SAP release updates or other technologies within the BOS ecosystem and define and implement the necessary adaptation of either S/4HANA Public Cloud environments or S/4HANA Public Cloud security and authorisation concepts, depending on the focus.

Your profile


You have completed your studies in (business-) informatics, economics or a comparable program.
You bring multiple years of professional experience in SAP. Ideally you have a good understanding of the specific requirements of the Professional Services Business in a multinational firm. Experience in Project management and/or leading would be helpful.
You have strong SAP and cloud-based experience. Depending on your focus, you are skilled in reporting and analytics (SAP S/4HANA, SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud), authorization concepts (business roles, catalogs, restrictions), or environment and integration technologies.
You are fluent in English both spoken and written. German would be a benefit.
You want to work in a multifunctional team and are ready to lead and mentor others. You are able to propose suitable solutions for the stakeholders at multiple levels and across multiple disciplines.


Your Benefits

Flexibility ‚Äì We encourage you to choose your working hours and your working place the way that suits you and your lifestyle. We do not have core working hours and we also offer you the possibility of home office or work from abroad. Always in accordance with operational requirements and labor law regulations.

Family ‚Äì Working parents bring huge value to our firm and we want to ensure that they are supported at every stage and feel confident balancing their work and home lives. Also, we support you, If required, in caring for relatives by arranging carers, special leave or part-time models.

Financial Stability ‚Äì We have put together various insurance packages for your (financial) security (e.g. international health insurance or accident insurance)

as well as a company pension scheme. In addition, in the event of illness, we grant you an allowance for continued payment of wages beyond the statutory period of 6 weeks.

Health and Wellbeing ‚Äì Your health is important to us: in addition to our own company health insurance scheme, we also offer preventive medical check-ups and

divers sport offerings. Take part in our free company sports programme or benefit from reduced rates at various gyms or an Urban Sports Club membership.

And there is even more ‚Äì It is our purpose to create a positive working environment: An environment where flexible and creative working is possible, where work is recognized and performance is rewarded and of which we are all very proud. You can find more detailed information on all of our benefits on our career website.

At PwC Germany, it is our purpose to solve our clients' key challenges, create sustainable outcomes and build trust in business and society. As part of our internal IT team (Products & Technology), you are the driver behind our promise: human-led and tech-powered. We are experts for our technology solutions and make the use of technology easier and more efficient. As a team, we develop innovative solutions for the entire product life cycle and

Contact

If you have any questions about this position or your application, please reach out to Alina Dusi at +49 211 981-7650.

Title: Lead Data Engineer ‚Äì Data Platform (Bangkok-Based, Relocation Provided)
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

Get to Know Our Team

The Data department oversees all of Agoda‚Äôs data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company‚Äôs culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.

Why Agoda Hadoop Apps Team?

Joining this team, you will be solving some of the most difficult challenges out there today for the Hadoop ecosystem. We focus largely on building user tools and applications for other teams to use, most of these are built on top of Yarn utilizing Apache Spark as well as other cutting edge technologies.

We are also the engine that drives a fully functional world class data warehouse on top of Hadoop, this means providing tools to define data cubes and syncing high load of data from a processing Hadoop to other systems using in-house built Applications.

In this Role, you will get to


Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data Platform
Build, administer and scale Data Platform
Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: S3, Kubernetes, KubeFlow, Spark, SQL, Impala, Scala, java, Python, scripting (Bash/Python) etc.
Work with experienced engineers to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data platform management


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
6+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration eg. Hadoop, S3, AWS, Google Cloud etc.
6+ years of experience in Kubernetes Administration
Good experience in Apache Spark performance tuning and debugging
Good level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala
Experience in WorkFlow Scheduler eg. KubeFlow, AirFlow, Oozie etc.
SQL experience eg. SparkSql, Impala, BigQuery, Presto/Trino, StarRocks etc.
Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable
Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience.
Systems administration skills in Linux


It‚Äôs great if you have


Experience working with Open-source products
Python/Shell scripting skills
Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

Title: Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x) in Stuttgart
Description:
You make the difference. Whether in business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory or Consulting: at Deloitte, we help our global clients continuously evolve. Discover a diverse working environment that is constantly in motion and always revolving around one central hub: you and your expertise. What impact will you make?

Do you want to leverage the full power of the cloud for our clients in Consulting ‚Äì Cloud Transformation & System Engineering? Our teams guide businesses on their cloud journeys, from strategizing to developing and integrating high-performing, future-proof applications, as well as transforming major IT divisions into agile entities, moving complex IT landscapes to the cloud, and operating innovative software services. Ensure our joint success and make the difference with us as a Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x).

Locations: Berlin, Cologne, Dusseldorf, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Hanover, Leipzig, Munich and Stuttgart.

Your impact:

As a Cloud Software Engineer (m/f/x) your role will be to support IT transformation and software delivery projects from conception phase to production by developing advanced solutions. You will work collaboratively with other experts in the team to generate value for our clients.


Adaptable architectures: Design flexible architectures in an agile environment which are compliant with clean code and software craftsmanship standards.
Best practices: Develop best practices for testability, maintainability, scalability, and other areas to support an open team culture.
Technical support: Assist internal teams as well as clients with the assessment of technologies to be used.
Community: Step up and make your contribution, for example by actively taking part in conferences and meet-ups.


Your skillset:


Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree, or Austrian HTL degree, ideally IT-focused (e.g. (business) informatics, mathematics, or physics), or equivalent education/training/experience
Experience in programming, software development in a cloud environment (AWS, Azure or GCP), implementing cloud infrastructure solutions (e.g. Terraform) or containerization (e.g. Docker or Kubernetes)
Hands-on in continuous integration and deployment (e.g. Git, GitHub Actions or Jenkins), and nice to have knowledge in machine learning libaries and NLP
Analytical and structured, team-oriented and capable of responding to complex client inquiries in a structured and organized manner
Fluent English and German (B2) language, both written and spoken and willing to travel occasionally


Your chance:


Best-in-class ongoing education at Deloitte University and through individual qualification programs and training sessions
Extensive professional development opportunities with structured career planning, inclusive leadership, secondment programs, project-based job rotation, and support for societal engagement and corporate volunteering
Work-family balance with a family advice service, mobile working, part-time hours, sabbaticals, support for family caregivers, counseling for parental leave, and much more
A focus on health and fitness with regular health-themed days, partnerships with fitness providers, and support for sporting and team events
Attractive employer benefits including bicycle and car leasing, a company smartphone for private use, and flexible working models (such as trust-based working hours and EU remote working)
Plenty of scope for creativity and active promotion of an inclusive corporate culture ‚Äì for instance through our diversity and inclusion employee networks


Are you ready? Make a difference with us!

Our recruiting team looks forward to receiving your application documents (CV as well as general qualification for university entrance, university and work references) via our online form. A cover letter and an application photo are not required.

Equal opportunities for all: We look forward to receiving applications from people who are as diverse as we are ‚Äì irrespective of age, disability, ethnic origin and nationality, gender, religion, sexual identity or social background. Any questions? You can find all the information you need about our application process in our application FAQs.

Title: PreMaster Programm - Projektmanagement Einkauf Compute Enhanced
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Bei Bosch gestalten wir Zukunft mit hochwertigen Technologien und Dienstleistungen, die Begeisterung wecken und das Leben der Menschen verbessern. Unser Versprechen an unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter steht dabei felsenfest: Wir wachsen gemeinsam, haben Freude an unserer Arbeit und inspirieren uns gegenseitig. Willkommen bei Bosch.

Die Robert Bosch GmbH freut sich auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Stellenbeschreibung


F√ºr innovative Automotive Produkte in der Vorserienphase im Bereich Cross-Domain Computing Solutions leitest Du eigenst√§ndig Einkaufsteilprojekte von Planung √ºber Durchf√ºhrung bis zur Umsetzung.
Als PreMaster √ºbernimmst Du dabei Verantwortung f√ºr Projekteinkaufsthemen und erarbeitest und treibst Ans√§tze zur Produktkostenoptimierung.
W√§hrend der Programms verfolgst, koordinierst und unterst√ºtzt Du die Erreichung von Zielen bez√ºglich Qualit√§t, Kosten und Teileverf√ºgbarkeit.
Dabei kooperierst Du mit weltweiten Schnittstellenfunktionen (Entwicklung, Logistik, Produktmanagement,‚Ä¶) und bildest die Schnittstelle zu externen Zulieferern (Verhandlungen, technische Gespr√§che,...).


Qualifikationen


Ausbildung: √ºberdurchschnittlich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Bachelor) im wirtschaftlichen/technischen Bereich (z.B. Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, technische Betriebswirtschaft, Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik) und konkrete Absicht im Anschluss ein Masterstudium aufzunehmen
Pers√∂nlichkeit und Arbeitsweise: hohe Bereitschaft zur Zusammenarbeit in interdisziplin√§ren Teams mit einer systematischen und analytischen Denkweise; kommunikativ, teamf√§hig sowie kooperativ, gute Arbeitsstruktur und Selbst√§ndigkeit
Erfahrungen und Know-how: erste Erfahrungen im Einkauf und im Projektmanagement
Qualifikation: gutes technisches und wirtschaftliches Verst√§ndnis sowie ganzheitliches Denken; gute MS-Office Kenntnisse mit Pivotierung in Excel und PowerBI
Begeisterung: hohe Identifizierung mit der Aufgabe, Spa√ü an der Zusammenarbeit mit Menschen, Freude an kommerziellen und technischen Themen
Sprachen: sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Zus√§tzliche Informationen

Das Bosch PreMaster Programm ist ein zweistufiges Qualifizierungsprogramm f√ºr engagierte Bachelor-Absolventinnen und -Absolventen, die das Ziel haben, ein Masterstudium zu absolvieren. Nach dem Bachelor bietet die erste Phase bis zu 12 Monate praktische Erfahrung im Rahmen eines Gap Years, um die fachlichen und unternehmerischen Zusammenh√§nge kennenzulernen. Die zweite Phase umfasst das Masterstudium und beinhaltet weitere praktische Einblicke im Rahmen studentischer Besch√§ftigungen sowie pers√∂nliches Mentoring auf dem Weg zum erfolgreichen Abschluss.

Beginn: ab Oktober 2024 / nach Absprache

Vielfalt und Inklusion sind f√ºr uns keine Trends, sondern fest verankert in unserer Unternehmenskultur. Daher freuen wir uns √ºber alle Bewerbungen: unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Alter, Behinderung, Religion, ethnischer Herkunft oder sexueller Identit√§t.

HTML:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Bei Bosch gestalten wir Zukunft mit hochwertigen Technologien und Dienstleistungen, die Begeisterung wecken und das Leben der Menschen verbessern. Unser Versprechen an unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter steht dabei felsenfest: Wir wachsen gemeinsam, haben Freude an unserer Arbeit und inspirieren uns gegenseitig. Willkommen bei Bosch.

Die Robert Bosch GmbH freut sich auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Stellenbeschreibung

  • F√ºr innovative Automotive Produkte in der Vorserienphase im Bereich Cross-Domain Computing Solutions leitest Du eigenst√§ndig Einkaufsteilprojekte von Planung √ºber Durchf√ºhrung bis zur Umsetzung.
  • Als PreMaster √ºbernimmst Du dabei Verantwortung f√ºr Projekteinkaufsthemen und erarbeitest und treibst Ans√§tze zur Produktkostenoptimierung.
  • W√§hrend der Programms verfolgst, koordinierst und unterst√ºtzt Du die Erreichung von Zielen bez√ºglich Qualit√§t, Kosten und Teileverf√ºgbarkeit.
  • Dabei kooperierst Du mit weltweiten Schnittstellenfunktionen (Entwicklung, Logistik, Produktmanagement,‚Ä¶) und bildest die Schnittstelle zu externen Zulieferern (Verhandlungen, technische Gespr√§che,...).

Qualifikationen

  • Ausbildung: √ºberdurchschnittlich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Bachelor) im wirtschaftlichen/technischen Bereich (z.B. Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, technische Betriebswirtschaft, Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik) und konkrete Absicht im Anschluss ein Masterstudium aufzunehmen
  • Pers√∂nlichkeit und Arbeitsweise: hohe Bereitschaft zur Zusammenarbeit in interdisziplin√§ren Teams mit einer systematischen und analytischen Denkweise; kommunikativ, teamf√§hig sowie kooperativ, gute Arbeitsstruktur und Selbst√§ndigkeit
  • Erfahrungen und Know-how: erste Erfahrungen im Einkauf und im Projektmanagement
  • Qualifikation: gutes technisches und wirtschaftliches Verst√§ndnis sowie ganzheitliches Denken; gute MS-Office Kenntnisse mit Pivotierung in Excel und PowerBI
  • Begeisterung: hohe Identifizierung mit der Aufgabe, Spa√ü an der Zusammenarbeit mit Menschen, Freude an kommerziellen und technischen Themen
  • Sprachen: sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Zus√§tzliche Informationen

Das Bosch PreMaster Programm ist ein zweistufiges Qualifizierungsprogramm f√ºr engagierte Bachelor-Absolventinnen und -Absolventen, die das Ziel haben, ein Masterstudium zu absolvieren. Nach dem Bachelor bietet die erste Phase bis zu 12 Monate praktische Erfahrung im Rahmen eines Gap Years, um die fachlichen und unternehmerischen Zusammenh√§nge kennenzulernen. Die zweite Phase umfasst das Masterstudium und beinhaltet weitere praktische Einblicke im Rahmen studentischer Besch√§ftigungen sowie pers√∂nliches Mentoring auf dem Weg zum erfolgreichen Abschluss.

Beginn: ab Oktober 2024 / nach Absprache

Vielfalt und Inklusion sind f√ºr uns keine Trends, sondern fest verankert in unserer Unternehmenskultur. Daher freuen wir uns √ºber alle Bewerbungen: unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Alter, Behinderung, Religion, ethnischer Herkunft oder sexueller Identit√§t.

Title: (Junior) Cloud Data Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Daten sind das Gold von morgen! Und Du suchst, f√∂rderst und veredelst das Wertvollste, was unsere Kundenbesitzen: Ihre Daten. Daher suchen wir Dich, mit und ohne Berufserfahrung, als (Junior) Data Engineer (all genders) f√ºr unsere Standorte in Stuttgart, Hamburg oder M√ºnchen.




Deine Aufgaben:




Mit der PIA Customer Experience Platform hilfst Du unseren Kunden, personalisierte und automatisierte Marketingkampagnen f√ºr alle Kan√§le entlang der Customer Journey zu planen, zu realisieren und zu optimieren.
Unsere Data Engineering Services setzt Du gezielt bei der technischen Weiterentwicklung der Customer Data Platform (CDP) ein mit dem Ziel einer ganzheitlichen Kundensicht: Dabei unterst√ºtzt Du unsere Kunden bei der Datenintegration (aus unterschiedlichen Quellen wie Webshops oder Kundenkarten) und der Datenveredelung (wie z.B. Dubletten identifizieren).
Gemeinsam mit unseren fachlichen Consultants bist Du Ansprechpartner:in f√ºr unsere Kunden: Du arbeitest im gesamten Projektzyklus mit den Marketing- und IT-Abteilungen unserer Kunden zusammen, um kundenindividuell entlang der Customer Journey beraten zu k√∂nnen.
Du setzt zukunftsweisende Dataengineering Technologien rund um die Azure Cloud ein uns sorgst f√ºr eine standardisierte Umsetzung √ºber die Projekte hinweg.
Mit neuesten L√∂sungen unserer f√ºhrenden Technologiepartner unterst√ºtzt Du bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer SaaS-Plattform in der MS Azure Cloud.
Dabei bleibst Du nicht stehen, sondern erschlie√üt neue Trends und Methoden und entwickelst Dich und unsere Kunden stets weiter.




Das bringst du idealerweise mit:

abgeschlossenes Studium mit (IT-)technischer Ausrichtung (Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik) oder vergleichbare Ausbildung
Starkes Interesse an der Entwicklung von DWH/Data Lake/BI Cloud Architecture, gro√üe Daten Plattformen in der Azure Cloud
Idealerweise hast Du schon erste Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Marketing & Customer Experience gesammelt ‚Äì dies ist kein Muss, Leidenschaft f√ºr Azure und Daten sind uns wichtiger!
sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Lust auf Ver√§nderungen, denn jeder Kunde ist ein Unikat!

Title: Abschlussarbeit Einf√ºhrung von Model-Based Systems Engineering f√ºr die E/E-Architekturentwicklung ab August 2024
Description:
"Aufgaben

In der Abteilung TT/S15 erforschen und entwickeln wir die n√§chste Generation von Elektrik/Elektronik-Architekturen (kurz ‚ÄûE/E‚Äú) bei Daimler Truck. Dabei ist der Wandel von der Komponenten-orientierten zur Software-definierten und Service-orientierten E/E-Architektur der Fokus unserer T√§tigkeiten. Neue Kund:innenw√ºnsche sowie das autonome Fahren sollen mit der neuen E/E-Architektur erm√∂glicht werden. Diese Kund:innenl√∂sungen m√ºssen mit schnellen Time-to-Market Anforderungen verf√ºgbar sein.

Um die Entwicklung solch einer Software-definierten E/E-Architektur methodisch zu unterst√ºtzen, richtet sich Daimler Truck nach modellbasierter Entwicklung mit Systems Engineering Gesichtspunkten (MBSE). Die Umstellung des gesamten Entwicklungsprozesses auf die modellbasierte Entwicklung mit der Einf√ºhrung des Systemgedanken stellt dabei eine gro√üe Herausforderung dar, die unsere Abteilung durch die Definition von Methoden, Rollen und Arbeitspaketen im Systems Engineering sowie dem Support angeht. Gerade die Erstellung der Modelle auf verschiedenen Abstraktionsebenen (Von logischer Architektur √ºber System- bis hin zur Hardware-Architektur) sowie die Definition der Schnittstellen zwischen den Ebenen ist essenziell f√ºr die erfolgreiche Etablierung von MBSE in unserem Unternehmen. Es gilt daher, die verschiedenen Abstraktionsebenen von Modellen in unseren Systems Engineering Ansatz zu integrieren, um alle Vorteile von dynamischen Interfaces in einer Modelllandschaft nutzen zu k√∂nnen.

Werden Sie ein Teil der Innovation bei Daimler Truck und arbeiten Sie mit Ihrer Abschlussarbeit an spannenden Themen der Zukunft mit!

Diese Herausforderungen kommen auf Sie zu:


Aufarbeitung von Stand der Technik und Wissenschaft
Einarbeitung in die Welt von Elektrik/Elektronik-Architekturen bei Daimler Truck
Einarbeitung in existierende Systems Engineering-Entwicklungsmethoden bei Daimler Truck
Entwicklung eines Konzepts f√ºr die Einf√ºhrung von Feature- und Systemmodellen auf verschiedenen Abstraktionsebenen samt Interfaces zwischen den Ebenen
Erarbeitung einer Argumentation f√ºr die Notwendigkeit der Einf√ºhrung von Feature- und Systemmodellen
Prototypische Umsetzung des Konzepts in einem modellbasierten Werkzeug mit Produktivdaten
Dokumentation und Pr√§sentation der Ergebnisse


Die endg√ºltige Themenfindung erfolgt in Absprache mit der Hochschule, Ihnen und uns. M√∂glichkeiten der Betreuung √ºber den Lehrstuhl ‚ÄûMobilit√§t und Technik‚Äú der Hochschule Esslingen sind vorhanden.

Qualifikationen


Naturwissenschaftlicher Studiengang (Elektrotechnik, Informatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Maschinenbau oder Vergleichbares), idealerweise im Master
Sichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Sicherer Umgang mit MS-Office
Engagement und Teamf√§higkeit
Analytische Denkweise und strategische Arbeitsweise


Zus√§tzliche Informationen:

Ganz ohne Formalit√§ten geht es nat√ºrlich auch bei uns nicht. Daher bitten wir Sie, sich ausschlie√ülich online zu bewerben und Ihrer Bewerbung einen Lebenslauf, aktuelle Immatrikulationsbescheinigung, aktuellen Notenspiegel und relevante Zeugnisse (max. Gesamtgr√∂√üe der Anh√§nge 5 MB) beizuf√ºgen.

Bitte haben Sie Verst√§ndnis daf√ºr, dass wir keine Papierbewerbungen mehr entgegennehmen und es keinen Anspruch auf R√ºckversand gibt.

Weiterf√ºhrende Informationen zu den Einstellkriterien finden Sie hier. Angeh√∂rige von Staaten au√üerhalb des europ√§ischen Wirtschaftsraums schicken ggf. bitte ihre Aufenthalts-/Arbeitsgenehmigung mit.

Wir freuen uns insbesondere √ºber Onlinebewerbungen schwerbehinderter und ihnen gleichgestellter behinderter Menschen.

Bei Fragen k√∂nnen Sie sich unter sbv-zentrale-truck@daimlertruck.com zudem an die Schwerbehindertenvertretung des Standorts wenden, die Sie gerne nach Ihrer Bewerbung im weiteren Bewerbungsprozess unterst√ºtzt.

Fragen zum Bewerbungsprozess beantwortet Ihnen gerne HR Services per Mail: hrservices@daimlertruck.com

"

Title: Bell Labs Internship - Autonomous Systems
Description:
Job Description

Family Description

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

Subfamily Description

The team you'll be part of

Bell Labs

Nokia Bell Labs is the world-renowned research arm of Nokia, having invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communications networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has produced nine Nobel Prizes, five Turing Awards and numerous other awards.

Bell Labs Summer Intern

Nokia Bell Labs is building the future of human experience and our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with industry leading experts, who solve the most formidable challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.

Education Recommendations

Enrolled student in Bachelor or Master (preferred) degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fields.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

What you will learn and contribute to

As part of our team, you will work on a subset of the following:

Design and implement research ideas in the filed of AI/ML

Work on developing solutions using Deep NN, Reinforement Learning, Speed up learning approaches, etc.

Work with different platforms and Proof of Concepts to validate the contributed / proposed solutions

Explore the potential of AI/ML in network edges and small devices.

Work on the Auction based network selection approaches

Explore the potential of Web 3.0 in networks

Understand Smart Contracts / Crypto Networks and implement them for different use-cases

Explore and get familiar with various open-source software libraries,

Key Skills And Experience

Impact

Good knowledge of ML concepts.

Good knowledge / worked with Reinforement/ Hybrid/ Transfer/Active / Speed up learning

Good knowledge regarding the machine learning concepts. Having knowledge on convolutional neural networks is an asset.

Being autonomous with open source libraries (TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch,‚Ä¶) and being fluent in Python are pre-requisite.

Large autonomy in the work, ability to ask for support, good communication, strong attention to details, ‚Ä¶ are essential skills for this type of internship.

It would be nice if you also had:

Intermediate/advanced knowledge of networks and 5G

Working knowledge of crypto networks

About Us

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:


One of the World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark


At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia‚Äôs employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Title: PreMaster Programm - interne Kommunikation
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Bei Bosch gestalten wir Zukunft mit hochwertigen Technologien und Dienstleistungen, die Begeisterung wecken und das Leben der Menschen verbessern. Unser Versprechen an unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter steht dabei felsenfest: Wir wachsen gemeinsam, haben Freude an unserer Arbeit und inspirieren uns gegenseitig. Willkommen bei Bosch.

Die Robert Bosch GmbH freut sich auf deine Bewerbung!

Stellenbeschreibung

Mit weltweit √ºber 12.000 Mitarbeitenden verfolgen wir bei Bosch Global Business Services ein gemeinsames Ziel: die Bereitstellung erstklassiger Dienstleistungen, die einen echten Mehrwert f√ºr Bosch schaffen.

Fortschrittliche Technologie und weltweite Zusammenarbeit sind unsere Treiber, durch die wir jeden Tag einen Unterschied machen. Durch unser einzigartiges Setup b√ºndeln wir alle kaufm√§nnischen Prozesse unter einem Dach. Das erm√∂glicht dir, in die spannende Welt von Bosch einzutauchen.

Deine Arbeit tr√§gt ma√ügeblich zur Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit von Bosch bei und gibt unseren Gesch√§ftsbereichen den n√∂tigen Freiraum, Technik f√ºrs Leben zu entwickeln.


Im Rahmen des PreMaster Programms verantwortest du vollumfassend die Standortkommunikation inclusive der Eventorganisation.
Die Verantwortung der Medienmodule sowie die Unterst√ºtzung und Durchf√ºhrung der Kommunikation an die Mitarbeitenden liegt fest in deinen H√§nden.
Zudem unterst√ºtzt du die weltweite Contentplanung und √ºbernimmst regelm√§√üige Redaktionsmeetings mit entsprechenden Stakeholdern.
Gemeinsam mit dem Team erarbeitest du Inhalte f√ºr die interne Kommunikation weltweit.
Nicht zuletzt arbeitest du kreativ bei der Erstellung von konformen Designs und Branding Elementen f√ºr Pr√§sentationen, Plattformen o.√§. mit und bringst hier deine Ideen proaktiv ein.


Qualifikationen


Ausbildung: abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Bachelor) im Bereich Kommunikation, Medien, Betriebswirtschaftslehre oder vergleichbarer Studiengang und die konkrete Absicht ein Masterstudium aufzunehmen
Erfahrungen und Know-how: Planung und Umsetzung von Kommunikationsstrategien, MS Office und MS Teams, Erfahrung im Texten und mit Adobe Illustrator oder In Design von Vorteil
Pers√∂nlichkeit und Arbeitsweise: deine Themen bringst du selbstbestimmt voran und du verstehst es, deine Arbeit gut zu strukturieren; mit vielen verschiedenen Stakeholdern erfolgreich zu kommunizieren, f√§llt dir leicht
Arbeitsalltag: bei uns kannst du hybrid arbeiten - wir treffen uns jede Woche ein bis zweimal im B√ºro
Sprachen: sehr gutes Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift


Zus√§tzliche Informationen

Das Bosch PreMaster Programm ist ein zweistufiges Qualifizierungsprogramm f√ºr engagierte Bachelor-Absolvent:innen, die das Ziel haben, ein Masterstudium zu absolvieren. Nach dem Bachelor bietet die erste Phase im Rahmen eines Gap Years von bis zu 12 Monaten praktische Erfahrung, um die fachlichen und unternehmerischen Zusammenh√§nge kennenzulernen. Die zweite Phase umfasst das Masterstudium und beinhaltet weitere Events und Seminare sowie Betreuung durch pers√∂nliches Mentoring auf dem Weg zum erfolgreichen Abschluss.

Vielfalt und Inklusion sind f√ºr uns keine Trends, sondern fest verankert in unserer Unternehmenskultur. Daher freuen wir uns √ºber alle Bewerbungen: unabh√§ngig von Geschlecht, Alter, Behinderung, Religion, ethnischer Herkunft oder sexueller Identit√§t.

Title: Super Computing Engineer (w/m/d)
Description:
How brave are you? We are a high-tech company providing machine tools and laser technology, and are looking for people who can face new challenges with a fresh mind. As an independent family company, we offer you the freedom and trust to put your brave ideas into practice. With you on board, we would like to power ahead with the digital networking of the manufacturing industry. Our passion and creative drive ensure that we are an innovative force ‚Äì across the globe at over 80 TRUMPF locations.

Ihre Aufgaben


Administration, Betrieb und Weiterentwicklung des aktuellen TRUMPF Supercomputing Framework, um die Nutzung weiter im Konzern zu verbreiten
Durchf√ºhrung von Projekten in cross-funktionalen Teams mithilfe agiler Methoden im Spannungsfeld zwischen IT und Entwicklung
Unterst√ºtzung der Entwickler in den Entwicklungsabteilungen bei der Umsetzung ihrer FEM-Simulationen, Machine Learning Algorithmen oder Quantensimulationen auf den Supercomputing Instanzen
Mitarbeit in Projekten als Supercomputing Spezialist mit den Aufgaben Analyse, Requirement Engineering, Konzeption und Implementierung von numerischen Simulationen verschiedener Fachrichtungen (Simulationsmodellierung, Implementierung von Simulationen, etc.)
√úbernahme von Verantwortung als Service Manager von Supercomputing Anwendungen bei TRUMPF
Durchf√ºhrung von Schulungen & Workshops, Gew√§hrleistung von Anwendersupport und Beratung der Fachbereiche bei der Entwicklung von Use Cases im internationalen Umfeld



Was wir suchen


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im MINT-Bereich oder vergleichbaren F√§chern sowie mehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung in diesem Bereich
Fundierte Erfahrung in den Bereichen Supercomputing und/oder FEM-Simulation, Machine Learning oder Quantum Simulation sowie den hierzu relevanten Programmiersprachen (Python, C++ oder Fortran) und Frameworks (z.B. Ansys, TensorFlow etc.)
Kenntnisse √ºber aktuelle L√∂sungen und Trends im Bereich Supercomputing, numerische Simulation, Machine Learning sowie Quantum Simulation w√ºnschenswert
Erfahrung im Bereich der Azure Cloud, Data Bricks Spark, Azure Machine Learning sowie im Cloud-Umfeld sind von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse



Was wir bieten


Hochmoderne Arbeitsumgebung mit neuester Technologie
Fr√ºhe Verantwortungs√ºbernahme und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben
Umfangreiches Schulungs- und Weiterbildungsangebot
Aktiv gef√∂rderte Work-Life-Balance, z. B. mit Sport- und Fitnessprogrammen
Respektvolle und wertsch√§tzende Unternehmenskultur



Haben wir Sie √ºberzeugt?

Bitte richten Sie Ihre Onlinebewerbung an Lena Domeyer. F√ºr R√ºckfragen erreichen Sie uns / unser Recruiting Team unter lena.domeyer@trumpf.com. Alle unsere ausgeschriebenen Stellen sind aktuell noch zu besetzen. Bitte beachten Sie, dass wir aus datenschutzrechtlichen Gr√ºnden keine Bewerbungen per E-Mail annehmen d√ºrfen. Auf unserer Karriereseite finden Sie alle FAQs rund um Ihre Bewerbung bei uns.

Title: Staff Data Engineer (Fintech team) (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
Description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose ‚Äì Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world

Get to Know Our Team

Fintech is one of the fastest growing areas in Agoda and we are rapidly expanding our tech team. We work closely with the finance business team and our Fintech product owners to reduce risk, drive efficiencies and move on new market opportunities in this exciting field. We have a wide range of projects from traditional finance or cutting-edge customer fintech. For example, reconciliation using Big Data technologies, growing and optimizing customer payments options, tax calculations in milli-second response times and a mesh of supplier payment options like vertical credit cards. Its a hot field and the perfect mix of data engineering and backend engineering.

The Opportunity

We are looking for engineers with experience in the fintech area. This can be a year or two at a fintech startup right through to an expert in this domain. You might have a background as ‚Äò back end ‚Äô or ‚Äòdata‚Äô engineer , either way we are looking for smart engineers who can be super agile, move fast and have an eye for detail. We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you are skilled in any of the technologies we work with and excited at building new fintech technology.

In this Role, you will get to


Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data systems
Build, administer and scale data processing pipelines
Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Scala, Spark, java, Golang, Python3, scripting (Bash/Python), Hadoop, SQL, S3 etc
Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data systems
Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality
Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks


What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
8+ years of experience in Data engineering
Good experience in Apache Spark
Expert level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala
Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable
A good understanding of data architecture principles preferred
Any other experience with Big Data technologies / tools
SQL experience
Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
Systems administration skills in Linux


It‚Äôs great if you have


Good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems
Experience working with Open-source products
Python/Shell scripting skills
Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person‚Äôs merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodation, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ talents coming from 90+ different nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enabling our customers to experience the world

Get to Know Our Team

Fintech is one of the fastest growing areas in Agoda and we are rapidly expanding our tech team. We work closely with the finance business team and our Fintech product owners to reduce risk, drive efficiencies and move on new market opportunities in this exciting field. We have a wide range of projects from traditional finance or cutting-edge customer fintech. For example, reconciliation using Big Data technologies, growing and optimizing customer payments options, tax calculations in milli-second response times and a mesh of supplier payment options like vertical credit cards. Its a hot field and the perfect mix of data engineering and backend engineering.

The Opportunity

We are looking for engineers with experience in the fintech area. This can be a year or two at a fintech startup right through to an expert in this domain. You might have a background as ‚Äò back end ‚Äô or ‚Äòdata‚Äô engineer , either way we are looking for smart engineers who can be super agile, move fast and have an eye for detail. We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you are skilled in any of the technologies we work with and excited at building new fintech technology.

In this Role, you will get to

  • Lead the team technically in improving scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data systems
  • Build, administer and scale data processing pipelines
  • Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: Scala, Spark, java, Golang, Python3, scripting (Bash/Python), Hadoop, SQL, S3 etc
  • Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing data systems
  • Design, build, test and deploy new libraries, frameworks or full systems for our core systems while keeping to the highest standards of testing and code quality
  • Work with experienced engineers and product owners to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data management / analysis tasks

What You‚Äôll Need To Succeed

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
  • 8+ years of experience in Data engineering
  • Good experience in Apache Spark
  • Expert level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala
  • Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable
  • A good understanding of data architecture principles preferred
  • Any other experience with Big Data technologies / tools
  • SQL experience
  • Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience
  • Systems administration skills in Linux

It‚Äôs great if you have

  • Good understanding of Hadoop ecosystems
  • Experience working with Open-source products
  • Python/Shell scripting skills
  • Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

Die Plattform verwendet neueste Technologien wie Kubernetes oder Apache Kafka mit unterschiedlichen Programmiersprachen wie Java, Python oder TypeScript. Title: AD System Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
In This Role, You Will


Be responsible for Momenta autonomous driving software stack's overall system behavior.
Drive the software architectural design and implementation for the adaption to EU specifics.
Leading challenging tasks, including but not limited to: system architecture design, integrate and release AD software stack, debug system level issues and ensure the performance, stability and security issues.
Drive the delivery of mass production projects.
Judge the development trend of autonomous driving software, and make a plan for in key areas such as chips, operating systems, middleware, etc.


We Would Like You To Have


Experience in the smart hardware industry (mobile phones/chips/communication/robots/autonomous driving/new energy vehicles and other industries)
In-depth understanding of engineering capabilities, able to control the entire process of software development, and familiar with large-scale mass production processes
Proficient in at least one of these fields: chip, Linux operating system, driver or ROS middleware
Proficient in software integration & release related tools and processes as well as programming languages C++ and Python.
Familiar with compiler, linker & loader, master at least one of boot, task scheduling, interrupt handling, memory management, file system, network protocol stack, etc.
Good at dealing with complex technical issues, have a mature methodology to solve system performance issues, stability issues
Experience in autonomous driving
Experience in startups is preferred
Fluent English skills


Why Momenta


High growth stage company
Partnerships with Mercedes-Benz, Bosch, GM, Toyota, SAIC
Competitive package depending on experience


About Us

We are committed to developing breakthrough AI solutions to push beyond the frontier of possibilities today and significantly improve people's quality of life.

We leverage our AI capabilities to develop autonomous driving solutions to enhance driving safety, convenience, and efficiency.

Through our autonomous driving technology and solutions, we aspire, in the next ten years, to save one million lives, save 100% driving time, and double the logistics and mobility efficiency

Title: Application Engineer - DFT / Tessent - EDA - (m/f/d)
Description:
Siemens EDA is a global technology leader in electronic design automation and part of Siemens Digital Industries Software.

Our software tools enable companies around the world to develop new, highly innovative electronic products faster and more cost-effectively. Our customers use our solutions to push the boundaries of technology to deliver better products in the increasingly complex world of chip, board and system design.

Join our team as ‚ÄúDFT Application Engineer (m/f/d)‚Äù in Munich, Germany (We can support remote across Europe but would need regular travel to Munich).

This role will support the Siemens EDA DFT products which will involve building relationships with our customers and helping them adopt and deploy the Tessent product lines. You will work closely with account managers to help drive the sales of all products. The job involves presenting, explaining, and discussing deep technical aspects of our products with senior technical managers and engineers in our customer base. The key technical activities will be product presentations, supporting customer evaluations, assisting with the adoption of advanced features of the products and design methodology support!

What Do You Need To Realize What Matters.

We are seeking a highly motivated Field Applications Engineer that will lead pre-sales and growth campaigns and activities for Tessent Silicon Lifecycle Solutions at Siemens' Strategic and potential customers. You will contribute to the business growth by assisting in the sales and deployment of Siemens EDA Test products as well as by increasing customer satisfaction and productivity both on-site and remotely.

Highly desirable skills include:


Effectively communicate with the worldwide team for alignment of priorities
Troubleshoot and remove technical obstacles
Self-learning
Develop and deliver technical presentations on product features and flows
Communicate customers' technical requirements to product marketing
Develop trusting and working relationships with customers
Familiar with time management
Flexibility to travel within the country and abroad
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Comfortable with getting hands-on with hardware platforms
Enjoys and values work-life balance


Candidate Profile:


Wide technical experience with large IC digital designs
Good track record of working with leading IC customers
DFT experience -Preferred
Sound knowledge of the semiconductor industry
Great teammate
Very good people and presentation skills
Highly motivated
Ability to take ownership and solving customer issues
Minimum University degree at B.Sc. level


We'd love to hear from you, so apply now on siemens.com!

We look forward to your application! Please use only our career platform, which you can access via "Apply now".

Send us an email to careers-DACH.sisw@siemens.com, if you would like to clarify initial questions with our recruiting team.

Come and learn more about Siemens Software: Mission / Vision and our software portfolio - or visit our homepage.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from people with disabilities. At Siemens, we believe people who‚Äôve had real experiences dealing with being different will excel as leaders. Let's foster a culture of creativity and innovation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

We are Siemens

A collection of over 377,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us shape tomorrow!

We offer a comprehensive reward package which includes a competitive basic salary, bonus scheme, generous holiday allowance, pension, and private healthcare.

Transform the everyday

Title: Bell Labs Internship - Autonomous Systems
Description:
Job Description

Family Description

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

Subfamily Description

The team you'll be part of

Bell Labs

Nokia Bell Labs is the world-renowned research arm of Nokia, having invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communications networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has produced nine Nobel Prizes, five Turing Awards and numerous other awards.

Bell Labs Summer Intern

Nokia Bell Labs is building the future of human experience and our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with industry leading experts, who solve the most formidable challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.

Education Recommendations

Enrolled student in Bachelor or Master (preferred) degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fields.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

What you will learn and contribute to

As part of our team, you will work on a subset of the following:

Design and implement research ideas in the filed of AI/ML

Work on developing solutions using Deep NN, Reinforement Learning, Speed up learning approaches, etc.

Work with different platforms and Proof of Concepts to validate the contributed / proposed solutions

Explore the potential of AI/ML in network edges and small devices.

Work on the Auction based network selection approaches

Explore the potential of Web 3.0 in networks

Understand Smart Contracts / Crypto Networks and implement them for different use-cases

Explore and get familiar with various open-source software libraries,

Key Skills And Experience

Impact

Good knowledge of ML concepts.

Good knowledge / worked with Reinforement/ Hybrid/ Transfer/Active / Speed up learning

Good knowledge regarding the machine learning concepts. Having knowledge on convolutional neural networks is an asset.

Being autonomous with open source libraries (TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch,‚Ä¶) and being fluent in Python are pre-requisite.

Large autonomy in the work, ability to ask for support, good communication, strong attention to details, ‚Ä¶ are essential skills for this type of internship.

It would be nice if you also had:

Intermediate/advanced knowledge of networks and 5G

Working knowledge of crypto networks

About Us

Job Description

Family Description

Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

Subfamily Description

The team you'll be part of

Bell Labs

Nokia Bell Labs is the world-renowned research arm of Nokia, having invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communications networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has produced nine Nobel Prizes, five Turing Awards and numerous other awards.

Bell Labs Summer Intern

Nokia Bell Labs is building the future of human experience and our interns will have the opportunity to learn from and work with industry leading experts, who solve the most formidable challenges confronting our world through disruptive innovation and research.

Education Recommendations

Enrolled student in Bachelor or Master (preferred) degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related fields.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

What you will learn and contribute to

As part of our team, you will work on a subset of the following:

Design and implement research ideas in the filed of AI/ML

Work on developing solutions using Deep NN, Reinforement Learning, Speed up learning approaches, etc.

Work with different platforms and Proof of Concepts to validate the contributed / proposed solutions

Explore the potential of AI/ML in network edges and small devices.

Work on the Auction based network selection approaches

Explore the potential of Web 3.0 in networks

Understand Smart Contracts / Crypto Networks and implement them for different use-cases

Explore and get familiar with various open-source software libraries,

Key Skills And Experience

Impact

Good knowledge of ML concepts.

Good knowledge / worked with Reinforement/ Hybrid/ Transfer/Active / Speed up learning

Good knowledge regarding the machine learning concepts. Having knowledge on convolutional neural networks is an asset.

Being autonomous with open source libraries (TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch,‚Ä¶) and being fluent in Python are pre-requisite.

Large autonomy in the work, ability to ask for support, good communication, strong attention to details, ‚Ä¶ are essential skills for this type of internship.

It would be nice if you also had:

Intermediate/advanced knowledge of networks and 5G

Working knowledge of crypto networks

Title: Active Directory Engineer
Description:
Job Number: R0200289

Active Directory Engineer

Key Role:

Design, install, configure, and maintain the organization‚Äôs Windows Server and Active Directory-based environments to meet the business needs. Apply advanced consulting skills, extensive technical expertise, and full industry knowledge to manage and maintain the current IDM, Linux, and AD infrastructure. Develop innovative solutions to complex problems, such as improving the current server configuration and infrastructure and migrating servers to current versions. Work without considerable direction and mentor and supervise team members. Support the management, uptime, and lifecycle of the organizations Active Directory architecture.

Basic Qualifications:


Experience in management, uptime, and lifecycle of the organizations Active Directory architecture
Knowledge of Active Directory or LDAP authentication and administration
Knowledge of IDM, Linux, AD infrastructure, and Outlook 365
Knowledge of a scripting language, such as PowerShell, Python, Bash, or Perl
Ability to assist the server team with day-to-day operations
TS/SCI clearance
Associate's degree and 7+ years of experience with Active Directory, or Bachelor's degree and 4+ years of experience with Active Directory



Additional Qualifications:


Experience administrating Azure Active Directory and single sign-on
Experience troubleshooting various Microsoft Windows Server platforms' roles and features
Bachelor's degree in a technical field
Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) Certification



Clearance:

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us‚Äîthat‚Äôs why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career.
