A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen‚Äôs culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you‚Äôll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we‚Äôll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life‚Äîat work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we‚Äôve compiled a list of resources so you‚Äôll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen‚Äôs benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual‚Äôs particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $75,600.00 to $172,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.


If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you‚Äôll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you‚Äôll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.



EEO Commitment

We‚Äôre an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change ‚Äì no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Description:
F√ºr unseren Gesch√§ftsbereich Deals suchen wir dich zum n√§chstm√∂glichen Zeitpunkt als Senior Consultant Valuation, Modeling & Analytics (w/m/d).

Das erwartet dich

Transaktionsberatung ‚Äì In unserem Valuation, Modeling and Analytics Team ber√§tst du nationale und internationale Unternehmen verschiedenster Gr√∂√üen und Industrien zu Transaktionen, Reorganisation oder Transformation.

Vielfalt ‚Äì Gemeinsam in deinem Team betreust du Kunden verschiedenster Gr√∂√üen und Industrien, vom b√∂rsennotierten Gro√ükonzern bis hin zum Start-up. Dabei pr√§gen aktuelle Marktentwicklungen (wie ESG) deine Projektarbeit und sorgen daf√ºr, dass du stets am Puls der Zeit bleibst.

Verantwortung ‚Äì In deinem Projektalltag ergeben sich laufend neue Herausforderungen, die es dir erm√∂glichen, abwechslungsreich, interdisziplin√§r und international zu arbeiten.

Das bringst du mit


Du hast dein Studium in Betriebswirtschaftslehre, (Wirtschafts-) Mathematik, (Wirtschafts-) Recht, (Wirtschafts-) Ingenieurwesen oder in einem √§hnlichen Bereich abgeschlossen.
Du verf√ºgst √ºber erste Berufserfahrungen im Bereich Transaktionsberatung oder Unternehmensbewertung.
Du kannst dich f√ºr Themen rund um Unternehmensbewertung, Accounting, Controlling oder Finance sowie Themen wie Interpreneurship und strategische Unternehmensf√ºhrung begeistern und hast Interesse an Financial Modelling.
Du hast Lust aktuelle Trendthemen wie Digitalisierung und Nachhaltigkeit in der Projektarbeit weiterzuentwickeln sowie dich in neue Gesch√§ftsmodelle einzudenken.
Du beherrschst die Sprachen Deutsch und Englisch flie√üend in Wort und Schrift.
Durch deine Kommunikationsst√§rke f√§llt es dir leicht, serviceorientiert auf unsere Kunden einzugehen.


Deine Benefits

Flexibilit√§t ‚Äì Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die M√∂glichkeit, im Home Office sowie in √ºber 40 L√§ndern zu arbeiten.

Masterf√∂rderung ‚Äì Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. Dar√ºber hinaus bieten wir die M√∂glichkeit einer Masterf√∂rderung f√ºr Examensmaster und Spezialisierungsmaster an.

Freizeit ‚Äì Dank eines Teilzeit-Blockmodells kannst du auch mehrmonatige Auszeiten in Form eines Sabbaticals nehmen. Zus√§tzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland √úberstunden auf einem pers√∂nlichen Jahresarbeitszeitkonto sammeln. Dabei bleibt es dir √ºberlassen, ob du dir deine √úberstunden auszahlen l√§sst oder flexibel in mehr Freizeit umwandelst.

Gesundheit ‚Äì Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von verg√ºnstigten Beitr√§gen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

Das ist noch nicht alles ‚Äì Wir m√∂chten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten m√∂glich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu l√∂sen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Als Teil unseres Deals Teams unterst√ºtzt du Unternehmen in allen Phasen des Deal Cycles: Vom Ermitteln geeigneter Kauf- bzw. Verkaufsoptionen bis zum Abschluss der Verhandlungen. Von der Unternehmens- und Marktanalyse, √ºber die Beratung bei steuerlichen und rechtlichen Fragestellungen bis hin zur Integration. Dadurch hast du stets den gesamten Transaktionsprozess im Blick und es gelingt uns im Team, die Risiken geplanter Deals zu minimieren sowie den Nutzen zu maximieren. Arbeite mit uns an spannenden Projekten, mit einer unglaublichen Themenvielfalt eingebunden in eine flexible Gestaltung deines Arbeitstages.

Kontakt

Du hast Fragen zu dieser Position oder deiner Bewerbung?

Melde dich gerne bei Katrin Breuer unter +49 69 95852297.

Title: Identity Management Engineer
Description:
Description

UNLEASH YOUR POTENTIAL

At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customers‚Äô success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainably. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.

Are you ready for your next career challenge?

Clearance Requirement: Top Secret with SCI

Are you interested in continuing your career in a mission focused environment? LEIDOS has established and upcoming positions in Stuttgart, Germany supporting the United States Africa Command. We are looking for experienced, innovative and motivated IT Specialists to support enablement USAFRICOM‚Äôs mission objectives.

What You‚Äôll Get To Do

LEIDOS has an excellent opportunity for an experienced, self-directedIdentity Management Engineer. This position supports a Department of Defense (DoD) organization, US AFRICOM, located OCONUS in Stuttgart, Germany, requiring relocation.

Responsibilities


Architect and design the configuration and operation of identity management solutions to support command initiatives and ensure interoperability with partners.
Optimize system operation and resource utilization, including performing system capacity analysis and planning.
Provide guidance to operations personnel for operation and troubleshooting of identity management systems.


The successful candidate must be able to communicate clearly and succinctly both written and orally, and present products and ideas in a business-like manner. The candidate will be required to work in dynamic fast paced environments that require team interaction and coordination of efforts. The candidate must be experienced in interfacing with both client managers and system users. The architect will be competent in all areas of identity and authentication. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible for designing and documenting the identity management solution for the command. The architect should speak well in front of an audience and be able to present design briefs to high-ranking personnel and be able to provide whiteboard training sessions and presentations to incoming personnel in a clear, concise but comprehensive manner.

Basic Qualifications


Hold an adjudicated Top-Secret Clearance with SCI and maintain it.
Professional certification meeting or exceeding DoD 8570.01 standards, such as IAT II (Security+ or equivalent).
BA/BS or equivalent experience (7+ years recent relevant experience).
5+ years supporting identity management solutions in a large enterprise DoD environment.
Deep understanding of the DoD Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) Strategy
Familiarity with identity reporting platforms and tools.
Understanding of directory services (e.g., Active Directory) and database management systems.
Experience coordinating the integration of new identity services into existing environments.
Ability to troubleshoot synchronization and workflow related issues.
Understanding of Windows Server design, configuration, and administration.
Knowledge of Group Policy Management (GPO) and application of Local Security Policies.
Familiarity with security settings/STIGs and other commercial security best practices.
TESA eligibility.


Preferred Qualifications


Knowledge and certification in Microsoft Azure
Experience with Identity solutions for example: Azure Identity Management,Microsoft Identity Management (MIM),Ping, SailPoint, Okta
ITIL v4 - Foundation certification.
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint.
Familiarity with non-Microsoft identity solutions.
Adaptability to changing circumstances and operational needs.
Understanding of Department of Defense Military standards.


Original Posting Date

2024-07-05

While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

Pay Range

Pay Range $101,400.00 - $183,300.00

The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline onlyand not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law.

Description:

Title: Frontend Developer - Intern (Remote Internship - IT)
Description:
Step into the dynamic realm of frontend development with an exclusive internship opportunity presented by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in frontend development!

If you're passionate about frontend development and equipped with creative problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the mentorship of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse frontend development projects, exploring concepts like responsive design, user experience optimization, and frontend frameworks. Gain hands-on experience in crafting user interfaces and bringing designs to life, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Schedule: Part-Time Internship
Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Aspiring frontend developers enthusiastic about crafting engaging user experiences and intuitive interfaces.
Creative thinkers adept at translating design concepts into functional frontend solutions.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team environments.
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, creative settings.
Enthusiastic learners committed to refining their skills in frontend development.
Proficiency in frontend technologies such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frontend frameworks (e.g., React, Vue.js) is highly valued.
Familiarity with UX/UI principles and responsive design techniques advantageous.
Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


Benefits

Your Contribution:


Contribute to frontend development projects, implementing responsive and user-friendly interfaces.
Collaborate with the development team to translate design mockups into interactive frontend solutions.
Assist in optimizing user experience and frontend performance across various devices and platforms.
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to frontend design and development challenges.
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in frontend development.
Support in documenting and presenting frontend solutions and recommendations.


Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in frontend development today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in frontend development!

Title: Identity Management Engineer
Description:
Job Number: R0200271

Identity Management Engineer

The Opportunity:

You know that the user is the last frontier for cyber security. It‚Äôs where the perimeter is drawn, and securing identities is pivotal in the fight against cybercriminals. As an IAM specialist, you have the skills and experience to keep hackers from taking data and breaking processes. We‚Äôre looking for someone like you to help our clients meet their missions without disruption.

As an Identity Management Engineer at Booz Allen, you‚Äôll play a critical role in the world of identity and access management and zero trust. In this role, you‚Äôll support large-scale IAM projects for our government clients. You‚Äôll interface with stakeholders and engineering teams to delve into the details and dependencies of critical processes and users‚Äô roles within them.

You‚Äôll analyze the identity lifecycle, articulating access requirements and defining enterprise identity records. You‚Äôll use your experience in IAM to design, deploy, and support systems that verify appropriate user privileges and manage credentials for accessing our clients‚Äô most valuable assets. From single sign-on to privileged access systems, you‚Äôll have the chance to implement enterprise-class solutions and stop adversaries in their tracks. In this role you will support US Africa Command by architecting and designing the configuration and operation of identity management solutions to support command initiatives and ensure interoperability with partners. Optimize system operation and resource utilization, including performing system capacity analysis and planning. Provide guidance to operations personnel for operation and troubleshooting of identity management systems

Apply today to help us as we configure systems and advance interoperability with our Command partners.

Join us. The world can‚Äôt wait.

You Have:


Experience coordinating the integration of new identity services into existing environments
Experience with security settings, STIGs, and commercial security best practices
Knowledge of Group Policy Management (GPO) and application of Local Security Policies
Knowledge of the DoD Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) Strategy
Knowledge of Windows Server design, configuration, and administration
TS/SCI clearance
Associate's degree and 7+ years of experience in Identity Management, or Bachelor's degree and 5+ years of experience in Identity Management
DoD 8570.01 IAT II Certification



Nice If You Have:


Experience with Identity solutions, such as Azure Identity Management, Microsoft Identity Management (MIM), Ping, SailPoint, or Okta
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint
Ability to work in an environment of changing circumstances and operational needs
Master's degree
Certified Identity and Access Manager (CIAM), Certified Identity Management Professional (CIMP), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), or ITIL v4 - Foundation certification



Clearance

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Create Your Career:

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us‚Äîthat‚Äôs why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen‚Äôs culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you‚Äôll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we‚Äôll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life‚Äîat work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we‚Äôve compiled a list of resources so you‚Äôll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen‚Äôs benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual‚Äôs particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $84,600.00 to $193,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen‚Äôs total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.

Work Model

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.


If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you‚Äôll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you‚Äôll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.



EEO Commitment

We‚Äôre an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change ‚Äì no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

Title: Working Student (m/f/d) ‚Äì Software Documentation
Description:
Job Title
Working Student (m/f/d) ‚Äì Software Documentation

Job Description

In this role you have the opportunity to
work closely with our software development team and support them with documentation and tracking progress of assignments.

Your role:

Review backlog and assigned tasks to different team members and keep track of any changes
Adapt the backlog in coordination with the software architect
Work closely with software developers and software architects


You are the right fit, if

You are currently studying in the field of software engineering, business informatics or a similar field of study
You have a good analytical skill set
You have strong documentation skills and the ability to translate changes into the backlog
You have a basic understanding of azure devops (beneficial)
You have very good English language skills, German language skills are beneficial


What We Offer


Salary: depending on your previous experience and your current studies, your salary will range between 17.07 ‚Ç¨/h and 19.12 ‚Ç¨/h
Annual leave: 30 days
Meals: Free drinks and reasonable prices in our canteen
Philips University: Wide range of professional training courses and for personal development
Philips in Balance: Various offers for physical and mental health as well as sports courses
Philips MyShop: Discount on Philips products
Purpose: Doing meaningful work with a great team
Culture: Informal culture, various team/cultural activities (on sustainability, diversity, ...) etc.


About Philips

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.


Learn more about our business here.
Discover our rich and exciting history here.
Learn more about our purpose here.


If you're interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

Philips is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, creed, citizenship, disability, and protected veteran or marital status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Juni who? üëã

We‚Äôre Juni. Born on the West Coast (of Sweden). Built for flexible working. And busy building a future where digital commerce is free from financial barriers. Want to be a part of it all?

What We Do ü§î

Juni gives online businesses the tools they need to save time, scale up and succeed. Our platform helps financial leaders take control of their cash flow, make better decisions and unlock the full potential of digital commerce. We even offer working capital to help them achieve their goals and dream up new ones. And that‚Äôs just for starters.

How & why we do it üöÄ

We give our people the same thing we‚Äôre building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what‚Äôs more ‚Äì make the most of it. We truly believe we‚Äôre making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.

Summary ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Join our data team on a mission to elevate Juni's data maturity, transforming it into an organization where comprehensive data is widely and easily utilized by all teams. We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic data team. As a Data Analyst, you will be working with a cross-functional team to identify key metrics, analyze and interpret data, create reports and dashboards, and provide valuable insights to enhance business performance and contribute to the overall data maturity of our organization.

Responsibilities üëè

In this role, you‚Äôll:


Analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business objectives.
Develop and maintain clear, informative reports and dashboards tailored to each business area. This includes building dashboards to track KPIs specific to each team (e.g., financial crime metrics, onboarding flow efficiency).
Work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support to optimize processes and improve performance.
Communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders in a clear, concise, and impactful manner.
Actively participate in the management of data pipelines for different departments, ensuring data quality and consistency.
Proactively identify and implement data-driven solutions to improve operational efficiency across the business.


Tooling ‚öôÔ∏è

We primarily use SQL and Python for programming. Our data platform is built on Google Cloud, AWS, and Airflow.

Qualifications üëë

What we need to see


Strong analytical skills and a passion for data.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with data extraction and transformation.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools (e.g., Metabase, Looker Studio).
Excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


What we‚Äôd love to see


Experience within the financial services industry or a comparable field (highly valued).
Hands-on experience with CRM and marketing data.
Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL processes.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud).


Your people üë•

We practice people-first culture. We‚Äôre real. We never wait. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn‚Äôt get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.

Your benefits üòç

We‚Äôre freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.


We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices at least two days per week.
Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
Stock options. We can‚Äôt promise you‚Äôll make a fortune. But we‚Äôll give it our very best shot.
Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
Global health insurance. You know. Just in case. Therapy & massage included.
Get sick? No stress. Feel better with unlimited paid sick leave.


The process üìÖ

CV screening > Get to know us call > Team interview(s) > Values interview > Offer (for some roles we‚Äôll include a task, but we‚Äôll notify you if this is the case)
Show more
HTML:
Juni who? üëã

We‚Äôre Juni. Born on the West Coast (of Sweden). Built for flexible working. And busy building a future where digital commerce is free from financial barriers. Want to be a part of it all?

What We Do ü§î

Juni gives online businesses the tools they need to save time, scale up and succeed. Our platform helps financial leaders take control of their cash flow, make better decisions and unlock the full potential of digital commerce. We even offer working capital to help them achieve their goals and dream up new ones. And that‚Äôs just for starters.

How & why we do it üöÄ

We give our people the same thing we‚Äôre building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what‚Äôs more ‚Äì make the most of it. We truly believe we‚Äôre making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.

Summary ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Join our data team on a mission to elevate Juni's data maturity, transforming it into an organization where comprehensive data is widely and easily utilized by all teams. We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic data team. As a Data Analyst, you will be working with a cross-functional team to identify key metrics, analyze and interpret data, create reports and dashboards, and provide valuable insights to enhance business performance and contribute to the overall data maturity of our organization.

Responsibilities üëè

In this role, you‚Äôll:

  • Analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business objectives.
  • Develop and maintain clear, informative reports and dashboards tailored to each business area. This includes building dashboards to track KPIs specific to each team (e.g., financial crime metrics, onboarding flow efficiency).
  • Work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support to optimize processes and improve performance.
  • Communicate data-driven insights to stakeholders in a clear, concise, and impactful manner.
  • Actively participate in the management of data pipelines for different departments, ensuring data quality and consistency.
  • Proactively identify and implement data-driven solutions to improve operational efficiency across the business.

Tooling ‚öôÔ∏è

We primarily use SQL and Python for programming. Our data platform is built on Google Cloud, AWS, and Airflow.

Qualifications üëë

What we need to see

  • Strong analytical skills and a passion for data.
  • Proficiency in SQL and experience with data extraction and transformation.
  • Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools (e.g., Metabase, Looker Studio).
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex data insights in a clear and concise manner.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

What we‚Äôd love to see

  • Experience within the financial services industry or a comparable field (highly valued).
  • Hands-on experience with CRM and marketing data.
  • Familiarity with data warehousing and ETL processes.
  • Experience with cloud-based data platforms (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud).

Your people üë•

We practice people-first culture. We‚Äôre real. We never wait. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn‚Äôt get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.

Your benefits üòç

We‚Äôre freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.

  • We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices at least two days per week.
  • Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
  • Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
  • Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
  • Stock options. We can‚Äôt promise you‚Äôll make a fortune. But we‚Äôll give it our very best shot.
  • Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
  • Global health insurance. You know. Just in case. Therapy & massage included.
  • Get sick? No stress. Feel better with unlimited paid sick leave.

The process üìÖ

CV screening > Get to know us call > Team interview(s) > Values interview > Offer (for some roles we‚Äôll include a task, but we‚Äôll notify you if this is the case)

Title: Product Data Analyst To Retail Bi & Analytics ‚Äì Decide & Go Value Stream
Description:
Company Description

Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.

The mission of the Retail Unit at Sales is to grow and transform the portfolio by building exceptional store experiences ‚Äì securing high productivity, financial resilience and a strong brand. This is done through holistic retail strategies, fueled by tech innovation and enabled through our global network of teams and partners.

Job Description

The Retail BI & Analytics team is a team gathering data competencies within the newly formed Retail unit including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Analysts. The Product Data Analyst works closely together with the product teams, structured as Value Streams, within the Retail Tech department. The role includes supporting the Value Stream in setting KPIs and creating business cases for the products in that product area, as well as conducting data analysis, A/B testing and creating the BI reports needed to evaluate the product performance and guide the Value Stream‚Äôs work forward.

As a Product Data Analyst working towards the Decide & Go Value Stream, you will be a key enabler to explore and support data driven product development for the checkout products in store: physical and self-checkout, as well as mobile checkout solutions. You will build BI dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs, perform A/B tests, provide analysis and insights to support your colleagues with data and insight-driven decision making on strategic directions.

In the role you will:


Be a crucial person for your colleagues to understand how our product development impacts the business
Proactively support product development with analytical insights and recommendations which helps to drive innovations and achieve strategic advantage
Perform analysis on large sets of data to extract impactful insights that will inform and guide development efforts within the Value Stream as well as supporting in creating and following up on business cases related to the products within he Value Stream
Support the product teams within the Value Stream with setting KPIs and following up on performance through reporting and A/B testing
Translate business requirements into analytical requirements and design analytics and reporting solutions together with global business stakeholders as well as regions to maximize their impact
Interact and influence the analytical community within H&M to explore and enable new data areas to realize even more business potential



Qualifications

As a person we believe that you are a true role model of H&M values and that you are an ambitious, flexible and communicative team player. Your positive drive and curiosity sees the potential and opportunities in our way of working and wants to understand, test, scale and learn. By having a business and customer-oriented mindset with the motivation to constantly improve, achieve targets and drive agenda forward you are key player in the team. You like taking responsibility, prioritize and enjoy working in a changing environment

Additionally, we see that:


You have an academic degree in a quantitative field, such as engineering, business, economics, finance or math/statistics
You have developed strong analytical skills through relevant work experience with at least three years of experience working as Data Analyst, Product Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar roles
You are experienced in using programming languages like R or Python for data analysis
You have deep knowledge in how to use tools such as Power BI and SQL and are confident in working with large data sets and extracting data by writing complex queries.
You have experience in A/B testing
You are a clear communicator who can easily translate complex analytical methods to business stakeholders and are comfortable in presenting results of your analyses to different stakeholders
You are a team player and enjoy sharing your knowledge with colleagues



Additional Information

This is a permanent role, based in Stockholm and reporting to Tobias Klingberg, Head of Retail BI & Analytics. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV through this job posting. If you have any questions about the role and/or the process, please contact Sarah Assem.

H&M Group is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Why kindly ask you to not attach cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Om tj√§nsten

How do we best source energy for fossil-free electricity sales?

Providing our customers with fossil-free electricity at competitive prices means we need to understand their needs and the market and be able to handle the attached risks. The Commodities Intelligence department is currently looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join us on our journey.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will belong to the Commodities Intelligence department which is responsible for the Financial Risk Management, Power Pricing and development of our BI-tools for our Sales segments. The team work with all customers and segments in the Nordic countries and you will have colleagues in both Sweden and Finland. Besides your team colleagues, you will work closely with Portfolio managers, Business control, Vattenfall IT and lots of other people.

Your main responsibility as a Business Intelligence Analyst is to develop and take responsibility for the teams data tables and BI tools, which are crucial for our financial risk management, business analysis and reporting.

The main focus of this position is to build, develop and secure quality in new or existing Power BI reports. You will work with the reports from start to finish, from ordering raw data from the Source systems to publishing a user-friendly power BI report that meets the stakeholder's demand for follow-up, risk management, analysis and decision-making.

To be able to apply the correct business logic in the data transformation, it is important to have or gain a deep understanding of the electricity market and electricity Sales business. It is also important to be able to work in a cross-functional environment where stakeholders has different requirements and needs.

Our ambition is that your work will form the basis for improved risk management and increased quality in our analysis and reports.

Din bakgrund

To be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following:


University degree in engineering, finance, mathematics or other similar field of education
Experience of SQL- programming, preferably Azure / Databricks
Experience of data modelling and data management
Good command of written and spoken English


It¬¥ll be beneficial if you also have:


Experience working in the electricity market
Experience working in sales and marketing settings
Experience from Power BI
Additional programming knowledge, preferably Python.
API management
Experience in financial derivatives
Experience working in a scrum team and have related skill set
Good command of written and spoken Swedish


As a person you have an analytical mindset and the ability to quickly assess and understand relations between involved systems and tools. You¬¥re customer-focused and business-minded, as well as a good team player with good communication skills.

Mer information

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‚ÄòAsk and Share‚Äô concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.

Location: Solna.

We welcome your application including cover letter and CV in English via the link below. Last day to apply is August 13th 2024. The advertising period has been extended due to summer holidays and we¬¥ll review all applications when the application has closed.

We¬¥re using tests in this recruitment process and an online test will be sent to all applicants as a first step in the recruitment process when the application has closed.

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager Andr√© Hellstr√∂m, andre.hellstrom@vattenfall.com. If you have questions regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Jennifer Wikstr√∂m, jennifer.wikstroem@vattenfall.com.

Trade Union Representatives, to be reached through Vattenfall‚Äôs switchboard, +46 (8) 739 50 00, are Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Mikael Mukka (SEKO) and Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna).

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europe‚Äôs largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato‚Äôs local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato‚Äôs offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What it‚Äôs like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Show more

  • Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
  • Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
  • Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
  • Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
  • And much much more!

What it‚Äôs like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Commercial Data Analyst
Description:
As a Commercial Data Analyst at Desenio, you will play a crucial role in shaping Desenio‚Äôs future by supporting key analytics projects across our Marketing and E-commerce teams. You will report directly to our Chief Commercial Officer. You will tackle some of the most challenging problems in our business, bringing data-driven insights and clarity to complex business units.

What You Will Do


Dashboard Development: Create and maintain dashboards and reports to track performance across marketing channels and e-commerce platforms, ensuring clear communication of insights to stakeholders.
Data Analysis: Conduct thorough analysis to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform digital strategies and resource allocation.
Data Visualization: Experience creating clean and effective data visualizations and dashboards using modern BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Insights & Recommendations: Extract actionable insights from data and provide recommendations across the Commercial department.
Technical Proficiency: Skilled in tracking, Google Tag Manager, Excel, and Google Sheets. Experience with APIs for data fetching and dashboard automation.
Experimentation: Clear understanding how to design and conduct experiments and A/B testing.
Commercially Focused: Comprehensive knowledge of digital marketing concepts, customer acquisition processes, and the technical aspects of the customer journey on e-commerce websites.
KPI Tracking and Visualization: Ability to clearly present live data around key performance indicators (KPIs) across digital marketing and our e-commerce platform.
Artificial Intelligence: Familiarity with LLMs and leveraging AI for data analysis to derive actionable insights and alerts is preferred.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to changing priorities.


Tools you will use:


Google Analytics 4
Google Tag Manager
Looker Studio
Social Media Ads Manager


Who We Are Looking For


Undergraduate Degree in mathematics, business, economics, marketing, or a related field
Minimum 2 years of experience in e-commerce, analytics, or a similar data-driven role.
Strong technical proficiency in data visualization.
Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.
Prior experience in e-commerce is highly desirable.


The ideal candidate for this role is highly ambitious, technical, and data-driven, balancing analytical rigor with the agility to make swift, impactful decisions. You continuously asks questions and seeks to understand the "why" behind the data. You enjoy working with ohters, sharing insights to achieve common goals.

What We Offer‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

At Desenio you‚Äôll be working together with our young, multicultural team in the company‚Äôs beautiful premises at Stockholm‚Äôs S√∂dermalm. We believe that together, in the actual meet and interaction we achieve greatness but also that the employee should enjoy flexibility in terms of work place.‚ÄØ‚ÄØThe company culture is including and meant to support your personal development. You will be part of a dynamic and change driven organization where we all work together with the aim to make affordable art available for everyone.‚ÄØ

PRACTICAL INFORMATION‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Start date: As soon as possible‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Extent: This is a permanent position with an initial probation period of 6 months. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Location: S√∂dermalm, Stockholm.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

We will start selecting and interviewing right away and the position might be filled before last application date. We don't accept applications through email.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.

Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations and the mission of the Data and Analytics craft is to turn that raw data into actionable insights.

We are now looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our flagship Angry Birds 2 game in the Stockholm studio. Coming into this role, you will build an understanding of the game and different business levers and use that knowledge to build new game features, optimising existing ones, structure vague problem statements in collaboration with stakeholders such as the Game lead, product managers, designers and producers.

The team is located in our studio in the centre of Stockholm and works in a hybrid mode (2-3 days per week onsite). Currently not based in Sweden? No problem at all, we will help you with the relocation and work permit if needed!

You will have impact and fun at work by:


Bringing an objective perspective and recommendations to all phases of decision making, leveraging your technical skills to mine raw data for valuable information
Constantly designing and running in-game A/B test experiments, helping the team to find options leading to better game monetization performance and our audience satisfaction
Creating dashboards and reports to help the game team understand your findings
Proactively working with data exploration and looking for opportunities to improve gameplay experience
Working closely with peer Data Analysts, Product Managers and Project Leads to continuously improve how we are interpreting game metrics and making decisions
Coaching and sharing best practices between colleagues in the data craft and whole game teams


Experience and skills we are looking for:


High proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or R
Solid understanding of statistics
Experience in product analysis and experiments design including A/B testing
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Presentation and collaboration skills with proven ability to present data and provide actionable recommendations to senior stakeholders
Prior experience in mobile games or apps with large audiences will help you to hit the ground running but not a must


Please apply with your CV in English. We look forward to meeting you!





We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.

At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.

What to expect when you join us

Meet the Rovians

About Rovio

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre EQT Ventures, the European venture firm with a global outlook, supporting founders of generation-defining companies from ideation to explosive growth. Built by some of the world‚Äôs most driven founders and operators, our distributed team operates on the ground in Stockholm, London, New York, Berlin, and Paris.




Currently investing out of a ‚Ç¨1.1B fund, the largest early-stage fund ever raised in Europe, we‚Äôre one of the most active VC firms globally and have partnered with over 100 founding teams, including Wolt, Einride, Handshake, The Exploration Company, Sana Labs, 1x Robotics, and Cleo.




About the Role

Join our newly formed AI team as a Quantitative Analyst, and play a pivotal role in extending EQT‚Äôs leadership in AI-driven VC. Our systems help us discover the most ambitious entrepreneurs earlier, and support them in solving the world‚Äôs most pressing problems by harnessing the full potential of EQT‚Äôs global network and technology initiatives. The startup landscape moves faster than any other industry, and our AI team thrives on speed and rapid iteration to solve problems effectively.




As a Quantitative Analyst, you‚Äôll uncover insights from vast sets of public, commercial and proprietary data, build a deep understanding of new markets and emerging technologies, and build models that automate key parts of our investment process. You‚Äôll collaborate with all investment teams at EQT Ventures, ensuring insights drive action and empowering us to make quicker, data-driven decisions.




Key responsibilities

Sourcing great investment opportunities by training algorithms and using innovative analysis on a mix of public, commercial and proprietary data, building systems to make this process repeatable and scalable.
Develop predictive models that quantify market signals, company traction metrics, and community sentiment to identify startups with outlier founders working on breakthrough technology.
Continually assess and integrate state-of-the-art technology, tools and practices, keeping our team at the forefront of the industry and maintaining EQT‚Äôs competitive edge.
Collaborate with Investors, Analysts and Operational Support at EQT Ventures ‚Äì assessing internal EQT data sources as well as external data troves, making sure we have the right insights at the right time.
Build internal ‚Äúspecial projects‚Äù where algorithms, technology and data drive portfolio and team efficiency, performance and productivity.




About you

This role demands a technical and entrepreneurial mindset, a relentless pursuit of excellence, and a deep passion for data and analytics. You should have a strong interest in startups, investments, new technologies, entrepreneurship, and a love for AI.




We believe that you have a tinkering mindset, an urge to build innovative solutions, and that you like to optimize for velocity, while constantly learning in an intellectually stimulating and challenging environment.




Mindset & traits

Techno-Optimist: firmly held belief in technology‚Äôs ability to transform society for the better, and committed to pushing the boundaries of VC to accelerate progress.
Gets Shit Done: turn plans into action and ideas into reality, efficiently and with flair; facing a locked door, you either kick it down, learn how to pick locks, or find a window.
Compulsive Maker: possess a hands-on mentality, probably tinkering with new AI tools and personal projects in your spare time, and always trying new things.
Maths & Stats Aficionado: you hold a deep love for mathematical modeling, statistical analysis and their applications on real-world data. It wouldn‚Äôt surprise us if you have a framed picture of Gauss, Euler or Feynman on your wall.
Super Communicator: can understand, distill and explain complex ideas to a layman. You like the idea of creating a presentation for executive MBAs on topics like LLMs, quantum statistics or loss functions.




Tech & tools we love (and that can help you thrive in the role)

Programming: Python, Javascript
Tabular data: Pandas, Google sheets
Machine Learning & Deep Learning: Scikit-Learn, xgboost, pytorch, keras
Visualization: Streamlit, plotly
SQL & Big Data: dbt, BigQuery, Spark, duckdb
AI Tools: Llamaindex, Pinecone, Anyscale, Weights & Biases, Kubeflow




Join us now on our mission to revolutionize how data and AI is being used in early stage VC!




EQT Ventures is working together with Safemind as an exclusive partner to manage this recruitment process.

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Description:
Fortum Consumer Solutions (CoS) is the largest electricity retail business in the Nordics, with approximately 2.2 million customers across different brands in Finland, Sweden, Norway, Poland and Spain. The core of our business is to provide electricity and related value-added services as well as new digital services to both private and enterprise customers. Join us and get the opportunity to shape the future of one of the largest energy retail companies in Europe!

At CoS, we are now strengthening our core data team with a digital data specialist. In this role you will join our international data team, working with digital product development, analytics, AI and our new customer data platform (CDP). As a digital data specialist, you will be looking at our data from an analytical point of view, identifying opportunities, insights and helping creating data dashboards to help visualize performance. You will also act as a bridge between users, business, development and power CoS towards a more data driven future in order to deliver better services for our customers.

You will report to the manager of data and customer offering and can be located at any of our main campuses in Stockholm, Oslo or Espoo.

About The Role

Your responsibilities:



Plan and develop the use of digital data from a range of sources and platforms to enhance our digital products.
Help to drive and identify digital data opportunities within Artificial Intelligence.
Be proactive to find market leading solutions to visualize digital data and pursue insight for stakeholders within digital development, customer offering, support, UX, marketing and other digital functions.
Drive innovation and development of digital data analytics in CoS, especially within mobile, web and other digital tracking tools.
Optimizing digital and data product development within analytics and drive digital data ownership to achieve business value.
Be responsible for digital data analytics at CoS in Europe.



About You

To succeed and thrive in this role, we see that you have:



Bachelor's degree in information management, data analytics, computer science, or a similar field.
3+ years‚Äô experience working with digital tracking tools such as Google 4, Adobe or similar.
Ability to read, interpret, and verify data.
Excellent communication, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of tag management tools (Google Tag Manager) as well as Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools e.g. DataStudio, Tablea or similar.
Microsoft Azure, Power BI and SQL skills appreciated.
You are business savvy and can act cross functionally within CoS to deliver and scale best practice through collaboration and insights.
Understanding of users and customer needs.
Good understanding of the agile mindset and values.



As a person you are a curious, forward looking and motivated by change and new challenges. People in your workplace find your communication open and transparent and you are good at building trust with other people. You are structured and solution-oriented with an analytical mindset.

We offer you

This is an opportunity to be part of a transformation within one of Europe¬¥s largest energy retail companies. The digital data specialist will be a central part of our data team and included in an inspiring and open working culture. Your data-driven and customer centric way of working will fundamentally change the way we sell and customers buy.

We actively encourage job rotation and development activities across the company with open leadership as our guiding principle. You will join a team of great individuals, where continuous learning is a virtue!

Interested?

Submit your application by 31.7.2024 at the latest. Please note that the recruitment is on hold during the summer. We will begin actively screening early August and hire as soon as the right candidate is found.

If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Senior Manager Data Tore Andre Godager, at tore.andre.godager@fortum.com or +47‚ÄØ906 45‚ÄØ553 during week 28.

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com‚ÄØ

For contact with union representatives in Fortum, please contact:

Sami Russom, Unionen: Sami.Russom@fortum.com or +46768716608.

Henrik S Tedeby: henrik.s.tedeby@fortum.com or +46722040354.

Title: LIA - Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Carla

We believe that more people should be able to drive electric. Therefore, we have set out to build the safest, most convenient and transparent way to sell, buy, or lease an electric car. Carla was founded in 2020 in Stockholm, with strong VC backing. We have since then sold and delivered thousands of cars all over Sweden, and can boast over having the happiest customers in the car industry!

Who are we looking for?

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst Intern who is passionate about data and eager to dive into a variety of tasks. The ideal candidate is driven, digitally savvy, and possesses excellent written communication skills. A ‚Äúdoer‚Äù mentality is essential, as you‚Äôll be handling diverse responsibilities ranging from data analysis to visualization.

We Believe That The Ideal Candidate Have


Strong written communication skills (in Swedish and English)
Basic knowledge of SQL, BigQuery and Analytics
Experience using Excel and Google Sheets
Ability to analyze and interpret data to support marketing decisions
Create basic visualizations in tools such as Looker


What can we offer?

We promise a steep learning curve within digital marketing and e-commerce with a particular focus on data analysis. As a Data Analyst Intern at Carla, you will be given a great opportunity to learn, explore and gain experience within the field of data analysis to create real impact for a fast-growing start-up company.

Title: Senior Customer Insight Analyst
Description:
Job ID:¬†24990¬†

¬†

Would you like to help Nordea drive customer-centric decision making? We are looking for a senior customer insight analyst with a flair for behavioural data and data analysis to support us in delivering some of the major customer satisfaction surveys at Nordea.

¬†

We are creating a work environment where we develop and adapt to what we observe, in order to keep the customer voice at the core of the business and grow together. To help with this objective, we need your ideas and unique background!

¬†

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast ‚Äì and we want to help our customers to succeed by providing them with the financial solutions of tomorrow.¬†

¬†

About this opportunity:

Welcome to Customer Behavioural Insights, a truly Nordic team working across all four Scandinavian countries to deliver strategic customer insights based on both qualitative and quantitative methods, often in collaboration. We support internal departments ranging from strategic marketing, communication and branding, to business development, service- and product- strategy teams. The team is responsible for delivering overall key performance indicators of customer satisfaction at Nordea, together with other satisfaction measures such as brand perception.¬†

¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

Support our team in delivering existing recurring customer surveys
Implement and test surveys in our survey tool
Continuously improve existing processes, methods and data outputs
Transform your findings into tangible business insights and simple, to the point visualizations
Communicate and present your insights to key stakeholders

You‚Äôll join a team driven by curiosity and exploration, with team members from a broad range of academic backgrounds. All of us have a keen interest in learning new methods and to build upon each other‚Äôs areas of specialization. The position is based in Helsinki or Stockholm.¬†

¬†

Who you are:

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

¬†

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Are more interested in what the numbers tell you than the numbers themselves. You have a sense for how to translate large data sets into actionable insights. Can think both analytically and intuitively to uncover user needs
Have a technical and mathematical mindset with attention to detail but do not lose focus on the overall goals
Are naturally curious and efficient minded, and whilst being meticulous you also constantly search for ways to improve processes and deliveries
Like to collaborate with others and thrive on feedback and continuous improvement
Build relations professionally across the organisation to improve your own work

Your experience and background:

Proven track record and experience working with quantitative research methods, including conducting and analysing surveys
Hands-on knowledge in applying data science and statistical methods to survey data - prior work with sampling and weighting methods is a plus
Working knowledge with statistical tools, especially R and/or willingness to learn R
Experience with content analysis of open comments is an advantage
Experience with presenting and communicating results to diverse audiences
Experience using Qualtrics is an advantage¬†
Fluency in one local Nordic language is also an advantage

¬†

¬†If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

¬†

Submit your application no later than 26/07/2024. Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

¬†

For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact recruiting manager Mats Leifler mats.leifler@nordea.se or Katrin Werner katrin.maren.werner@nordea.com Vacations during week 27-31. Interviews can start from week 32.

¬†

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

Only for candidates in Sweden:¬†For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se ¬†or SACONordea@nordea.com

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Title: Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data | SEB, Stockholm
Description:
The industry of Banking is changing rapidly. We are going through changes in the cash management area with new competitors, technological development and infrastructure upgrades.

Do you want to join a professional and passionate team that is in the process of further developing the analytical capabilities within SEB Corporate Banking and beyond? Customer expectations in the digital era is putting new requirements on our existing and future data driven advisory products. In this transition we aim to automate, simplify and implement self-service advanced analytics in all areas. We are now looking for a Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data . As part of our Google Cloud migration journey, you will help define account data products that support our reporting and analytics use cases.

About the role:

As a Data Steward, you will champion data quality, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance for our account data and products. You'll develop and implement innovative data governance frameworks and best practices. By collaborating closely with stakeholders across departments, you'll define and refine data requirements and standards, driving powerful analytics initiatives and turning raw data into actionable insights. Monitoring key data quality metrics and KPIs, you will ensure continuous improvement and swiftly resolve any data discrepancies. Additionally, you'll play a pivotal role in our Google Cloud migration journey, defining account data products to enhance our reporting and analytics capabilities in cloud. To your support you will work in close collaboration with the information architects and account product specialists to reach our desired state of defined account products, account data products and schemas.

The role reports to the Head of Data and Analytics within Cash Management. We are part of Corporate Banking, LC&FI and our tasks and responsibility often span across the SEB Group.

As a Data Steward and Account Data Specialist you will be responsible for:


Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with regulatory and internal standards.
Collaborating with stakeholders to define data requirements and standards for account data products.
Monitoring and report on data quality metrics and KPIs.
Identifying and resolve data-related issues and discrepancies.
Supporting reporting and data analytics initiatives to drive insights and business decisions.
Continuously improve data management processes and tools.
Collaborating with other data stewards, information architects, analysts, data owners, and our tech development teams.


To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


Documented university degree or equivalent within areas such as finance, IT or engineering.
A curious mindset and are a positive team player.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Deep understanding of data quality principles and best practices.
An attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
The ability to manage your time & prioritize.
Account product knowledge.
The ability to balance between reactive and strategic work.
Track record in data management, data stewardship, or data governance within the banking sector.
Data modelling knowledge, which is considered a bonus.


What we offer:

We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual‚Äôs career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:


Work-life balance with the principle of office first.
Attractive compensation and benefits.
Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
Excellent office environment.
Agile and modern ways of working.
Deliver world-class service to customers.


Do you want to be part of SEB?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August 20th 2024. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the role. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Eln√§s, jonatan.elnas@seb.se .

Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual during the summer due to the holidays.

Learn more about working at SEB: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
