  • Supporting reporting and data analytics initiatives to drive insights and business decisions.
  • Continuously improve data management processes and tools.
  • Collaborating with other data stewards, information architects, analysts, data owners, and our tech development teams.

To thrive in this role, we believe you have:

  • Documented university degree or equivalent within areas such as finance, IT or engineering.
  • A curious mindset and are a positive team player.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
  • Deep understanding of data quality principles and best practices.
  • An attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
  • The ability to manage your time & prioritize.
  • Account product knowledge.
  • The ability to balance between reactive and strategic work.
  • Track record in data management, data stewardship, or data governance within the banking sector.
  • Data modelling knowledge, which is considered a bonus.

What we offer:

We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual‚Äôs career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:

  • Work-life balance with the principle of office first.
  • Attractive compensation and benefits.
  • Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
  • Excellent office environment.
  • Agile and modern ways of working.
  • Deliver world-class service to customers.

Do you want to be part of SEB?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August 20th 2024. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the role. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Eln√§s, jonatan.elnas@seb.se .

Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual during the summer due to the holidays.

Learn more about working at SEB: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Title: Data Modeler
Description:
We are looking for a Data Modeler with below expertise:

Key Competencies:

‚Ä¢ Good experience in Data Modelling (Data vault, 3NF, Relational Data Model & Dimensional Data Model, Star/Snowflake Schema) using data modelling tools such ERWIN, IBM etc.

‚Ä¢ Design and build logical data model and physical data model.

‚Ä¢ Good understand of banking domain so he can understand the source systems and translate into target architecture.

‚Ä¢ Help ETL developers in creating high level and low-level mappings.

‚Ä¢ Good understanding of RBDMS and Data warehouse housing concepts

‚Ä¢ Updating and optimizing local and metadata models.

‚Ä¢ Evaluating implemented data systems for variances, discrepancies, and efficiency.

‚Ä¢Troubleshooting and optimizing data systems.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What We Do At Qliro

At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both here in Sweden and the Nordics.

What Your Team Does

We're a data team responsible for the data platform that powers Qliro's Analytics and data producs, handling over 50 TB of data! We believe great work can be done anywhere, that's why we offer flexible remote work. Join us and leverage your data expertise to build high-impact data products that fuel business decisions and power our machine learning models serving millions of customers.

How you'll make a difference:


Wrangle massive datasets related to Payments.
Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for efficient data flow.
Champion data quality and ensure its accuracy for critical business decisions.
Utilize cutting-edge tools like AWS, Snowflake, GitLab, and dbt to build a robust data platform.
Partner with cross-functional teams (Product, Finance, Credit and Tech teams) to translate data into data products and building the foundation for Analytics.


What You Bring To The Team


You are highly experienced in the majority of our techstack, but most importantly in SQL, Python, dbt and Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouse)
You bring value to the business by using data, preferably within financial and/or related industries
You are logical and analytical minded and are able to communicate technical content to end users
Passionate about solving complex business problems by building data products with high quality and velocity
You are someone who continuously seeks improvements, enjoys learning new tools and techniques and having fun together as a data team.


Our stack:

Snowflake, dbt, Airflow, Docker, AWS & Tableau

Does this sound like your next role? What are you waiting for - apply now!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role:

Development of SADP, IDPs. Ensuring Data Quality. Adopting to Data mesh capabilities. These are all covered in our One Data Foundation Initiative, but also working for other stack ranked initiatives like BTI-292, BTI-146, BTI-147 and BTI-260.

Essential requirements:

Strong GCP skills with understanding of different Google services, when to use which service, their cost implications. Data warehouse concepts, SQL, Python, DBT and Terraform.

Leadership/experience level: Mid Senior to Senior Data Engineer

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal ‚Äì to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.

Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.

As a Data Engineer at Sambla Group you will be part of the responsibility over the orchestration, security work and integrations of all things data. You will get to work with all departments at Sambla Group, and work with modern cloud based technologies in GCP such as BigQuery, Pubsub, Cloud run, Cloud Functions, Cloud Build and artifact registry as well as other tools like dbt, prefect and Terraform. You will be part of the Data Engineering team and report to the Head of Data Engineering.

Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With


Design, build and administer data integrations and data pipelines that feed our data products (streaming, batch, api endpoints).
Ensure data security and GDPR compliance.
Ensure data quality, data governance and product uptime.
Develop and maintain Data Platform and Data Warehouse (BigQuery)
Architect cloud solutions and data models.



Must Have


1-3 years of work experience within data engineering or similar roles.
Working experience in Python, eg. pyspark/polars, flask/fastapi.
Working experience with SQL, e.g. joins, group by, CTEs, Window/Analytic Functions.
Working experience in cloud technologies, (GCP/AWS), preferably in GCP
Working experience with version control e.g. Git.
Working experience in stakeholder management, both technical/non-technical.
Project management experience, eg. screening/scoping/planning.



Nice To Have


Experience with CI/CD (CircleCI, Jenkins, Github Actions).
Experience with logging, monitoring and observability.
Experience from the Fintech industry.
Understanding of Data Modelling & Data Warehousing, e.g. dimensional modelling, data vault, SCD etc.
Understanding of the marketing data space and the platforms used (SEM, Social, Affiliate, Marketing Automation etc.).
Programming skills in Scala, Java, Rust or similar.
Experience with coaching coworkers.



What We Offer


Business in mind & people at heart ‚Äì we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people‚Äôs everyday lives.



Please note!

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks‚Äô offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

F√∂r oss √§r kompetens viktigt, men vi v√§rdes√§tter √§ven personliga egenskaper, driv och vilja h√∂gt. S√• skulle du inte uppfylla alla kriterier, uppmanar vi dig att s√∂ka √§nd√•! Dessutom tror vi att du kan relatera till v√•ra tre v√§rdeord √∂dmjukhet, pragmatism och kommunikation. Vi arbetar ofta i team ute hos v√•ra kunder eftersom vi tror p√• kraften i samarbete. Vi √§r √∂vertygade om att det b√§sta s√§ttet att l√§ra sig n√•got nytt √§r tillsammans med inspirerande kollegor.

Om Bricobomba

Namnet Bricobomba kommer fr√•n det franska ordet ‚ÄúBricolage‚Äù som ungef√§r betyder ‚Äúg√∂r-det-sj√§lv‚Äù. Denna filosofi genomsyrar v√•rt arbetss√§tt. Vi ger v√•ra kunder kunskap och verktyg som de beh√∂ver f√∂r att kunna ta kontroll och g√∂ra saker sj√§lva. Vi vill kunna vara en helhetspartner f√∂r v√•ra kunder och erbjuder kompetens inom allt fr√•n att etablera infrastruktur, bygga systemst√∂d, utf√∂ra dataanalys och etablera dataprocesser.

Vi erbjuder

En arbetsplats med stora m√∂jligheter till utveckling, l√§ra och l√§ras av sina kollegor. Tillsammans har vi olika aktiviteter och t√§vlingar under √•ret, stora som sm√•. Vi har √§ven √•rlig konferens, sommaravslutning och julbord. Vi fr√§mjar och uppmuntrar eget initiativ i arbetet s√•v√§l som olika aktiviteter som vi kan g√∂ra tillsammans.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join us in creating world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.




Appostrophe is a mobile app development company creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our portfolio consists of top-listed apps such as SCRL, Memo, Text Art, and Add Text that are used and loved by millions of people worldwide. We‚Äôre a small, ambitious team that enjoys working together in central Stockholm and are looking for more like-minded people to join our mission.




We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the analytics team that handles the data and analysis of an app portfolio with millions of monthly users.




What you will do

Be responsible for our ETL system, guaranteeing its ease of use, reliability, and error reporting capabilities.
Establish data retrieval processes to collect data from the services we use through API calls.
Support with creation of internal libraries to help with app metrics calculations.
Bring to production data scientists‚Äô models so that they can be accessed easily by the team.
Handle backend topics such as notifications messaging for in-app promotions.
Shape the development of our technologies aimed at the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data and metrics calculation.
Be a beacon and an evangelist of data culture throughout the company.




You should have

IT knowledge. You have excellent knowledge of Python, SQL and NodeJS or other languages used for data engineering.
Data pipelines owner.¬†You know how to fully manage data pipelines from data ingestions to processing in the most efficient way.
Interest in our industry.¬†You have experience or a strong interest in the subscription app business and you want to use your knowledge of data engineering to support Appostrophe in its mission to create the most amazing apps for its customers.
Good communication skills.¬†You are able to communicate insights, strategies, and results clearly and effectively to the team. You can make complex topics you manage easy to understand.
Quality and pragmatism.¬†You are able to work at a high pace without compromising quality.
Can-do attitude.¬†You are a self-motivated problem solver with an eye for details and an internal drive for excellence.




We offer

Opportunity to be creative and test new ideas.
Important role in a successful startup.
Great colleagues and office in central Stockholm.
Competitive salary.

Title: Analyst Consultant - Risk Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You‚Äôll join our global Risk & Resilience Practice in one of our European offices and be part of the Risk Analytics team.‚ÄØ

Risk Analytics is the tech-enablement power engine of Risk & Resilience. We combine deep analytical and technical expertise with distinctive strategy and transformation capabilities to support clients in everything - from large-scale analytics programs to in-depth technical modelling exercises.

We develop and deploy leading-edge solutions incorporating the latest innovations in methodology and technology and maintain in-depth knowledge of regulatory developments. We convene leaders in the industry to build and share knowledge to drive long-term sustainable change in the practice of risk data and analytics.

We have over 18 years of expertise serving leading institutions across industries in the fields of model development, model advisory, model validation, and model risk management.

We are a diverse global community of world-class practitioners with a shared passion to build risk analytics capabilities that break new ground, transform industries, and shape markets. We solve real life business problems for our clients; work with us and you will learn from the best and have your voice heard from day one.

There is flexibility to hire at the Analyst or Senior Analyst level depending on candidate experience.

What You'll Do

As an Analyst Consultant in Risk Analytics, you will


Help clients to develop, refine and review their models using cutting-edge technology to better manage risk, assess market opportunities and create business benefits, across different areas of expertise.
Assess our clients‚Äô frameworks for model development and risk management across a variety of risk topics. This includes credit risk, market and trading risk, climate risk, financial crime and compliance and wider applications such as cyber‚ÄØand digital trust.
Analyze content and data, identify risk vectors, build prototypes, interpret results, find new solutions, derive conclusions, support clients to implement recommendations, and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value.
Be expected to communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to key client stakeholders‚ÄØ
Be able to establish connections between sophisticated modelling techniques and strategic decision-making processes. You will have exposure to a highly international environment as our client base is global‚ÄØ
Work on projects and exchange experiences with your colleagues which means you will face new intellectual challenges daily, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills, as well as your strategic consultancy toolkit


RiskandR

Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree required. Advanced quantitative degree (Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics/statistics, engineering, or financial engineering) would be a plus
2+ years of relevant experience in risk quantitative analysis/modelling to solve real world problems‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Experience across model lifecycle, including active participation in activities of development, implementation and/or testing of risk models (vendor or ‚Äúin-house‚Äù models)‚ÄØ
First experience in programming (beyond simple scripts) in a modern scientific language (e.g., Python, Matlab, R). Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB, Ignite) and SAS would be a strong plus‚ÄØ
Experience in one of the following machine learning / AI areas natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, graph-based techniques would be a strong plus‚ÄØ
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization‚ÄØ
Exceptional communication skills - especially around translating technical knowledge into forms that can be digested by leadership and non-technical project teams-, verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s)‚ÄØ
Willingness to travel‚ÄØ
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit‚Ä¶ well, forced. But we‚Äôd like to think that our story is special for real.




Our founders, Shadi Bitar and Ninos Malki, came to Sweden from Syria when they were kids. Books became their compass, guiding them through the maze of life, and helping them shape their destinies in a new world.




Their dream was bold: What if they could unlock the world of books for everyone, making knowledge and inspiration accessible to all? Fast forward a few years, and the tale of Nextory was born.




At Nextory, we've crafted a revolutionary monthly subscription that empowers our users to devour books like never before, be it through reading or listening. It's not just a product; it's a passport to endless adventure and enlightenment.




And now, we're on a quest to find a Data Engineer, someone as passionate as we are about making the world a happier place and enriching lives through the world of reading. Join our extraordinary team, and let's script a future where every day is a chapter of discovery, and every book is a key to a richer life.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

As a Data Engineer at Nextory you will work with keeping and developing the data drivenness of Nextotry throughout the organization. With a curious, innovative and analytical mindset and tech-savvy approach you will fuel our data-driven teams.




Together with the team you will be responsible for data services which means, data warehousing, ML/AI, data quality and enabling data insights. You will build and run data pipelines, data warehouses, data frameworks and leverage ML/AI. We believe that you enjoy working autonomously in close collaboration with the cross-functional teams and other stakeholders.




You will be a part of an amazing team and be at the core of understanding a consumer subscription service - always with the continuous aspiration to increase reading! The position is based in Stockholm and you report to our COO.




WHO YOU ARE

We believe that you are currently working in a similar role at a fast-moving company. We believe that you would like to develop a thorough understanding of how consumers use our service and be part of delivering key insights. By using various development techniques, you will keep us in the forefront of creating the best customer experience as well as providing a great self-service data platform. We believe that you take pride in structuring, integrating and transforming data on a daily basis - you believe that data quality is key!

If you have ambitions (or experience!) of working with areas like ML and AI we would love to give you a platform to show your practice! You thrive working in a dynamic and unpretentious environment where you take great responsibility for our product and your team!




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

‚Ä¢ We believe you have, for the field, relevant educational background

‚Ä¢ We believe you have around 4 years of experience from working within the field

‚Ä¢ We believe that you are an expert in SQL and have worked with Java, Python and/or similar languages

‚Ä¢ We believe that you have experience with cloud infrastructure (Azure, AWS, GCP) and cloud data warehousing, preferably BigQuery or equivalent

‚Ä¢ We believe that you have experience working with pipelines and data integration solutions with an ELT approach

‚Ä¢ We believe that you have experience in operating, maintaining and ensuring quality of production grade software




We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Kambi

Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world‚Äôs leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

About Tzeract:

Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.

To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/

Role Overview:

We're seeking a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for sports and a keen eye for statistics to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow and integrity of large-scale sports data sets. You will work closely with our data scientists and developers, turning complex data into actionable insights that drive our AI algorithms.

Responsibilities:



Develop and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines for real-time and historical sports data ingestion, processing, and analysis using Python and AWS services.
Implement and manage AWS cloud-based solutions to ensure high availability, performance, and security of our data infrastructure.
Collaborate with data scientists to understand data requirements for AI model development and provide the necessary data engineering support.
Apply your expertise in statistics and data analysis to enhance data quality and the effectiveness of our AI algorithms.
Monitor data pipelines and systems performance, troubleshoot data issues, and implement optimizations.
Stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies in data engineering and sports analytics to continuously improve our data systems.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong proficiency in Python.
Extensive experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Redshift) and managing cloud-based data infrastructure.
Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies is highly desirable.
A good eye for statistics and experience in statistical modeling or analysis.
Passion for sports and sports data analysis is a big plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.



Why Join Us:



Be part of a cutting-edge project that's shaping the future of sports betting.
Work in an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach.
Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.
Engage in continuous learning and growth opportunities within an ambitious tech startup.



How to Apply:

Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, and any relevant portfolio links or GitHub repository to us. Please include "Data Engineer Application" in the subject line.

We're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi

About Tzeract:

Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.

To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/

Role Overview:

We're seeking a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for sports and a keen eye for statistics to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow and integrity of large-scale sports data sets. You will work closely with our data scientists and developers, turning complex data into actionable insights that drive our AI algorithms.

Responsibilities:


  • Develop and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines for real-time and historical sports data ingestion, processing, and analysis using Python and AWS services.
  • Implement and manage AWS cloud-based solutions to ensure high availability, performance, and security of our data infrastructure.
  • Collaborate with data scientists to understand data requirements for AI model development and provide the necessary data engineering support.
  • Apply your expertise in statistics and data analysis to enhance data quality and the effectiveness of our AI algorithms.
  • Monitor data pipelines and systems performance, troubleshoot data issues, and implement optimizations.
  • Stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies in data engineering and sports analytics to continuously improve our data systems.


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong proficiency in Python.
  • Extensive experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Redshift) and managing cloud-based data infrastructure.
  • Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
  • Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies is highly desirable.
  • A good eye for statistics and experience in statistical modeling or analysis.
  • Passion for sports and sports data analysis is a big plus.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.


Why Join Us:


  • Be part of a cutting-edge project that's shaping the future of sports betting.
  • Work in an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach.
  • Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.
  • Engage in continuous learning and growth opportunities within an ambitious tech startup.


How to Apply:

Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, and any relevant portfolio links or GitHub repository to us. Please include "Data Engineer Application" in the subject line.

We're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi

Title: BI & Analytics Developer
Description:
Our talented Data & AI team is made up of globally recognized experts and there's room for more analytical, innovative, client-driven data professionals! If you're passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let's talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Come join us

If you‚Äôre passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let‚Äôs talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Skills And Experiences


You have extensive experience in database development mainly in SQL and working knowledge from T-SQL
Knowledge of Power BI to enhance better data visualizations to the clients
You have some experience in ETL tools and tabular/in-memory databases
You have experience in analytical applications and dimensional data modelling
You are experienced in both Azure and on-prem Microsoft platforms you are comfortable with DevOps
You have worked with solution development (and design) either in an in-house role or as a consultant
You speak fluently Swedish and English


About You

Characteristics that can spell success for this role:


Collaborative, curious, client-centric
Resilient, adaptable, flexible
Passionate about tech


What You'll Do

As a BI and Analytics Developer you will:


Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen
Work with a team maintaining and developing an end-to-end enterprise data warehouse including integrations, data modelling, analysis tools and automated reports
Work closely with the customer where mostly the solutions that the team is responsible for are business critical
Take ownership of your own development tasks while collaborating with your team members
You'll be working occasionally with Application Management, we work in a DevOps setup, mixing development and operations
Work with and be specialized in Microsoft tools


Learn more

Do you recognize yourself in this vacancy and would you like to meet us? Then apply today, we can't wait to hear from you! Even if you don't feel a complete match for this role, we would encourage you still to apply! We are constantly looking for new team members to join our growing Data & AI team.

Enjoy your career

Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade


People-first culture that supports innovation and encourages people to move forward
Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this both by offering formal training opportunities as well as informal evenings where peers share their knowledge
With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a difference for our customers in the Enterprise market
We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career adviser who will work with you to create a plan and guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer
Working in a hybrid/flexible model


A great place to work

As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you'll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You'll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It's all here, so take a closer look! We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees.

Title: Data Engineer Insight
Description:
Data Engineer

Do you want to build the next datamodels f√∂r AI, ML and datawarehouse empowered solutions?

Nexer Insight, a Microsoft partner, invites you to embark on a journey as a Data Engineer where you'll be part of an extraordinary team, engage in exciting activities, work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. We are committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies such as Databricks to drive innovation and excellence in everything we do.

Do you want to be our next ‚ÄùData Ninja‚Äù?

Joining Nexer Insight means becoming a vital part of a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. Here, you'll have the chance to engage with cutting-edge technology from Microsoft, Databricks, and DBT Labs, as we proudly partner with them. We're committed to investing in our employees, empowering them to excel in their fields through professional growth and development opportunities. Collaboration is at the heart of our approach, as we value teamwork and foster a vibrant community spirit. Enjoy the flexibility of a dynamic work environment, including the option for part-time remote work. Dive into the exciting intersection of data engineering and data science, where you'll have the chance to make a meaningful impact.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and operate scalable and robust analytical models.
Set up data platforms and build data models and pipelines.
Innovate and collaborate with customers to learn and find new business opportunities.
Become a champion in best practices regarding architecture, data quality, reliability, and performance.
Be at the forefront of the latest data engineering technology.
Leveraging Microsoft Azure services for data processing, transformation, and storage.
You propel progress and ensure delivery by constructing top-tier cloud solutions, empowering our customers to adopt a data-driven approach.



Based on our criteria f√∂r the role, we expect you to have:


Hands-on project experience of working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS or GCP)
Experience working with ETL tools such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, DBT, Snowflake
Experience with Data Lakes or Lakehouse Architecture
In-depth knowledge of SQL syntax
Experience in information and dimensional modelling
Good knowledge of DevOps processes with git version control and CI/CD methodology
Speaks English and Swedish fluently



Have you previously worked on-premises? No problem, with us you get the opportunity to take courses and get certified in Azure.

Meritorious experience:


Platform modernisation
Tabular cubes and DAX
Data Vault modelling
Experience in setting up Azure, AWS or GCP Infrastructure
Show more

Title: BI - Developer
Description:
FINN, Blocket, DBA, Bilbasen, Oikotie & Tori. Did you spot any familiar names? Then you already know a bit about Schibsted Marketplaces! Our team spans across the Nordics and Poland, united by a shared passion for our work and to foster a friendly and caring community. Curiosity, teamwork, problem-solving and continuous learning are the cornerstones of our culture.

Currently, we‚Äôre embarking on an exciting journey to become a fully marketplace-focused company. Our mission is to empower people to make smart choices for themselves and future generations. To achieve this, we are committed to staying agile and proactive in the rapidly evolving digital landscape ‚Äî shaping the future of digital marketplaces.

,

THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL

You? Are you a skilled BI developer with a passion for transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical and data visualisation skills drive commercial decisions? Are you excited by the prospect of playing a crucial role in developing actionable analytics to optimise sales and advertising processes? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!

Role? As a BI Developer with a focus on reporting and visualisation within the new BI department of Sales Insights, you'll extract, transform, and analyse data from multiple sources to generate insights and develop dashboards using Tableau. You'll collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand their reporting requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions. Your work will include developing dashboards, performing ad-hoc analyses, and presenting findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Company? Nordic Marketplaces is a dynamic and innovative company committed to driving change through data. As a result of the Schibsted company separation, Sales Insights is creating its own BI department to develop actionable analytics and enhance revenue streams through optimised sales and advertising processes. FINN.no in Norway, Blocket in Sweden, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland collectively form Schibsted Marketplaces, serving over 325 million monthly visits.

Why us?


Impact: Drive the optimization of our sales and advertising processes through data-driven insights.
Growth: Collaborate with various teams across the organisation, gaining broad experience and ample opportunities for professional growth.
Innovation: Thrive in a forward-thinking environment that embraces emerging technologies and industry trends.
Supportive Team: Join a team packed with smart, friendly, and motivated individuals who are passionate about what they do.


Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!

WHO ARE YOU?


Proven experience as a BI Developer at least 3 years, and preferably in a business intelligence or sales analytics role.
Expert knowledge using Tableau to build data visualisation and dashboard development.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with CRM systems and advertising platforms is an advantage.
Proactive and self-motivated with a forward-leaning attitude.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to communicate complex findings clearly and concisely.
Strong collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data quality and accuracy.
Enthusiastic about transforming data into actionable insights that drive business impact.


WHAT‚ÄôS THE JOB LIKE?


Extract, transform, and analyse data from multiple sources to generate insights and reports using Tableau.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Design and develop story driven dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics and trends effectively.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to support business decisions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Present findings and insights to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear and compelling manner.
Educate and train stakeholders on how to use dashboards effectively to gain insights and drive decision making.


What We Offer

We guarantee an engaging workplace where successes are celebrated, and colleagues support each other. Our benefits include various celebrations and plenty of opportunities to connect. Your well-being is a priority, supported by company benefits including physical and mental health support, flexible working hours, and on-site massage services. In our Oslo office, there's always cake to celebrate (which happens often), and in our Stockholm office, we cherish our Fika tradition.

GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!

If you're looking for a workplace where you can share your knowledge, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you! We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

QUESTIONS?

Head of Business Intelligence of Sales Insight Micheal Zamayeri (micheal.zamayeri@schibsted.com) is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role.

While we are continually reviewing CVs, please be aware that July is a traditional holiday period for us. We kindly ask for your patience as responses may be delayed until August. Thank you for your understanding!
Show more

If you're looking for a workplace where you can share your knowledge, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you! We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

QUESTIONS?

Head of Business Intelligence of Sales Insight Micheal Zamayeri (micheal.zamayeri@schibsted.com) is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role.

While we are continually reviewing CVs, please be aware that July is a traditional holiday period for us. We kindly ask for your patience as responses may be delayed until August. Thank you for your understanding!

Title: BI & Analytics Developer
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork ‚Äì the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

Our talented Data & AI team is made up of globally recognized experts and there's room for more analytical, innovative, client-driven data professionals! If you're passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let's talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Come join us

If you‚Äôre passionate about helping clients make better data-driven decisions to tackle their most complex business issues, let‚Äôs talk. Take your skills to a new level and launch a career where you can truly do what matters.

Skills And Experiences


You have extensive experience in database development mainly in SQL and working knowledge from T-SQL
Knowledge of Power BI to enhance better data visualizations to the clients
You have some experience in ETL tools and tabular/in-memory databases
You have experience in analytical applications and dimensional data modelling
You are experienced in both Azure and on-prem Microsoft platforms you are comfortable with DevOps
You have worked with solution development (and design) either in an in-house role or as a consultant
You speak fluently Swedish and English


About You

Characteristics that can spell success for this role:


Collaborative, curious, client-centric
Resilient, adaptable, flexible
Passionate about tech


What You'll Do

As a BI and Analytics Developer you will:


Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business acumen
Work with a team maintaining and developing an end-to-end enterprise data warehouse including integrations, data modelling, analysis tools and automated reports
Work closely with the customer where mostly the solutions that the team is responsible for are business critical
Take ownership of your own development tasks while collaborating with your team members
You'll be working occasionally with Application Management, we work in a DevOps setup, mixing development and operations
Work with and be specialized in Microsoft tools


Learn more

Do you recognize yourself in this vacancy and would you like to meet us? Then apply today, we can't wait to hear from you!

Even if you don't feel a complete match for this role, we would encourage you still to apply! We are constantly looking for new team members to join our growing Data & AI team.

Enjoy your career

Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade


People-first culture that supports innovation and encourages people to move forward
Knowledge development is our focus, and we ensure this both by offering formal training opportunities as well as informal evenings where peers share their knowledge
With your passion, you can use the latest Microsoft technology to make a difference for our customers in the Enterprise market
We have a strong focus on the career and development opportunities of all our people. Everyone has a career adviser who will work with you to create a plan and guide you in choosing from the many training opportunities we offer
Working in a hybrid/flexible model


A great place to work

As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you'll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You'll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It's all here, so take a closer look! We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At Sandvik Group IT, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Engineer with strong technical skills to join us on an exciting transformation journey and build a new modern Azure data platform.

You‚Äôll be part of a diverse and collaborative team with a focus on building scalable and secured middle layer serving data to the front services.

Some Words About Us

At Sandvik, we're going through a major digital shift with the objective of becoming an industry leader within digital solutions and to enable operational excellence through digitalization. We welcome you to an open and supportive work environment where you get to grow and develop ‚Äì read more about our culture on our career site! We look forward to hearing from you!

Your mission

Your main focus is leading the exciting mission of building data pipelines to onboard data from various sources, such as relational databases, mainframe systems, APIs, and message queues. With Azure Cloud Platform as your targeted working environment, you develop scalable and secure services that harvest integrated data.

You have a strong voice in decision-making and our technical road map, and your work highly contributes to meeting data compliance and governance standards. You shape our work culture by sharing your knowledge, coaching junior developers, and partnering with the business, as you deploy data pipelines that deliver value and insights from data.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden and allows for a hybrid work schedule.

Your profile

We‚Äôre looking for a seasoned data engineer who can handle complex data challenges in an agile environment. You have:


A strong grasp of SQL and Python, and you can use Spark and Azure data bricks to build and manage scalable data solutions.
Familiarity with various data architectures, such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric, and you can design and implement data pipelines that integrate data from multiple sources, such as databases, flat files, API‚Äôs, and event-driven data feeds.
Proficiency in software development practices, such as Git version control, CI/CD, and Docker, and you can troubleshoot and optimize data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
Fluency in English.


Although your hard skills are important, we highly value your personality ‚Äì characterized by your forward-thinking mindset, helping you to drive change and continuous improvement across teams, tools, and processes. You‚Äôre comfortable communicating and building relationships with stakeholders at all over our organization and have the ability to easily ‚Äúgrasp the gist‚Äù. With your analytical mindset, you‚Äôre able to approach complex challenges and proactively tackle them with your team's help. You have a positive and open mind, and as a true team player, you‚Äôre intrigued by collaborating and motivating other team members in a multicultural environment.

Our culture

At Sandvik, we‚Äôre tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.

Contact information

For further information about this position, please contact:

Swati Falak, recruiting manager, swati.falak@sandvik.com

We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.

Union contacts ‚Äì Sweden

Anders R√∂nnqvist, Unionen, +46 (0)70 616 41 21

G√∂ran Norell, Akademikerf√∂reningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78

Peter Olsson-Andr√©e, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55

Recruitment Specialist

Gustaf Sj√∂gren

How To Apply

Send your application no later than August 15, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don‚Äôt accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0066184.

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers‚Äô processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer - Helsinki, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden




Are you passionate about creating robust data solutions which empower data-driven decision-making? Do you want to be part of influencing the well-being of employees with the help of data and analytics for millions of Epassi users? Do you want to be part of a rapidly growing company?

If yes, you might be a great fit for us. Read more below and apply to join Epassi!




As a Data Engineer:




You will be developing and maintaining a hybrid data platform (on-prem & cloud)
You will be building data integrations for internal and external stakeholders
You will be implementing high-quality data solutions in compliance with privacy
regulations and security standards
You will be working in co-operation with other teams, such as IT, security, software development, business, and finance
You will be part of an agile team of data & analytics professionals and will be contributing to continuous improvement of our way-of-working




You will be a great fit if you have:




3+ years as a data engineer building, developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines
Hands-on experience of formal DataOps/DevOps practices and Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible
Solid foundation in AWS, particularly in data storage solutions
Experience of Airflow and Databricks/Spark
Proficiency in SQL and Python programming
Good communication and social skills
Working proficiency in English




Why you should join Epassi:




We are a fast-growing tech company; you will have a chance to impact on many meaningful things and grow together with us as a professional
We have an inspiring & supportive culture, and we take care of the wellbeing of our employees
We provide a flexible hybrid work model and care about your work-life balance
We take care of the professional development of Epassians by creating a personal development plan individually and supporting development by providing a yearly budget
We have a unique team environment - international, motivated, supportive colleagues with a great sense of humor
Epassi has a great benefit package, for example wellbeing and lunch benefit, healthy snacks & refreshments at the office, investment in employee growth and development, and private health care




The location of the position is either in Helsinki, Finland or in Stockholm, Sweden.

The hiring manager for this position is Head of Data & Analytics Laura Mantere.

If you want to ask more information about this opportunity, please

contact careers@epassi.com.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Stockholm Exergi √§r stockholmarnas energibolag och vi √§r ca 750 medarbetare som varje dag arbetar f√∂r att minska stockholmarnas klimatp√•verkan. Vi v√§rmer √∂ver 800 000 stockholmare och v√•rt 300 mil l√•nga fj√§rrv√§rmen√§t √§r navet f√∂r de samh√§llsnyttor som vi skapar. Vi planerar att bygga en anl√§ggning f√∂r koldioxidinf√•ngning vid v√•rt biokraftv√§rmeverk i V√§rtan med potential att f√•nga in 800 000 ton koldioxid per √•r, vilket √§r mer √§n Stockholms v√§gtrafik sl√§pper ut under samma period.

Vi beh√∂ver fler duktiga medarbetare och hoppas att du vill vara med oss p√• v√•r Exergiresa.

Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?

Som Data Engineer i v√•rt team hanterar du tillsammans med dina kollegor helheten runt Data & Analytics p√• Stockholm Exergi. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Dema.ai is a well-funded SaaS startup based in Stockholm with 25+ employees with a mission to help thousands of e-commerce businesses improve their profitability.

What We Are Looking For

We're in search of an experienced Data Engineer who will be designing, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines, as well as ensuring data quality and availability. Your work will pave the way for the discovery of insights that will drive business decisions for our clients.

What You'll Be Doing


Designing, building, and maintaining a modern data stack
Architecting, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines from various sources in our data warehouse
Ensuring our data warehouse scales and performs to our high standards, with support from other data engineers
Collaborating with our product developers and data scientists to deliver new data features
Designing data models that provide long-term stability, maintainability, and scalability for our data warehouse
Building and maintaining monitoring and alerting systems for data pipelines


Technical Skills And Experience


5+ years work life experience
Strong Python skills and SQL proficiency
Experience with data warehousing
Experience with dbt is a plus
Hands-on experience building ETL/ELT pipelines in a distributed processing setup
Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration tools like Prefect, Airflow, or similar


Our Tech Stack

Javascript, Python, Java, MongoDB, SQL, ClickHouse, Kubernetes, AWS

You are right for this role if you:


Detail-oriented and thorough
Structured and views a bit of chaos as a fun challenge
A doer who gets things done, rather than just a visionary with big ideas
Humble, open-minded, and team-oriented


Hard requirements for this position:

To be qualified for this position, you must have the legal authorization to work in Sweden (work permit or residence card) or be a citizen of the European Union. Dema is currently unable to provide assistance with this process.

Benefits


A significant amount of stock options
30 days of vacation per year
Pension and health insurance (level at par with the Swedish high standard ITP1)
5000 SEK per year as wellness allowance
Hybrid remote way of working
Dog-friendly office

HTML:
Dema.ai is a well-funded SaaS startup based in Stockholm with 25+ employees with a mission to help thousands of e-commerce businesses improve their profitability.

What We Are Looking For

We're in search of an experienced Data Engineer who will be designing, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines, as well as ensuring data quality and availability. Your work will pave the way for the discovery of insights that will drive business decisions for our clients.

What You'll Be Doing

  • Designing, building, and maintaining a modern data stack
  • Architecting, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines from various sources in our data warehouse
  • Ensuring our data warehouse scales and performs to our high standards, with support from other data engineers
  • Collaborating with our product developers and data scientists to deliver new data features
  • Designing data models that provide long-term stability, maintainability, and scalability for our data warehouse
  • Building and maintaining monitoring and alerting systems for data pipelines

Technical Skills And Experience

  • 5+ years work life experience
  • Strong Python skills and SQL proficiency
  • Experience with data warehousing
  • Experience with dbt is a plus
  • Hands-on experience building ETL/ELT pipelines in a distributed processing setup
  • Familiarity with data pipeline orchestration tools like Prefect, Airflow, or similar

Our Tech Stack

Javascript, Python, Java, MongoDB, SQL, ClickHouse, Kubernetes, AWS

You are right for this role if you:

  • Detail-oriented and thorough
  • Structured and views a bit of chaos as a fun challenge
  • A doer who gets things done, rather than just a visionary with big ideas
  • Humble, open-minded, and team-oriented

Hard requirements for this position:

To be qualified for this position, you must have the legal authorization to work in Sweden (work permit or residence card) or be a citizen of the European Union. Dema is currently unable to provide assistance with this process.

Benefits

  • A significant amount of stock options
  • 30 days of vacation per year
  • Pension and health insurance (level at par with the Swedish high standard ITP1)
  • 5000 SEK per year as wellness allowance
  • Hybrid remote way of working
  • Dog-friendly office

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Role:

Development of SADP, IDPs. Ensuring Data Quality. Adopting to Data mesh capabilities. These are all covered in our One Data Foundation Initiative, but also working for other stack ranked initiatives like BTI-292, BTI-146, BTI-147 and BTI-260.

Essential requirements:

Strong GCP skills with understanding of different Google services, when to use which service, their cost implications. Data warehouse concepts, SQL, Python, DBT and Terraform.

Leadership/experience level: Mid Senior to Senior Data Engineer

Required cloud certification: Google Cloud or other Cloud Engineering

Please explain how you meet all the requirements when applying.

Utilization: 100%

Location: Stockholm

Period: 19-08-2024-31-12-2024

Last day to apply: 29-07-2024

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

Title: Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data | SEB, Stockholm
Description:
The industry of Banking is changing rapidly. We are going through changes in the cash management area with new competitors, technological development and infrastructure upgrades.

Do you want to join a professional and passionate team that is in the process of further developing the analytical capabilities within SEB Corporate Banking and beyond? Customer expectations in the digital era is putting new requirements on our existing and future data driven advisory products. In this transition we aim to automate, simplify and implement self-service advanced analytics in all areas. We are now looking for a Data Steward and analyst with focus on account data . As part of our Google Cloud migration journey, you will help define account data products that support our reporting and analytics use cases.

About the role:

As a Data Steward, you will champion data quality, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance for our account data and products. You'll develop and implement innovative data governance frameworks and best practices. By collaborating closely with stakeholders across departments, you'll define and refine data requirements and standards, driving powerful analytics initiatives and turning raw data into actionable insights. Monitoring key data quality metrics and KPIs, you will ensure continuous improvement and swiftly resolve any data discrepancies. Additionally, you'll play a pivotal role in our Google Cloud migration journey, defining account data products to enhance our reporting and analytics capabilities in cloud. To your support you will work in close collaboration with the information architects and account product specialists to reach our desired state of defined account products, account data products and schemas.

The role reports to the Head of Data and Analytics within Cash Management. We are part of Corporate Banking, LC&FI and our tasks and responsibility often span across the SEB Group.

As a Data Steward and Account Data Specialist you will be responsible for:


Ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with regulatory and internal standards.
Collaborating with stakeholders to define data requirements and standards for account data products.
Monitoring and report on data quality metrics and KPIs.
Identifying and resolve data-related issues and discrepancies.
Supporting reporting and data analytics initiatives to drive insights and business decisions.
Continuously improve data management processes and tools.
Collaborating with other data stewards, information architects, analysts, data owners, and our tech development teams.


To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


Documented university degree or equivalent within areas such as finance, IT or engineering.
A curious mindset and are a positive team player.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Deep understanding of data quality principles and best practices.
An attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
The ability to manage your time & prioritize.
Account product knowledge.
The ability to balance between reactive and strategic work.
Track record in data management, data stewardship, or data governance within the banking sector.
Data modelling knowledge, which is considered a bonus.


What we offer:

We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual‚Äôs career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:


Work-life balance with the principle of office first.
Attractive compensation and benefits.
Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits.
Excellent office environment.
Agile and modern ways of working.
Deliver world-class service to customers.


Do you want to be part of SEB?

Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than August 20th 2024. Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to the role. If you have questions about the position, please contact Jonatan Eln√§s, jonatan.elnas@seb.se .

Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual during the summer due to the holidays.

Learn more about working at SEB: www.sebgroup.com/career

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

Title: Master/Senior Data Analyst in Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations and Analytics (FCIIA)
Description:
Job ID:¬†24867¬†

¬†

Do you have a can-do attitude and are you ready to take the next step as a Master/Senior Data Analyst in Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations and Analytics (FCIIA)?¬†Come and join the dynamic fight against international financial crime using the latest technologies and processes in a leading financial institution!

¬†Due to expanding requirements and continued success, we are looking for Master/Senior data analysts to expand our Financial Crime related Data team within FCIIA.

¬†

Joining the Data team will provide you with multitude opportunities to support data-savvy end-users using your experience in:¬†

Data Management
Data Analysis
Data Engineering¬†

¬†Key to our success is the gift of having an enjoyable working environment with intellectual, driven colleagues who are keen to solve issues and continually improve the data landscape.

¬†

At Nordea, we‚Äôre committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you‚Äôll have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.

¬†About this opportunity

¬†

This is a role within the Financial Crime Investigation, Intelligence & Analytics (FCIIA) unit in Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP).

¬†

What you‚Äôll be doing:

Producing standardised data focused requirements to be implemented by our IT partners.
Analysing datasets to validate data sources are ingested as per specification.
Identifying complex undocumented relationships across disparate data sources.
Implementing complex data solutions to facilitate simplified down-stream consumption.
Integrating with large-scale change programmes both upstream and downstream.
Documenting data standards, including definitions, business rules and data quality controls.
Drinking coffee ‚Äì (not strictly essential, tea and water are both acceptable alternatives).
Measuring compliance with the data standards and defined data quality targets.
Liaising with Data Owners, architects and analysts to enhance our data offering.
Assisting with regulatory focused programmes

¬†The role is available in one of our offices in: Tallinn, Stockholm or Helsinki.

¬†

Who you are

¬†Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

¬†

To build a successful career with us, you‚Äôll work well with others and always act with the stakeholders‚Äô needs in mind. You love learning and trying new things, and you‚Äôre excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You‚Äôre honest and dependable, willing to speak up even when it‚Äôs difficult, and committed to empowering others. You‚Äôre passionate about doing a great job.

¬†You are a person who has a passion for data. You can analyse it to answer queries, but also understand where potential limitations exist and can creatively resolve them in either a tactical or strategic manner, as required.¬†Identifying and resolving data issues is something that gives you great satisfaction.



Your experience and background:¬†

Experience in the payment domain, e.g. SWIFT MT/MX or ISO20022 message formatting and usage
+5 years of experience within data focused role
Good hands-on level of experience using Excel, SQL, Hadoop, VBA, R and Python etc.
Academic degree in quantitative subject¬†e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance
Excellent English. Meetings, presentations and written materials are in English as standard
Good interpersonal and stakeholder management skills
You are proactive and bring a strong sense of ownership for your tasks and responsibilities
You understand the principles of working with an Agile development approach
You are excited to share ideas and findings with your team

¬†

Your application will benefit from demonstrating experience in the below:

Financial crime prevention
Financial industry expertise
Experience in working in large scale change programmes
Hadoop experience
Cloudera experience
Cloud experience (AWS/Snowflake etc.)

¬†

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

¬†

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/07/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Kosmas Diveris.¬†We kindly ask you to submit your CV and cover letter in English.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

¬†

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.¬†

HTML:
Job ID: 24867 

 

Do you have a can-do attitude and are you ready to take the next step as a Master/Senior Data Analyst in Financial Crime Intelligence, Investigations and Analytics (FCIIA)? Come and join the dynamic fight against international financial crime using the latest technologies and processes in a leading financial institution!

 Due to expanding requirements and continued success, we are looking for Master/Senior data analysts to expand our Financial Crime related Data team within FCIIA.

 

Joining the Data team will provide you with multitude opportunities to support data-savvy end-users using your experience in: 

  • Data Management
  • Data Analysis
  • Data Engineering 

 Key to our success is the gift of having an enjoyable working environment with intellectual, driven colleagues who are keen to solve issues and continually improve the data landscape.

 

At Nordea, we‚Äôre committed to being a partner our customers and society can count on. Compliance and integrity go hand in hand. Joining us means you‚Äôll have an impact on how we do banking ‚Äì today and tomorrow. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. With us, you‚Äôll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.

 About this opportunity

 

This is a role within the Financial Crime Investigation, Intelligence & Analytics (FCIIA) unit in Group Financial Crime Prevention (GFCP).

 

What you‚Äôll be doing:

  • Producing standardised data focused requirements to be implemented by our IT partners.
  • Analysing datasets to validate data sources are ingested as per specification.
  • Identifying complex undocumented relationships across disparate data sources.
  • Implementing complex data solutions to facilitate simplified down-stream consumption.
  • Integrating with large-scale change programmes both upstream and downstream.
  • Documenting data standards, including definitions, business rules and data quality controls.
  • Drinking coffee ‚Äì (not strictly essential, tea and water are both acceptable alternatives).
  • Measuring compliance with the data standards and defined data quality targets.
  • Liaising with Data Owners, architects and analysts to enhance our data offering.
  • Assisting with regulatory focused programmes

 The role is available in one of our offices in: Tallinn, Stockholm or Helsinki.

 

Who you are

 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best ‚Äì and that we imagine you share with us.

 

To build a successful career with us, you‚Äôll work well with others and always act with the stakeholders‚Äô needs in mind. You love learning and trying new things, and you‚Äôre excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You‚Äôre honest and dependable, willing to speak up even when it‚Äôs difficult, and committed to empowering others. You‚Äôre passionate about doing a great job.

 You are a person who has a passion for data. You can analyse it to answer queries, but also understand where potential limitations exist and can creatively resolve them in either a tactical or strategic manner, as required. Identifying and resolving data issues is something that gives you great satisfaction.



Your experience and background: 

  • Experience in the payment domain, e.g. SWIFT MT/MX or ISO20022 message formatting and usage
  • +5 years of experience within data focused role
  • Good hands-on level of experience using Excel, SQL, Hadoop, VBA, R and Python etc.
  • Academic degree in quantitative subject e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Finance
  • Excellent English. Meetings, presentations and written materials are in English as standard
  • Good interpersonal and stakeholder management skills
  • You are proactive and bring a strong sense of ownership for your tasks and responsibilities
  • You understand the principles of working with an Agile development approach
  • You are excited to share ideas and findings with your team

 

Your application will benefit from demonstrating experience in the below:

  • Financial crime prevention
  • Financial industry expertise
  • Experience in working in large scale change programmes
  • Hadoop experience
  • Cloudera experience
  • Cloud experience (AWS/Snowflake etc.)

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/07/2024. For more information, you‚Äôre welcome to contact Kosmas Diveris. We kindly ask you to submit your CV and cover letter in English.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

 

Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.

Title: Analyst Consultant - Risk Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You‚Äôll join our global Risk & Resilience Practice in one of our European offices and be part of the Risk Analytics team.‚ÄØ

Risk Analytics is the tech-enablement power engine of Risk & Resilience. We combine deep analytical and technical expertise with distinctive strategy and transformation capabilities to support clients in everything - from large-scale analytics programs to in-depth technical modelling exercises.

We develop and deploy leading-edge solutions incorporating the latest innovations in methodology and technology and maintain in-depth knowledge of regulatory developments. We convene leaders in the industry to build and share knowledge to drive long-term sustainable change in the practice of risk data and analytics.

We have over 18 years of expertise serving leading institutions across industries in the fields of model development, model advisory, model validation, and model risk management.

We are a diverse global community of world-class practitioners with a shared passion to build risk analytics capabilities that break new ground, transform industries, and shape markets. We solve real life business problems for our clients; work with us and you will learn from the best and have your voice heard from day one.

There is flexibility to hire at the Analyst or Senior Analyst level depending on candidate experience.

What You'll Do

As an Analyst Consultant in Risk Analytics, you will


Help clients to develop, refine and review their models using cutting-edge technology to better manage risk, assess market opportunities and create business benefits, across different areas of expertise.
Assess our clients‚Äô frameworks for model development and risk management across a variety of risk topics. This includes credit risk, market and trading risk, climate risk, financial crime and compliance and wider applications such as cyber‚ÄØand digital trust.
Analyze content and data, identify risk vectors, build prototypes, interpret results, find new solutions, derive conclusions, support clients to implement recommendations, and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value.
Be expected to communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to key client stakeholders‚ÄØ
Be able to establish connections between sophisticated modelling techniques and strategic decision-making processes. You will have exposure to a highly international environment as our client base is global‚ÄØ
Work on projects and exchange experiences with your colleagues which means you will face new intellectual challenges daily, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills, as well as your strategic consultancy toolkit


RiskandR

Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree required. Advanced quantitative degree (Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics/statistics, engineering, or financial engineering) would be a plus
2+ years of relevant experience in risk quantitative analysis/modelling to solve real world problems‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Experience across model lifecycle, including active participation in activities of development, implementation and/or testing of risk models (vendor or ‚Äúin-house‚Äù models)‚ÄØ
First experience in programming (beyond simple scripts) in a modern scientific language (e.g., Python, Matlab, R). Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB, Ignite) and SAS would be a strong plus‚ÄØ
Experience in one of the following machine learning / AI areas natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, graph-based techniques would be a strong plus‚ÄØ
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization‚ÄØ
Exceptional communication skills - especially around translating technical knowledge into forms that can be digested by leadership and non-technical project teams-, verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s)‚ÄØ
Willingness to travel‚ÄØ
