Title: Innovation AI - Intern
Description:
Internship ‚Äì Innovation, Data & Analytics, Artificial Intelligence

Location: Stockholm

Start Date: immediately.

Building greater futures through innovation and collective knowledge




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world‚Äôs largest businesses for the past 50 years. We believe innovation and collective knowledge can transform all our futures with greater purpose. We help companies across industries achieve their strategic goals and lead their digital transformation programs. With 600,000 experts globally and 18,000+ consultants working for leading Nordic Customers, we have a strong sense of purpose for the ecosystem around us ‚Äì our employees, partners, customers and society.

We are happy to invite applications for exciting internship opportunities at TCS. The internship allows you to gain unique and real-life perspectives in solving challenges for TCS and its Customers.

We look forward to receiving your application via Neelavani.k@tcs.com




Your perspectives and assignments:

Focus on following dimensions (1) Data and Analytics for business, (2) Artificial Intelligence & Automation, (3) Sustainability & Digital Solutions, (4) Research & Innovation themes. It is likely that business use cases exist at the intersection of these themes.
Study tech and business trends in key themes and industries
Support the build up of TCS Stockholm Pace Studio (i.e. TCS Innovation Hub). This will involve working with the design team to create new experiences for TCS and Customers.
Organize innovation events and workshops on identified themes
Profile Artificial Intelligence Ecosystem in Sweden. Identify potential collaboration partners
Develop channels with Academic and Research Institutions in Sweden
Coordinate Innovation, AI and Research initiatives working with Sales, Account, CTO teams
Work with Sales and Account teams on research and advisory services related to strategy,
Prepare research papers and business presentations
Participate in conferences to enhance understanding of AI, Innovation, Sustainability themes




Your Qualifications:

Enrollment in a Bachelor's (at least in the 2nd year) or Master's degree program
Awarenes (or experience) of Digital Technology and Artificial Intelligence concepts
Experience in the field of sustainability and or AI/digital tech gained through seminar or project work, internships or extracurricular activities
Good to have: Project/ Uni experience on digital tech (low-code/ no-code platforms)
Passion for personal and professional development on Digital Technology and AI
Strong research and analytical skills
Networking skills to engage actively with internal and external stakeholders
Strong proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
Ability to work in an international working environment.
Structured and independent way of working
Business fluent in English and Swedish




Duration of Internship: six to twelve months

We look forward to receiving your application via Neelavani.k@tcs.com

Privacy Note:

https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice

  • Coordinate Innovation, AI and Research initiatives working with Sales, Account, CTO teams
  • Work with Sales and Account teams on research and advisory services related to strategy,
  • Prepare research papers and business presentations
  • Participate in conferences to enhance understanding of AI, Innovation, Sustainability themes


Your Qualifications:

  • Enrollment in a Bachelor's (at least in the 2nd year) or Master's degree program
  • Awarenes (or experience) of Digital Technology and Artificial Intelligence concepts
  • Experience in the field of sustainability and or AI/digital tech gained through seminar or project work, internships or extracurricular activities
  • Good to have: Project/ Uni experience on digital tech (low-code/ no-code platforms)
  • Passion for personal and professional development on Digital Technology and AI
  • Strong research and analytical skills
  • Networking skills to engage actively with internal and external stakeholders
  • Strong proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word).
  • Ability to work in an international working environment.
  • Structured and independent way of working
  • Business fluent in English and Swedish


Duration of Internship: six to twelve months

We look forward to receiving your application via Neelavani.k@tcs.com

Privacy Note:

https://ibegin.tcs.com/iBegin/privacy-notice

Title: Data Warehouse developer SQL 9 Months Contract
Description:
For our client, we are now looking for 2 Data Warehouse developers SQL.

The assignment involves development in the current SQL warehouse (SSIS 2019, SSMS 15.X).

The customer is facing fairly large changes in data flows that will require new development of, parallel and dismantling of existing flows. The work is done in SQL. A high degree of independence and initiative will be required. However, you will work in teams of 2-3 developers with a senior lead on site

Shell requirements:


Good track record of delivery
Team player
Good SQL skills



Requirements :


Meritorious with experience in regulated activities such as pharmacies or banks etc



Level : Level 3

Period: 2024-10-01 - 2025-05-31

Scope : 100% per consultant

Place of station : Solna

Requirements

Required skills

SQL

Data Warehouse

Languages

Swedish

Title: LIA - Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Carla

We believe that more people should be able to drive electric. Therefore, we have set out to build the safest, most convenient and transparent way to sell, buy, or lease an electric car. Carla was founded in 2020 in Stockholm, with strong VC backing. We have since then sold and delivered thousands of cars all over Sweden, and can boast over having the happiest customers in the car industry!

Who are we looking for?

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst Intern who is passionate about data and eager to dive into a variety of tasks. The ideal candidate is driven, digitally savvy, and possesses excellent written communication skills. A ‚Äúdoer‚Äù mentality is essential, as you‚Äôll be handling diverse responsibilities ranging from data analysis to visualization.

We Believe That The Ideal Candidate Have


Strong written communication skills (in Swedish and English)
Basic knowledge of SQL, BigQuery and Analytics
Experience using Excel and Google Sheets
Ability to analyze and interpret data to support marketing decisions
Create basic visualizations in tools such as Looker


What can we offer?

We promise a steep learning curve within digital marketing and e-commerce with a particular focus on data analysis. As a Data Analyst Intern at Carla, you will be given a great opportunity to learn, explore and gain experience within the field of data analysis to create real impact for a fast-growing start-up company.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join us in creating world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.




Appostrophe is a mobile app development company creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our portfolio consists of top-listed apps such as SCRL, Memo, Text Art, and Add Text that are used and loved by millions of people worldwide. We‚Äôre a small, ambitious team that enjoys working together in central Stockholm and are looking for more like-minded people to join our mission.




We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the analytics team that handles the data and analysis of an app portfolio with millions of monthly users.




What you will do

Be responsible for our ETL system, guaranteeing its ease of use, reliability, and error reporting capabilities.
Establish data retrieval processes to collect data from the services we use through API calls.
Support with creation of internal libraries to help with app metrics calculations.
Bring to production data scientists‚Äô models so that they can be accessed easily by the team.
Handle backend topics such as notifications messaging for in-app promotions.
Shape the development of our technologies aimed at the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data and metrics calculation.
Be a beacon and an evangelist of data culture throughout the company.




You should have

IT knowledge. You have excellent knowledge of Python, SQL and NodeJS or other languages used for data engineering.
Data pipelines owner.¬†You know how to fully manage data pipelines from data ingestions to processing in the most efficient way.
Interest in our industry.¬†You have experience or a strong interest in the subscription app business and you want to use your knowledge of data engineering to support Appostrophe in its mission to create the most amazing apps for its customers.
Good communication skills.¬†You are able to communicate insights, strategies, and results clearly and effectively to the team. You can make complex topics you manage easy to understand.
Quality and pragmatism.¬†You are able to work at a high pace without compromising quality.
Can-do attitude.¬†You are a self-motivated problem solver with an eye for details and an internal drive for excellence.




We offer

Opportunity to be creative and test new ideas.
Important role in a successful startup.
Great colleagues and office in central Stockholm.
Competitive salary.




Show more
HTML:
Join us in creating world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.


Appostrophe is a mobile app development company creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our portfolio consists of top-listed apps such as SCRL, Memo, Text Art, and Add Text that are used and loved by millions of people worldwide. We‚Äôre a small, ambitious team that enjoys working together in central Stockholm and are looking for more like-minded people to join our mission.


We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the analytics team that handles the data and analysis of an app portfolio with millions of monthly users.


What you will do

  • Be responsible for our ETL system, guaranteeing its ease of use, reliability, and error reporting capabilities.
  • Establish data retrieval processes to collect data from the services we use through API calls.
  • Support with creation of internal libraries to help with app metrics calculations.
  • Bring to production data scientists‚Äô models so that they can be accessed easily by the team.
  • Handle backend topics such as notifications messaging for in-app promotions.
  • Shape the development of our technologies aimed at the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data and metrics calculation.
  • Be a beacon and an evangelist of data culture throughout the company.


You should have

  • IT knowledge. You have excellent knowledge of Python, SQL and NodeJS or other languages used for data engineering.
  • Data pipelines owner. You know how to fully manage data pipelines from data ingestions to processing in the most efficient way.
  • Interest in our industry. You have experience or a strong interest in the subscription app business and you want to use your knowledge of data engineering to support Appostrophe in its mission to create the most amazing apps for its customers.
  • Good communication skills. You are able to communicate insights, strategies, and results clearly and effectively to the team. You can make complex topics you manage easy to understand.
  • Quality and pragmatism. You are able to work at a high pace without compromising quality.
  • Can-do attitude. You are a self-motivated problem solver with an eye for details and an internal drive for excellence.


We offer

  • Opportunity to be creative and test new ideas.
  • Important role in a successful startup.
  • Great colleagues and office in central Stockholm.
  • Competitive salary.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At Sandvik Group IT, we‚Äôre looking for a Data Engineer with strong technical skills to join us on an exciting transformation journey and build a new modern Azure data platform.

You‚Äôll be part of a diverse and collaborative team with a focus on building scalable and secured middle layer serving data to the front services.

Some Words About Us

At Sandvik, we're going through a major digital shift with the objective of becoming an industry leader within digital solutions and to enable operational excellence through digitalization. We welcome you to an open and supportive work environment where you get to grow and develop ‚Äì read more about our culture on our career site! We look forward to hearing from you!

Your mission

Your main focus is leading the exciting mission of building data pipelines to onboard data from various sources, such as relational databases, mainframe systems, APIs, and message queues. With Azure Cloud Platform as your targeted working environment, you develop scalable and secure services that harvest integrated data.

You have a strong voice in decision-making and our technical road map, and your work highly contributes to meeting data compliance and governance standards. You shape our work culture by sharing your knowledge, coaching junior developers, and partnering with the business, as you deploy data pipelines that deliver value and insights from data.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden and allows for a hybrid work schedule.

Your profile

We‚Äôre looking for a seasoned data engineer who can handle complex data challenges in an agile environment. You have:


A strong grasp of SQL and Python, and you can use Spark and Azure data bricks to build and manage scalable data solutions.
Familiarity with various data architectures, such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric, and you can design and implement data pipelines that integrate data from multiple sources, such as databases, flat files, API‚Äôs, and event-driven data feeds.
Proficiency in software development practices, such as Git version control, CI/CD, and Docker, and you can troubleshoot and optimize data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
Fluency in English.


Although your hard skills are important, we highly value your personality ‚Äì characterized by your forward-thinking mindset, helping you to drive change and continuous improvement across teams, tools, and processes. You‚Äôre comfortable communicating and building relationships with stakeholders at all over our organization and have the ability to easily ‚Äúgrasp the gist‚Äù. With your analytical mindset, you‚Äôre able to approach complex challenges and proactively tackle them with your team's help. You have a positive and open mind, and as a true team player, you‚Äôre intrigued by collaborating and motivating other team members in a multicultural environment.

Our culture

At Sandvik, we‚Äôre tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.

Contact information

For further information about this position, please contact:

Swati Falak, recruiting manager, swati.falak@sandvik.com

We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.

Union contacts ‚Äì Sweden

Anders R√∂nnqvist, Unionen, +46 (0)70 616 41 21

G√∂ran Norell, Akademikerf√∂reningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78

Peter Olsson-Andr√©e, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55

Recruitment Specialist

Gustaf Sj√∂gren

How To Apply

Send your application no later than August 15, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don‚Äôt accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0066184.

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers‚Äô processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.

We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers‚Äô processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal ‚Äì to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.

Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.

As a Data Engineer at Sambla Group you will be part of the responsibility over the orchestration, security work and integrations of all things data. You will get to work with all departments at Sambla Group, and work with modern cloud based technologies in GCP such as BigQuery, Pubsub, Cloud run, Cloud Functions, Cloud Build and artifact registry as well as other tools like dbt, prefect and Terraform. You will be part of the Data Engineering team and report to the Head of Data Engineering.

Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With


Design, build and administer data integrations and data pipelines that feed our data products (streaming, batch, api endpoints).
Ensure data security and GDPR compliance.
Ensure data quality, data governance and product uptime.
Develop and maintain Data Platform and Data Warehouse (BigQuery)
Architect cloud solutions and data models.



Must Have


1-3 years of work experience within data engineering or similar roles.
Working experience in Python, eg. pyspark/polars, flask/fastapi.
Working experience with SQL, e.g. joins, group by, CTEs, Window/Analytic Functions.
Working experience in cloud technologies, (GCP/AWS), preferably in GCP
Working experience with version control e.g. Git.
Working experience in stakeholder management, both technical/non-technical.
Project management experience, eg. screening/scoping/planning.



Nice To Have


Experience with CI/CD (CircleCI, Jenkins, Github Actions).
Experience with logging, monitoring and observability.
Experience from the Fintech industry.
Understanding of Data Modelling & Data Warehousing, e.g. dimensional modelling, data vault, SCD etc.
Understanding of the marketing data space and the platforms used (SEM, Social, Affiliate, Marketing Automation etc.).
Programming skills in Scala, Java, Rust or similar.
Experience with coaching coworkers.



What We Offer


Business in mind & people at heart ‚Äì we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people‚Äôs everyday lives.



Please note!

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks‚Äô offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At Coody, we're revolutionizing consulting by combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment. As a consultant with us, you'll enjoy a high salary, a generous benefits package, and the opportunity to work remotely. On average, our consultants increase their monthly pay by 44%. How is this possible?

The math is simple. We can pay you more because we cut costs on things that don't directly benefit you - no overpaid bosses, no expensive group conferences, and no big fancy offices. Instead, we invest in you, providing the trust and freedom you need to excel and compensating you accordingly. Welcome to Gravity Free Consulting.

Gravity Free Consulting @ Coody means:


Maximized Compensation: Typically a +44% salary increase.
Higher sense of freedom: No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who want.
Shaping the future: Work with digital game-changers like Mojang, Spotify, Tobii, Volumental, and various startups and scale-ups.


About Us

Coody is a dynamic and growing team for the new generation in tech, with assignments in Sweden, Finland, and the UK. Our broad network includes customers in Gaming, AI, XR/VR, EV, MedTech, and FinTech sectors.

We think of ourselves as a community platform rather than a traditional company. We are building a seamless existence for our consultants, where trust is high, and micro-management is low. We cherry-picked the functions that actually benefit consultants and are proud to share our benefits stated in our employee handbook.

What You'll Be Doing

As a Data Engineer consultant you'll work on technically, intellectually challenging and fun assignments for companies to strengthen their teams and projects.

You‚Äôll be an integral part of the organisation and expected to design and setting up well-functioning fully automated data platforms and data pipelines, as well as contributing to ways of working and product strategy.

You'll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see new challenges and situations as opportunities for growth. Typically, you'll work on 1-2 different assignments per year for companies in a sector you're passionate about.

What We Are Looking For


5+ years of experience working as a Data Engineer
Deep understanding of one or more technical areas stated below
Fluency in English (verbal and written)
Experience working in an agile environment
A doers mindset with a proven track record of getting things done


WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE THAT YOU HAVE

Experience from design, develop and maintain scalable data pipelines, infrastructure and tools

Solid understanding of cloud based environments e.g. Azure, AWS or GCP

Technical expertise with tools such as Python, Snowflake, Airflow, DBT, Tableu, ELT/ETL, BigQuery, Looker Studio, Kafka, Hadoop, Spark, SQL

An interest for becoming a wizard in Big data architecture

A degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Mathematics

If Gravity Free Consulting sounds like the perfect fit for you and your profile matches our needs, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

We will respond within a week if your profile aligns with our current requirements.

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.

Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world‚Äôs #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth with high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.







We, at the Data Science and Analytics Products team build centralized data products that serve the business and our customers. We collaborate across all of Truecaller, delivering products that require centralized ownership or where the competence to build the products is not present in the wider product organization.




As a Staff Data Scientist, you will be the right hand of the VP of Data Science and Analytics, you will take fuzzy business goals and transform them into data science products that can deliver value iteratively. Leading the data science work in the team, you will be responsible for structuring the work and ensuring that the outcomes match the business objectives. A significant part of this leadership will be coaching and mentoring other data scientists to guide and speed their development, as well as unblocking them and finding ways to make the team as happy and productive as possible.

Collaboration is a central requirement for this role, both when working with stakeholders, but also within the team to deliver results that cannot be delivered by one person on their own




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals
Gathering, collating, and understanding the data necessary to create data science products that delight the customers
Collaborating with stakeholders throughout Truecaller to find and build data science products that solve business and customer problems at scale.
Coaching and mentoring junior to senior data scientists to improve their technical skills and productivity




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python and SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
A solid understanding of the engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.

We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:




A smart, talented and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, top-up parental leave, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership (SATS).
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.
Do it your way: We work in-office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days. You can enjoy 3 weeks working remotely from anywhere you want per year.
Office life: Enjoy your days with a daily free breakfast, a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, or have fun with your colleagues at the playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!




Come as you are:




Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that‚Äôs why we would love to meet you.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:

Du kommer jobba med b√•de ‚Äùon premis‚Äù och molnbaserade l√∂sningar d√§r ambitionen √§r att leverera ‚Äùworld class‚Äù dataanalys f√∂r att bidra i v√•r verksamhetsutveckling och ambition att bli st√∂rst p√• riktigt. Title: Junior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you‚Äôll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You‚Äôll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more.

What You‚Äôll Do


You‚Äôll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10‚Äôs of billions of data points per day!!)
You‚Äôll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, and helping us understand how to improve and optimise our member's experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in statistics, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career.
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation across all areas of the product development lifecycle. You will use SQL and data visualisation skills to translate technical problems into actionable recommendations for product managers.
You will make contributions to the data model and contribute to building out data pipelines
You‚Äôll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, analytics managers, and analytics engineers PLUS, you‚Äôll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc.


About You


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with complex datasets.
Foundational coding experience (e.g. SQL. Python, R, Matlab, SAS, Java)
Experience with data visualisation
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methods.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings to non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-oriented mindset and a strong commitment to accuracy.
Internships, coursework, or projects involving data analysis or business intelligence are a plus.
Eagerness to learn and develop new skills in data analysis and business insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst



Salary: ¬£50,000 - ¬£60,000



Location: London, Hybrid



Data Idols is collaborating with a large, worldwide publishing company, continuously expanding its product and service range. This company is on an exciting growth trajectory, publishing significant research that has the potential to enhance society. With the aim of improving people's lives through books and journals at the heart of their business, they are searching for a Data Analyst to introduce new, innovative methods to the team.






The Opportunity



In this thrilling role as a Data Analyst, you will be pioneering data analysis to support and refine key reports and dashboards that are crucial for decision-making across the company. This is an opportunity to not only contribute to the data culture and drive efficiency in various analytic projects but also to engage with internal teams and present these findings.



What's in it for you?


Up to ¬£60k
Hybrid working


Skills and Experience



Including key requirements helps you to deter irrelevant candidates from applying for your role. We would also recommend making your key requirements screening questions:

Experience working wit SQL
Expereince working with Python
Experience with working with visulisation tools, preferably Power BI

If you would like to be considered for the role and feel you would be an ideal fit with our team then please send your CV to us by clicking on the Apply button below.


Desired Skills and Experience

SQL|Power BI|Python

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

A leading company in the CBD industry is seeking a passionate and motivated Junior Data Analyst to join their innovative team in Central London. This organisation is dedicated to delivering comprehensive CBD products and services, emphasizing sustainable, natural, and organic solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to gather and analyze data on industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape.
Data Analytics: Perform data collection, cleansing, and analysis to generate actionable insights. Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret complex data sets.
Direct Reporting: Act as a direct report to senior team members, providing accurate and timely data analysis and insights.
Presentation Work: Prepare and deliver clear, concise, and compelling presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.




This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - ¬£30k-¬£45k (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Title: Data Analyst (Python)
Description:
About the Company: A great opportunity to join a highly ambitious, London-based, food & drink consultancy on a mission to support our customers with expert data insight. They are one of the leading consultancies in the food and drinks industry, and provide expert consultancy through data and insight, powered by analytical thinking, outstanding expertise, and insights technology. They work with a broad range of clients emerging brands and operators and some of the most renowned businesses.




About the Role: They are looking for a Data Analyst confident in Python, SQL and GitHub to join their growing data team, this is more than a standard data role.




Responsibilities:

Restructure and maintain data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all product trackers and bespoke research.
Implement systems to help the optimization of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich internal data.
Assist in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
Set up and maintenance of automated data processes.
KPI tracking
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.




Qualifications:

Previous experience working with survey data
Working experience in Python and GitHub a non negotiable
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight / rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Dashboard building
Web analytics and behavioural tracking (i.e., Google Analytics)




Pay range and compensation package:35k-37k

Hybrid: 2 x days in London a week

Title: Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau/Power BI)
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau/Power BI)




Mobysoft is one of the fastest growing SaaS providers in the UK and has been shortlisted in the "Top 50 fastest growing technology companies in the North" for four successive years. Mobysoft provides predictive analytical software that has helped our customers deliver tens of millions of pounds in savings. Such is our success; customer numbers have doubled in little over two years and as a result we‚Äôre looking for great people to join our exciting team.




We have also just won AI Project of the year at the Real I.T Awards- one of the many awards we are proud of !




Role overview




Data Analytics plays a key part in this mission, working to bring together, explore and make sense of disparate data sources, which combine to create compelling stories for our clients such as developing trends and next best actions.

This function will serve as:

1. A bridge between data engineering and data science, helping us to explore and develop initial hypothesis for new data products and services, including appraisals of new data sources.

2. As a data translator and narrative generator, working alongside our business intelligence (BI) specialists to shape and deliver compelling, data-driven insights through reports, presentations, visualisations and dashboards.

As such we are looking for a stellar Data Analyst (DA) professional to join our dynamic team, working with our most excellent data engineers, data scientists and our superb senior data analyst Verity.‚Äù SQL, Tableau and Power BI are required for this position.




What will you be doing?

We're convinced that the data analyst role is key to a high functioning data & insights team, playing a part in many aspects of our work, here are some of the key areas we will looking for this role to progress:




Data discovery. Evaluating new data sources and how they can enhance current/support new product propositions through appropriately designed experiments.

Data trust. Providing analytics on the reliability of existing data and in collaboration with our data engineers helping to productionise on going monitoring with benchmarks.

Feature generation. Working with our data science team to explore and develop new/improved data features.

Measuring success. Researching and developing appropriate measures of product efficacy and return on investment (ROI) in collaboration with our sector experts.

Strategic Analytics. Identifying our clients' and business' analytical needs, organising these into clear, actionable plans, and ensuring their effective execution.

Insight Navigation. Liaising with our clients (directly or through events, conferences, webinars etc.), to help support their data driven journeys, finding the most compelling, clean and clear approach to effectively communicating their data insights story.

Emerging technologies. Researching augmented analytics and related artificial intelligence (AI) approaches to enhance our output - helping to implement solutions where practical.

Evolving standards. Working with the full data & insights team to further enhance our systems of work.




‚ÄúPlease note this is a professional, technical role, with no line management responsibilities. There will however be multiple opportunities to lead data engineering workstreams.‚Äù




Why should you consider this role?

Alongside the work opportunities as described your development will be supported, you will be sensibly renumerated, we will provide a compelling benefits package and we are a great bunch of folks to work with - though we would say that!




What qualifications and experience are we after?

Honours degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or similar quantitative discipline where data analytics plays a key role- ideally a(2:1+) honours degree
Ideally 4+ years of serious commercial experience working in a data analytics role.




What technical skills are required?

wrangling mastery- having the data shaping skills needed to deliver analysis across relational and non-relational data structures, working with structured, semi-structured and unstructured formats.
proficiency- very comfortable employing statistical techniques to solve commercial problems, including, hypothesis testing, feature transformations, dimensionality reduction, correlation analysis, regression analysis (multiple linear and logistic), time series analysis and Bayesian methods.
skills - adept in Python and its core data/analytics libraries (including in relation to working with Amazon Dynamo DB), alongside SQL, HiveQL, Scala. You will also have good familiarity with Git for version control and project management, alongside some knowledge of Linux/Shell.
data platform familiarity - previous experience of working with both Apache Spark and MapReduce data processing and analytics frameworks.
and reporting expertise - experience with Tableau, Power BI, Excel alongside notebooks for experiment documentation.

What experience and technical skills are desirable?

within AWS.
knowledge of VBA for efficient Excel work.
of graph analytics.




What else are we looking for?

to work effectively both as an individual (e.g., during remote deep work) and within a team - supportive, collaborative.
keen interest in data analytics - bringing to the team, new approaches, best practice developments, and analytical methods from other walks of life.
critical thinker and a problem solver.
proactive, detail focused, person who is curious and seeks continuous improvement both in our systems and their skills.
written and verbal communication, including effective communication with non-technical audiences.
individual who takes a keen interest in productivity, working to optimise their own output as part of a team that values this highly.




Benefits

Competitive salary and rewards package including: - Private Health care , 4 x salary Life cover, 25 days annual leave, increasing to 28 after 3 years service ,salary sacrifice pension scheme and much more ..

HTML:
Data Analyst (SQL/Tableau/Power BI)


Mobysoft is one of the fastest growing SaaS providers in the UK and has been shortlisted in the "Top 50 fastest growing technology companies in the North" for four successive years. Mobysoft provides predictive analytical software that has helped our customers deliver tens of millions of pounds in savings. Such is our success; customer numbers have doubled in little over two years and as a result we‚Äôre looking for great people to join our exciting team.


We have also just won AI Project of the year at the Real I.T Awards- one of the many awards we are proud of !


Role overview


Data Analytics plays a key part in this mission, working to bring together, explore and make sense of disparate data sources, which combine to create compelling stories for our clients such as developing trends and next best actions.

This function will serve as:

1. A bridge between data engineering and data science, helping us to explore and develop initial hypothesis for new data products and services, including appraisals of new data sources.

2. As a data translator and narrative generator, working alongside our business intelligence (BI) specialists to shape and deliver compelling, data-driven insights through reports, presentations, visualisations and dashboards.

As such we are looking for a stellar Data Analyst (DA) professional to join our dynamic team, working with our most excellent data engineers, data scientists and our superb senior data analyst Verity.‚Äù SQL, Tableau and Power BI are required for this position.


What will you be doing?

We're convinced that the data analyst role is key to a high functioning data & insights team, playing a part in many aspects of our work, here are some of the key areas we will looking for this role to progress:


Data discovery. Evaluating new data sources and how they can enhance current/support new product propositions through appropriately designed experiments.

Data trust. Providing analytics on the reliability of existing data and in collaboration with our data engineers helping to productionise on going monitoring with benchmarks.

Feature generation. Working with our data science team to explore and develop new/improved data features.

Insight Navigation. Liaising with our clients (directly or through events, conferences, webinars etc.), to help support their data driven journeys, finding the most compelling, clean and clear approach to effectively communicating their data insights story.

Emerging technologies. Researching augmented analytics and related artificial intelligence (AI) approaches to enhance our output - helping to implement solutions where practical.

Evolving standards. Working with the full data & insights team to further enhance our systems of work.


‚ÄúPlease note this is a professional, technical role, with no line management responsibilities. There will however be multiple opportunities to lead data engineering workstreams.‚Äù


Why should you consider this role?

Alongside the work opportunities as described your development will be supported, you will be sensibly renumerated, we will provide a compelling benefits package and we are a great bunch of folks to work with - though we would say that!


What qualifications and experience are we after?

  • Honours degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or similar quantitative discipline where data analytics plays a key role- ideally a(2:1+) honours degree
  • Ideally 4+ years of serious commercial experience working in a data analytics role.


What technical skills are required?

  • wrangling mastery- having the data shaping skills needed to deliver analysis across relational and non-relational data structures, working with structured, semi-structured and unstructured formats.
  • proficiency- very comfortable employing statistical techniques to solve commercial problems, including, hypothesis testing, feature transformations, dimensionality reduction, correlation analysis, regression analysis (multiple linear and logistic), time series analysis and Bayesian methods.
  • skills - adept in Python and its core data/analytics libraries (including in relation to working with Amazon Dynamo DB), alongside SQL, HiveQL, Scala. You will also have good familiarity with Git for version control and project management, alongside some knowledge of Linux/Shell.
  • data platform familiarity - previous experience of working with both Apache Spark and MapReduce data processing and analytics frameworks.
  • and reporting expertise - experience with Tableau, Power BI, Excel alongside notebooks for experiment documentation.

What experience and technical skills are desirable?

  • within AWS.
  • knowledge of VBA for efficient Excel work.
  • of graph analytics.


What else are we looking for?

  • to work effectively both as an individual (e.g., during remote deep work) and within a team - supportive, collaborative.
  • keen interest in data analytics - bringing to the team, new approaches, best practice developments, and analytical methods from other walks of life.
  • critical thinker and a problem solver.
  • proactive, detail focused, person who is curious and seeks continuous improvement both in our systems and their skills.
  • written and verbal communication, including effective communication with non-technical audiences.
  • individual who takes a keen interest in productivity, working to optimise their own output as part of a team that values this highly.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics Manager

D2C | Entertainment | App

¬£45,000 - ¬£60,000

London | Hybrid

Please note this role is unable to offer sponsorship.




The Company:

This company has created a culinary community that transforms the everyday cooking experience into a vibrant and accessible adventure. With a focus on bringing people together through food, it offers a unique blend of creative recipes, budget-friendly meal ideas, and engaging content that inspires both novice and experienced cooks. The approach goes beyond traditional cooking shows, infusing each dish with a sense of fun, inclusivity, and practicality. This group turns the kitchen into a social hub where delicious meals are created and shared, making cooking a delightful part of everyday life.







As Data Analytics Manager you will:

Develop and optimize our data infrastructure to ensure scalable tools, architecture, and technical projects for analytics.
Analyse customer data to deeply understand our audience and transform these insights into actionable outcomes that align with business objectives.
Identify which content and product features drive user acquisition, monetization, and retention.
Provide data to the Marketing team to clarify which marketing channels are most effective for acquiring, monetizing, and retaining users.
Translate complex analyses into understandable insights and conclusions.
Manage and enhance existing dashboards and reporting systems, promoting data accessibility for stakeholders to improve data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to guide and shape product personalization.
Recommend updates to product and engineering roadmaps to enhance data quality in source systems and strengthen analytical workflows.
Ensure data solutions are well-documented for consistent organizational use.
Build strong relationships with stakeholders and become a trusted partner to promote a data-driven culture.
Identify and validate opportunities to inform growth and product strategy, including new areas like B2B consumer insights.







Experience:

You have over 3 years of experience using analytics to address business questions and drive value toward business goals.
Experience as a Data Analyst in a D2C business is preferred but not required. The ideal candidate has a proven track record of effectively solving business challenges and acting on dynamic insights promptly, with a curiosity for understanding and influencing consumer behavior on digital platforms.
A creative thinker who excels at developing, presenting, and utilizing data, with strong communication skills and the ability to present data in an effective, compelling, and concise manner that influences everyday business operations.
Comfortable working cross-functionally, with an understanding of various functions and how they contribute to the business (e.g., understanding the nuances of marketing and its interplay with product analytics).
We are a fast-growing start-up, so you must be comfortable working in small, agile teams where everyone gets involved.







If you're interested in the Data Analytics Manager role please apply below...

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose

At Travelex, data is at the heart of our relationship with our customers. We analyse data in order to understand what our customers prefer and how our products perform. Our work is fast-paced although our team remains collaborative and flexible even when delivering fast.

Your role as data analyst will be to run a wide range of queries on our datasets, interpret the results, and communicate your findings to colleagues and stakeholders. You will be working with product owners, subject matter experts, managers and engineers across the company to develop deep insight on our customers and products.

You will have an end-to-end responsibility for your deliverables: from leading the work to agree the right approach, through developing, running and continuously refining your queries, all the way to presenting your results and recommending what the business should do about them. You will have significant impact on the way our business evolves, and a high level of freedom to do things in your own way.




Responsibilities

Here are key things you‚Äôll do as a data analyst in our team. The list isn‚Äôt complete: as a competent analyst, you‚Äôll bring to Travelex your own ideas of what else is needed to become a world-class data-driven business.

Work with colleagues to understand their analytical needs and convert these into robust analytical tasks
Explore data in a range of business domains, such as: retail customer behaviour; online customer behaviour; payment cards; product performance; colleague performance; HR; finance, cost and pricing
Analyse data to understand trends, gaps and anomalies
Build time series, models and forecasts
Compare the performance of products, campaigns and sales across the different geographies where Travelex operates
Help automate analytical tasks so that powerful analytics can come with little effort
Present your findings in a simple, compelling and inspiring way
Develop visualisations and infographics that will shed light on complex business questions
Derive metrics from data and build the processes to monitor these metrics over time
Have particular responsibility for data quality: defining it, monitoring it and improving it




Key Requirements

This vacancy is for someone who greatly enjoys problem-solving, simplifying complex data into simple insight, and continuous learning. Below are key requirements from our data analyst, but you don‚Äôt need to tick every box: success in our team comes in many forms!

Competent in analysing data using SQL and Python
Familiar with AWS, including databases, data services and analytics capabilities
Experienced with SageMaker
Capable of creating engaging visualisations and infographics
A strong storyteller, who can turn a big pile of numbers into an interesting narrative
Self-starter and independent, able to turn loosely-defined requirements into concrete deliverables by asking questions, taking initiative and recommending a way forward
A good team player, who enjoys brainstorming and engaging, and is able to resolve differences of opinion in a constructive way
Understands the foundations of information security and data protection
Able to learn new tools, languages and methods quickly
Have the curiosity to understand the business, its requirements and culture
Knowledge of visualisation tools (e.g. Amazon QuickSight) and data modelling techniques isn‚Äôt essential but would be an advantage
Familiarity with DBT would be an advantage
Experience of building machine learning models, and familiarity with the common ML libraries in Python, would be an advantage
Your own unique style or way of working, which will make our team diverse and original




Why Travelex?

To remain the world‚Äôs leading Foreign Exchange specialist, we focus on making our customers‚Äô lives hassle-free while they travel.

We are customer-centric and innovative. Our digital and data products are part of our investment in the future of Foreign Exchange, cross-border e-commerce and international payments.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example- she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).




TrustedHousesitters is a global pet care travel exchange; a two-sided digital marketplace of owners and sitters that‚Äôs growing rapidly through our unique combination of product, proposition, marketing and community building. Our small but mighty team has a collaborative and supportive culture. We‚Äôre passionate about pets, people and travel; continuously searching for the win, win, win that makes everyone‚Äôs lives easier, travel kinder on the pet and enables a more sustainable travel footprint.




We're fully in scale-up mode and have grown to be the only global platform of its kind. In the last few years, we‚Äôve consistently achieved high year-on-year growth. Thanks to strong tailwinds in the pet and travel industry in the post-Covid world, 2022 has been our strongest year so far. We facilitate the perfect match between pet owners who want to leave their pets in safe hands and pet sitters looking to enjoy the companionship of pets whilst they travel.




We've recently made the transition to a remote-first business, however we've retained a HQ in central Brighton which is available for collaborative working and in-person meetups.




The role




We are looking for a passionate analyst to join a growing Analytics & Insight team. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

Dealing with large data sets from various sources, you will be generating insight by analysing web, app and member data. Whether you are generating reports, dashboards or larger research projects you will be providing various teams with the information they need to improve their processes and make critical decisions. As well as fielding data requests from around the business, analysts sit within a Product squad to support that Product roadmap with analysis and insight. You will use various tools to extract data from standard web analytics tools like Google Analytics, or use SQL to extract customer data from our data warehouse. You will also be dealing with the tag management and event tracking required for our customer data platform, Segment.




Salary for this role is up to ¬£45k DOE




Requirements




Ideally at least 1 year of experience working as an analyst, though we are also willing to consider candidates with other relevant experience in an academic environment.
Demonstrable ability to produce high-quality, automated reports and dashboards
Expertise regarding data models, database design, data mining and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of, and experience working with, SQL, BI tools, and web analytics packages (Google Analytics, Amplitude etc)
Some knowledge of, or an interest in, statistics and data science (Python, R, etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at writing queries, producing reports and presenting findings
An eagerness to learn how to use new systems and analytics tools
Qualifications in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Statistics would be useful but are not a requirement
Interpreting data, analysing results and providing reports and dashboards
Acquiring data from various sources and QA/maintaining those sources
Identifying, analysing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets
Presenting insight back to the business, enabling data driven decisions
Working with a Product Manager to gather data requirements as new features are developed and tested
Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities




Benefits




In addition to a competitive salary and bonus, we offer a range of benefits, including:




Fully remote work
Discretionary 10% annual bonus scheme
25 days holiday annually
Pension scheme: 5% from you as an employee and 3% from TrustedHousesitters
Premium TrustedHousesitters pet owner and sitter membership which includes benefits like airport lounge passes, sit cancellation insurance, and home and contents insurance for sits
Our team have an unlimited housesitting allowance, can work remotely from their sits, and TrustedHousesitters will contribute up to ¬£500 per year towards travel costs
¬£200 annually towards home office equipment
Monthly working from home stipend
Macbook
Find a rescue pet to join your family and we‚Äôll cover the adoption fees, as well as paternity to help any pet settle into their new home
We host a quarterly all expenses paid meetup, and will fund team events (remote or in person) throughout the year
We can cover costs of personal development resources, and have regular time set aside for personal development
Health Insurance plan, including dental (Bupa)
Brighton Bikeshare

Access to Spaces Locations across the globe




If you're ready to join us on our mission to become the most loved pet travel solution, we'd love to hear from you.




At the heart of our team are a mix of diverse backgrounds. Here at TrustedHousesitters, we‚Äôre committed to the equal opportunities policy throughout the interview process and selection. Offers of employment into TrustedHousesitters are based solely on individual merit, qualifications, and the person's professional suitability.




Gender identity, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, colour, race, nationality, ethnic or national origins, religion or beliefs, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, pregnancy or maternity status, or any other protected characteristics do not enter into our decision-making process.

HTML:
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example- she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).


TrustedHousesitters is a global pet care travel exchange; a two-sided digital marketplace of owners and sitters that‚Äôs growing rapidly through our unique combination of product, proposition, marketing and community building. Our small but mighty team has a collaborative and supportive culture. We‚Äôre passionate about pets, people and travel; continuously searching for the win, win, win that makes everyone‚Äôs lives easier, travel kinder on the pet and enables a more sustainable travel footprint.


We're fully in scale-up mode and have grown to be the only global platform of its kind. In the last few years, we‚Äôve consistently achieved high year-on-year growth. Thanks to strong tailwinds in the pet and travel industry in the post-Covid world, 2022 has been our strongest year so far. We facilitate the perfect match between pet owners who want to leave their pets in safe hands and pet sitters looking to enjoy the companionship of pets whilst they travel.


We've recently made the transition to a remote-first business, however we've retained a HQ in central Brighton which is available for collaborative working and in-person meetups.


The role


We are looking for a passionate analyst to join a growing Analytics & Insight team. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.

Dealing with large data sets from various sources, you will be generating insight by analysing web, app and member data. Whether you are generating reports, dashboards or larger research projects you will be providing various teams with the information they need to improve their processes and make critical decisions. As well as fielding data requests from around the business, analysts sit within a Product squad to support that Product roadmap with analysis and insight. You will use various tools to extract data from standard web analytics tools like Google Analytics, or use SQL to extract customer data from our data warehouse. You will also be dealing with the tag management and event tracking required for our customer data platform, Segment.


Salary for this role is up to ¬£45k DOE


Requirements


  • Ideally at least 1 year of experience working as an analyst, though we are also willing to consider candidates with other relevant experience in an academic environment.
  • Demonstrable ability to produce high-quality, automated reports and dashboards
  • Expertise regarding data models, database design, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Knowledge of, and experience working with, SQL, BI tools, and web analytics packages (Google Analytics, Amplitude etc)
  • Some knowledge of, or an interest in, statistics and data science (Python, R, etc)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at writing queries, producing reports and presenting findings
  • An eagerness to learn how to use new systems and analytics tools
  • Qualifications in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Statistics would be useful but are not a requirement
  • Interpreting data, analysing results and providing reports and dashboards
  • Acquiring data from various sources and QA/maintaining those sources
  • Identifying, analysing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Presenting insight back to the business, enabling data driven decisions
  • Working with a Product Manager to gather data requirements as new features are developed and tested
  • Locating and defining new process improvement opportunities


Benefits


In addition to a competitive salary and bonus, we offer a range of benefits, including:


  • Fully remote work
  • Discretionary 10% annual bonus scheme
  • 25 days holiday annually
  • Pension scheme: 5% from you as an employee and 3% from TrustedHousesitters
  • Premium TrustedHousesitters pet owner and sitter membership which includes benefits like airport lounge passes, sit cancellation insurance, and home and contents insurance for sits
  • Our team have an unlimited housesitting allowance, can work remotely from their sits, and TrustedHousesitters will contribute up to ¬£500 per year towards travel costs
  • ¬£200 annually towards home office equipment
  • Monthly working from home stipend
  • Macbook
  • Find a rescue pet to join your family and we‚Äôll cover the adoption fees, as well as paternity to help any pet settle into their new home
  • We host a quarterly all expenses paid meetup, and will fund team events (remote or in person) throughout the year
  • We can cover costs of personal development resources, and have regular time set aside for personal development
  • Health Insurance plan, including dental (Bupa)
  • Brighton Bikeshare
  • Recruitment Referral Bonus
  • Access to Spaces Locations across the globe


If you're ready to join us on our mission to become the most loved pet travel solution, we'd love to hear from you.


At the heart of our team are a mix of diverse backgrounds. Here at TrustedHousesitters, we‚Äôre committed to the equal opportunities policy throughout the interview process and selection. Offers of employment into TrustedHousesitters are based solely on individual merit, qualifications, and the person's professional suitability.


Gender identity, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, colour, race, nationality, ethnic or national origins, religion or beliefs, age, mental or physical disability, medical condition, pregnancy or maternity status, or any other protected characteristics do not enter into our decision-making process.



If you have a medical condition or an individual need for an adjustment to our process, and you believe this may affect your ability to be at your best - please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support you and make any adjustments that may be needed.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and product managers in providing data-driven insights across all stages of the product development lifecycle. This role will focus on experimentation, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys a fast-paced environment and has a passion for contributing to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

Key Accountabilities


Be an analytical thought partner to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product managers. This will include providing analytical support across all areas of the product development lifecycle, from ideation and broad product strategy to analytics deep dives and experimentation.
You will lead experimentation across an area of the product. You will design and execute multi-step experiments to understand the impact of a feature or product change on user behaviour and business KPIs. You will interpret experiment results and translate them into actionable recommendations for a non-technical audience.
You will own event tracking for one area of the app, understanding which events are critical to track user behaviour.
You will create self-serve dashboards to ensure stakeholders have access to real-time insights.
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will develop deep knowledge of the product domain, becoming an authority on its characteristics, drivers, and subsystems.
You will contribute to data quality related to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience using SQL and python to solve data science, statistical and analytics problems.
I prefer experience working in similar dating, social, or gaming tech product industries or in financial services or high-data-volume industries.
You have experience working in a highly collaborative cross functional space and translating technical insights for a non-technical audience.
You have experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience creating data visualisations and self serve tools for a product forced audience.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in product analytics analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability to create impact through the power of customer-led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping cross functional teams to define the questions that help support product development.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.

Title: Data Analyst - Paid Display
Description:
Company Description

Wise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world‚Äôs money. Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.

Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their life easier and save them money.

As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world's money. For everyone, everywhere. More about our mission.

Job Description

In this role, you will support the Paid Display marketing team to help them improve their marketing strategies!

As part of this role, you will have the unique opportunity to work with an extensive dataset of over 16 million customers. Your mission will be to uncover insights, measure marketing effectiveness, and handle the analytical requirements to enable one of our largest paid marketing channels to optimise and grow through data-driven decisions.

Here‚Äôs How You‚Äôll Be Contributing


You will own the paid display data pipelines and analytical domains, improving them as needed.
You will provide actionable insights to help the paid display team to optimise their campaigns and find areas of improvement.
You will propose and execute incrementality tests to measure the real value of paid display campaigns. Additionally, you will collaborate with Paid Display managers to support and validate their testing ideas.
You will help the team improve the marketing message segmentation strategy.
You will maintain and create reports and dashboards to equip the team with the data they need for decision making.
You will contribute defining impactful OKRs to work throughout the quarter.
Additionally, you will also be able to work on more cross functional projects covering more channels.


This Role Will Give You The Opportunity To


Be part of our mission to make money without borders!
Contribute to the growth of the company by enhancing the effectiveness of marketing efforts.
Collaborate with diverse teams such as marketing, analytics, data science and engineering.
Continue learning and developing in areas such as data analysis, performance tracking and marketing measurement.


Qualifications


You have worked in a data analyst role.
You have advanced SQL skills and can work with complex data models.
Python/R skills are advantageous.
You are able to demonstrate that you can tell a story with data and proactively give guidance on strategy based on insights.
You have experience with data visualisation tools (Looker, Superset, etc.).
Experience in performance marketing analytics is advantageous but not required.
Experience in causal effect measurement is advantageous as well.


Additional Information

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders ‚Äî without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.

Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.
