Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive insightful decision-making? Do you excel in presenting visually compelling dashboards and creating user-friendly data applications? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!




Join a growing team at a leading provider of management services. Our client is dedicated to leveraging technology to enhance client experiences and drive business growth. With a commitment to innovation, they are currently harnessing the power of PowerBI and custom-built data solutions to provide valuable insights to their clients.




As a Data Analyst, the successful candidate will be responsible for delivering impactful insights through visually engaging dashboards and building accessible data applications. They will collaborate closely with the data team to extract, analyse, and visualise data from various sources, including the Dynamics system and SQL Server. The role requires strong communication skills as they will present these solutions to clients, helping them understand trends, identify opportunities, and make informed decisions.




Key Responsibilities:




Create visually appealing dashboards using PowerBI to present insights derived from multiple data sources.
Develop and maintain user-friendly data applications that allow business users to access and analyse data independently.
Design and manage databases using SQL Server to ensure efficient data storage and retrieval.
Analyse data trends and patterns to identify key insights and opportunities for clients.
Collaborate with the data team to ensure accurate and timely data extraction and analysis.
Present dashboards and data applications to clients in a clear, concise, and engaging manner, fostering productive discussions and driving action.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in data visualisation, database management, and application development.




Requirements:




Proficiency in PowerBI and creating interactive dashboards.
Experience with SQL Server for database design, management, and querying.
Experience with developing data applications using tools such as Microsoft Access, low-code/no-code platforms (e.g., Microsoft PowerApps), or basic programming languages (e.g., Python, VBA).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to distil technical information into understandable insights.
Experience working with Dynamics or similar CRM systems is a plus.
A proactive and collaborative approach to problem-solving.




Why Join?




Opportunity to work with user-friendly data tools and drive innovation in the property management industry.
Collaborative and supportive work environment where ideas and contributions are valued.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Convenient location in Birmingham City Centre, with flexible working hours (three days per week in office).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A global management consulting firm is urgently seeking experienced Data Strategy & Advisory Consultants to join and help expand their Data & Analytics practice at the Manager / Principal Consultant level.




Our client is looking for a Subject Matter Experts in Data & Analytics with a Management Consulting background, where you will be involved in delivering strategic advisory services to client senior stakeholders, where you will be leading efforts in assessing the maturity of clients‚Äô Data, Analytics and AI capabilities through multiple methods.




The ideal candidate should hold a combination of experience across some of the following areas:




Data Management
Analytics & Insights
Business Intelligence
Data Visualisation
Data Modelling
Data Architecture
Data Quality
Data Governance
Big Data
Data Warehousing
Data Migration
AI Analytics
Data Science
Data Strategy




The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 4years of experience and come from a Management Consulting background.




This is a unique opportunity to join a rapidly expanding Data & Analytics practice driving Data Strategy & Advisory with a range of exciting clients. This organisation offers a hybrid working environment, has excellent training & career development as well as a streamlined promotion process with excellent remuneration offered.




Further to the above, you must have full right to work in the UK without sponsorship. It is also essential that you come from a consulting background for this role.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London üåÜ




Remuneration: Hourly rate ¬£35.58 üí∏




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ‚åõ




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ‚è∞




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. üìà




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a Hybrid role 3 days a week onsite




Purpose

The Data Analyst is responsible for turning large and complex data sets into meaningful insights that drive business decisions. The role requires a combination of technical and communication skills to effectively analyse, interpret and visualise data to uncover insights and support business decision-making.




Responsibilities




Collect and analyse large and complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other data visualisation tools to provide stakeholders with easy-to-understand insights.
the management of Power BI assets, including reports, dashboards, workspaces, and the underlying datasets that are used in the reports and dashboard
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions to support their use cases.
Develop and maintain predictive models to support forecasting and decision-making.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to support specific business initiatives and projects.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and trends in the data analytics field and recommend improvements to client‚Äôs data analysis processes.
Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, using both written and verbal communication.




Skills Required




Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data analysis tools such as Excel, Tableau, and PowerBI.
Experience with data processing technologies such as Apache Spark and Apache Flink.
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and experience with programming languages such as Python, R, and SAS.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Passion for staying up-to-date with new technologies and trends in the data analytics field.
Willingness to travel around the UK, across the Port Estates as required for specific projects and generally




Desirable

Experience working in Port /Supply Chain or Logistics industry

Title: Data Analyst, Operations
Description:
Inclusion at Bumble Inc.

Bumble Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and we strongly encourage people of all ages, colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents, people with disabilities, and neurodivergent people to apply. We're happy to make any reasonable adjustments that will help you feel more confident throughout the process, please don't hesitate to let us know how we can help.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her, he/him, they/them, etc).

Bumble Inc. is seeking an experienced Data Analyst, Operations to work with stakeholders across Member Operations and Trust & Safety. The Operations Analytics team is responsible for all metrics related to operations efficiency, cost, and longevity. It provides support with the analytical, data science, and analytics engineering capabilities required to scale reporting, forecasting, and insights around member retention, workforce management, and operational efficiency.

This is a unique opportunity for an analyst who enjoys a dynamic environment of a growing company, has experience in operational analytics and has a passion to make a positive impact on customers and the business whilst contributing to the Bumble Inc.‚Äôs mission to foster kind connections.

You would ideally have an extensive background in operations analytics at a relevant tech company, with proven experience of driving commercial impact through applying analytics to critical business problems.

You bring experience of working with complex sources of customer operations, payments and behavioural data. You will be fluent in a range of analytical techniques from data modelling, self-serve analytics, to data science and forecasting as applied to workforce management, abuse moderation, and regulatory reporting, and will have a deep understanding of operations and moderation.

You understand the high-level business model of the company and the primary drivers and output metrics to efficiently receive a stakeholder request, draft a project/insights brief and proactively ask for additional scope clarity where necessary.

Key Accountabilities


Collaborate with the member operations and trust and safety teams to generate actionable and pragmatic insights and recommendations, automating decision-making where necessary, and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
Efficiently present your information to executive stakeholders, effectively select the right visualisation types and abstract technical complexities in accessible business language.
Drive core business insights around cost to serve, average handling time, and other operational efficiencies. Design and build reporting suites relevant to the operational stakeholders using multiple domain areas across cost, operations, and business metrics.
Act as a trusted thought partner in the customer operations domain and collaborate with other areas of analytics and the business to bring to light how product and other customer initiatives impact the member support and trust and safety and vice versa.
You will act as translator between business and analyst requirements and applications to the data model.
You will optimise reporting to reflect consistency in sources of truth, and align stakeholders in your domain on definitions of metrics and dimensions.
You will work closely with your team and stakeholders in operations and trust and safety domain to support them with the most impactful priorities, reduce time to insight, ensure data quality and reliability.
You will work with advanced analytics models and methods across the core levers of operations (including experimentation, ML and automation).


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
Preference for experience working in similar dating/social/gaming tech product industries or else financial services/high-data-volume industries.
3+ years experience in commercial/operational analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.
You have experience and knowledge of the operations domain across multiple channels, tools, and understand the tooling/vendor landscape (Zendesk, UnitQ among others) and opportunities for automation introduction of genAi.
You have had experience setting up experimentation (A/B testing), measurement, and data collection.
You have experience in building and deploying ML and statistical models for demand forecasting and segmentation.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
Strong experience with data engineering and data modelling requirements needed to automate reporting and measurement.
You have worked with multiple data visualisation and transformation tools, with preference for DBT, Airflow, Fivetran, and Tableau/Powerbi/Looker or similar.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.‚Äôs brand vision and values.
Engaging , inspiring and clear communicator.
A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes, up to exec level.
Deep commercial understanding, and a proven ability of creating impact through the power of customer led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping teams you work with to define the questions that help support the business, and confidence in pushing back and saying no where needed.
You can manipulate large datasets, combining data from multiple sources to obtain the required results.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with Python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.You are an expert in SQL and Python and are willing to upskill teams on best practices.
You can break down and explain complex processes, requirements and data pipelines to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
You‚Äôll have demonstrable experience in presenting these solutions to your peers.


About Us

Bumble Inc. is the parent company of Bumble, Badoo, Fruitz and Official. The Bumble platform enables people to build healthy and equitable relationships, through kind connections. Founded by Whitney Wolfe Herd in 2014, Bumble was one of the first dating apps built with women at the center and connects people across dating (Bumble Date), friendship (Bumble BFF) and professional networking (Bumble Bizz). Badoo, which was founded in 2006, is one of the pioneers of web and mobile dating products. Fruitz, founded in 2017, encourages open and honest communication of dating intentions through playful fruit metaphors. Official is an app for couples that promotes open and honest communication between partners and was founded in 2020.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | ¬£40,000 - ¬£50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)




Here at Burns Sheehan, we have partnered up with a well-established name in the UK market for over 20 years who have just been bought out by an experienced leader in the gambling industry as they look to invest heavily within growth and explore International Markets.




As a result, they are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team and report into the Head of Analytics as one of the 1st key hires in this initial growth phase. In this role you will be responsible for taking over the curation and development of a suite of Power BI reports, which are used across all areas of the business to help drive strategy and run the day to day mechanics of the organisation.




Skills and Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Similar...
2 + Years experience within Data Analysis
Proficient in SQL / T-SQL and PowerBI (Potentially Tableau)




With a two-decade presence in the UK, this company has a proven track record of success and customer loyalty this an amazing time to join as the companies goes from strength to strength. If you are a Data Analyst with excellent experience across both SQL and PowerBI feel free to apply and I will get back to you accordingly !!!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB TITLE ‚ÄìData Analyst - Marketing

Location - London




Your New Company

With over 244 offices in 33 countries across the globe, Hays are the largest specialist recruitment agency. Hays is recognised in the recruitment sector for its industry leading training & development opportunities.




Role Objectives

The Senior Data Analyst works within the UK&I Marketing Department to develop and deliver reporting and insight analysis to all business stakeholders.







Responsibilities

Creating dashboards and reports using Excel and Power BI
Support the monitoring of marketing campaign performance across the department
Maintain and deliver monthly KPI and ROI reporting for the UK&I management board and to support the marketing planning team at regional ops meetings
Creating and maintaining documentation for processes and best practices
Improve access to data sets and bring together to automate use where possible.







Skills and Competencies

Good understanding of Marketing Principles
Work autonomously, but collaboratively, demonstrating ownership in ALL activities
Demonstrates behaviour which supports the Hays brand values: Expert; Ambitious; Inquisitive; Passionate about People
Capable of interpreting data in order to make sound and timely business decisions
MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills essential
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively under pressure and to strict deadlines




Essential

Proven ability to design visually impactful dashboards and tell a meaningful story
Experience with complex DAX queries
Using Power Query to load, transform, and curate the data
Strong SQL skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures
Logical mindset and strong attention to details
Project management skills




Desirable:

Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
Experience with SFMC automations
Knowledge of Python
Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
Proficiency in PowerPoint
Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio




What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You‚Äôll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you‚Äôll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You‚Äôll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.




Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
Flexible hybrid working patterns
Opportunity to take your career globally
Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
Referral bonus scheme
Community of internal support networks.
Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.




Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you‚Äôre thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let‚Äôs work together to create it!




At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background. We know that diversity of perspective and an inclusive approach, which encourages those experiences and views to be heard, is great for business and therefore your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
About the job



My client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their data team. This role will be pivotal in modeling data and constructing their internal data platform for the first time. Key responsibilities include using dbt to transform data into accurate and dynamic models for business insights and reporting. Additionally, the Data Analyst will assist in the entire data process, from digestion to visualization.



Role Requirements


Collaborate with data scientists to design, evaluate, and monitor the performance of models and algorithms.
Work with data scientists, data engineers, and backend developers to address client and user challenges.
Ensure accurate data collection in partnership with data engineers.
Enhance customer understanding to provide tailored solutions.
Conduct end-to-end data analysis, from data cleaning to insight extraction.
Demonstrate value to prospective clients by expanding on existing tools and techniques.
Develop innovative methods to showcase key analysis from complex data sets.
Drive product and business strategy through analytical findings.


Required Skills


2/3+ years of experience as a data analyst.
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
Proficiency in Python (especially Pandas) and SQL.
Solid understanding of statistical methods.
Experience with visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Superset, etc.
Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
Knowledge of data ethics.

HTML:
About the job

My client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their data team. This role will be pivotal in modeling data and constructing their internal data platform for the first time. Key responsibilities include using dbt to transform data into accurate and dynamic models for business insights and reporting. Additionally, the Data Analyst will assist in the entire data process, from digestion to visualization.

Role Requirements

  • Collaborate with data scientists to design, evaluate, and monitor the performance of models and algorithms.
  • Work with data scientists, data engineers, and backend developers to address client and user challenges.
  • Ensure accurate data collection in partnership with data engineers.
  • Enhance customer understanding to provide tailored solutions.
  • Conduct end-to-end data analysis, from data cleaning to insight extraction.
  • Demonstrate value to prospective clients by expanding on existing tools and techniques.
  • Develop innovative methods to showcase key analysis from complex data sets.
  • Drive product and business strategy through analytical findings.

Required Skills

  • 2/3+ years of experience as a data analyst.
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
  • Proficiency in Python (especially Pandas) and SQL.
  • Solid understanding of statistical methods.
  • Experience with visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Superset, etc.
  • Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
  • Knowledge of data ethics.
  • Ability to present analysis and insights to diverse audiences.
  • Strong work ethic and a thirst for knowledge.

Desired Skills

  • Basic understanding of machine learning and a keen interest in further learning.
  • Fluency in statistics.
  • Good understanding of computer science concepts.
  • Domain knowledge or experience in the Financial Services industry or Fintech companies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Hereford, England, United Kingdom

Type: Permanent

Working Pattern: Hybrid working ( 3days onsite)




Who Are we?




MandM is one of the biggest employers in Herefordshire and one of Europe‚Äôs leading online, off-price retailers, selling branded Fashion, Sport & Outdoor products for Men, Women and Children.

We offer our customers fantastic value by partnering with companies who we have built long term relationships with, enabling us to offer our customers big household names and up-and-coming brands, giving fantastic value all year round.




We are located in the heart of Hereford City Centre in our brand new, state of the art office. The modern, stylish workspace was designed to encourage collaborative working, teamwork and creativity - everything that MandM is all about.




As our business continues to grow we are recruiting for a talented Data Analyst to join our growing team.




Why not come be a part of our journey to success and take advantage of all MandM can offer you!




More than a role




‚ú® Competitive Salary: Your talent deserves recognition

üèÜ Company bonus: We succeed, you benefit

üöÄ Career Growth: Opportunity to grow

üéÅ Staff Discounts: Stay stylish with our exclusive discounts.

üè¶ Company Pension: Secure your financial future.

üèñÔ∏è Generous Holiday Allowance: Enjoy 5 weeks of well-deserved breaks. You even have the option to buy an extra week

üíä Health & Wellbeing programme; we‚Äôll look after you




The Role Scope




‚ú®Role key responsibilities




Maintain a suite of business reports using Excel, Google Analytics, SQL and Looker (spanning financial, web analytics, customer, warehouse and product KPIs).
Perform ad-hoc project analysis and decision support across a wide variety of business projects spanning Marketing, IT, Operations and Finance.
Maintain and optimise the structure of stored data to enable timely, accurate and automated business reporting.
Be an expert on our data ‚Äì continually search for valuable insights within the information that we store and pass these findings on to key stakeholders.
Promote the use of data across the organisation, helping make smarter, data-driven decisions.
Work alongside other members of the data analytics team sharing and adopting ideas and best practice.
Proactively and continuously improve processes, systems and documentation.




About You




‚ú®Skill/competency




A passion for data, you will love turning large, transactional datasets into meaningful commercial insights to solve pressing business challenges.
SQL and/or Python experience
Robust analytical skills ‚Äì able to spot trends and explain findings to a non-analytical audience.
Intermediate excel skills (lookups, pivots).
Experience with Google Analytics and data stored in databases would be advantageous.
A naturally inquisitive, self-starter with an eye for detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentation skills.
Excellent organisational, problem-solving, project management and communication skills.
The ability to work to deadlines and be flexible to deal with changing business demands.
An understanding of online retailing and the key KPIs that an online business needs to measure would be advantageous

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your New Company

My client believes in valuing people for who they are and advocate for the respect and inclusion of everyone they support in society. No one should be limited in achieving their dreams. With the right support, they believe everyone can live the life they choose.




This is a fantastic opportunity to join this dynamic and forward-thinking organisation at the forefront of a digital transformation. They are committed to innovation and excellence, working collaboratively across IT, Operations, and Central Services Teams to deliver cutting-edge solutions. The team is passionate about leveraging technology to drive efficiency and improve outcomes.




Your New Role

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting the Digital Transformation Programme Manager, Digital Project Managers, and Project Management Officer with project delivery. You will work collaboratively with internal teams and external consultants to analyse existing systems, cleanse data, and ensure successful data migration and testing.

Your responsibilities will include:

Supporting data analysis, cleansing, and migration for digital transformation projects.
Mapping ‚Äòas is‚Äô and ‚Äòto be‚Äô data flows.
Reviewing existing data for duplication, errors, and inconsistencies.
Developing and implementing data quality control tests.
Identifying root causes of data quality issues and recommending solutions.
Presenting data quality findings to management and stakeholders.
Assisting in the development of test plans and coordinating testing of new systems.
Training staff on data quality policies and procedures.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

To excel in this role, you will need:

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Experience with data analysis, cleansing, and migration.
Capable with Power BI, SQL and excel.
Proficiency in mapping data flows and identifying data quality issues.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with stakeholders.
Ability to develop and implement data quality control tests.
Problem-solving skills to identify and address data quality issues.
Experience in training staff on data quality standards and procedures.




What You‚Äôll Get in Return

In return for your expertise and dedication, you‚Äôll get:

A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
The chance to work on impactful projects that drive digital transformation.
Supportive team culture and access to cutting-edge technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A prominent law firm is looking to hire a Data Analyst and can produce key analysis on various topics in particular regulatory reporting.

Responsibilities

Understand the New Business function, identifying risks involved with new clients and matters, and produce analysis and key insights to manage these risks globally.
Produce and maintain compliance and regulatory reports for internal and external clients, and regulatory bodies, while creating and updating dashboards to track metrics and visualize insights.
Build and maintain a suite of reports using Excel, SQL, and PowerBI for regular weekly and monthly reporting, working closely with the Financial Crime Team to manage new client workflow and compliance.
Enhance data integrity through ongoing manual data cleansing and collaborate with relevant teams to ensure proper data maintenance and establish Data Entry Standards.
Provide analytical support for new business initiatives, identify process efficiencies, support annual reviews of third-party software, and review new technologies, including Generative AI, to improve NB&ER processes.




Requirements

At least 1-2 years previous data analysis experience ideally within a law firm.
Expert user of Excel with experience of building and using own sophisticated spreadsheets with pivot tables and macros.
A good working knowledge of all other Microsoft packages (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) is essential for the role.
Ideally knowledge of SQL and Power BI.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

¬£35,000 - ¬£40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.

Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Client Location: Remote (must be UK based)

Starting: ASAP

Salary/Pay Rate: ¬£22.60 - ¬£25 p/h (dependent on location)

Duration: 6 months




Job Description:




In the rapidly evolving field of generative AI, measuring quality remains a challenge due to the lack of reliable technical metrics. The minute differences in the generated details can significantly impact user experience. Our clients team is developing manual, semi-automatic, and fully automatic protocols to measure the quality of our face generative models, such as "talking heads," face reenactment, and face manipulation, across various quality dimensions, including lipsync quality, visual artefacts, identity preservation, and naturalness of expressions. To support this effort, they need additional data analysts to help prototype and iterate on these protocols before scaling them up.




Job Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the team to prototype human rating and semi-automatic model evaluation protocols.
Conduct in-house human rating on generated content for high-stake and complex protocols.
Work with other teams to scale up validated evaluation protocols, including coordination and auditing.




Skills:

Prior industrial experience in software development and testing, or research experience in human-computer interaction.
Basic knowledge of Python, Unix, and SQL.
Basic understanding of computer vision, generative models, and/or face analysis.
High attention to detail and aptitude for experimental investigations.




** This role is open until Tuesday 23rd July **




Client Description:

Our Client is the largest social media company in the world. They have substantial B2B and B2C advertising and media platforms, as well as a nonprofit initiative. With the mission of bringing people together, they now boast over 2 billion users, and are rapidly developing as they influence the world around us.




Aquent is dedicated to improving inclusivity & is proudly an equal opportunities employer. We encourage applications from under-represented groups & are committed to providing support to applicants with disabilities. We aim to provide reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, to those with a medical condition, disability or neurodivergence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Summary

Location

United Kingdom

Job Family

Digital & Technology

Job Type

Full Time

Posted Date

01-Jul-2024

Ref #

59805

We're hiring for a seasoned Data Analyst on a 10 month fixed term contract.

Working closely with stakeholders, you'll need to be confident handling multiple simultaneous tasks, prioritize work, and remain functional in a fast paced environment. As a Data Analyst you'll also be involved in identifying, evaluating, and documenting potential data sources in support of a wide range of projects, ensuring timely data-loading while maintaining accuracy and relevance of data.

Who we are

The UK‚Äôs fastest broadband network. The nation‚Äôs best-loved mobile brand. And, one of the UK's biggest companies too.

Diverse, high performing teams - jam packed with serious talent. Together, we offer the UK more choice and better value, through our boundary-pushing, customer-championing values and ambitions.

Together, we are Virgin Media O2, and we can't wait to see what you can do.

Accessible, inclusive and equitable for all

Virgin Media O2 is an equal opportunities employer and we're working hard to remove bias and barriers for our people and candidates. So, we build equity and inclusion into everything we do, from the policies we craft to the relationships we shape. We support and encourage you to be your authentic self throughout your application journey with us.

The must haves

In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;


Strong SQL skills
Experience with designing and implementing ETL processes for data integration.
Proficient in acquiring and documenting data from various sources.
Demonstrable experience with data visualisation tools, ideally Tableau.



The other stuff we are looking for

We'd also love you to bring;


Commercial experience with dbt.
Hands on experience using BigQuery.



What's in it for you

Our goal is to celebrate our people, their lives and everything in-between. We aim to create a culture that empowers everyone to bring the best versions of themselves to work each and every day. We believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a brighter world.

Working at Virgin Media O2, you get a bumper reward package bursting with benefits, and loads of extras you can add if you‚Äôd like to. These are designed to support both you and your loved ones, making sure that you‚Äôre covered no matter what life throws your way.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you as a person and your experience to date. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two stage interview process.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.

Please note: Applications will be reviewed, and interviews conducted throughout the duration of this advert, therefore we may bring the closing date forward. We encourage all interested applicants to apply as soon as possible. Thanks for your patience and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

Accessible, inclusive and equitable for all

Virgin Media O2 is an equal opportunities employer and we're working hard to remove bias and barriers for our people and candidates. So, we build equity and inclusion into everything we do, from the policies we craft to the relationships we shape. We support and encourage you to be your authentic self throughout your application journey with us.

The must haves

In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;

  • Strong SQL skills
  • Experience with designing and implementing ETL processes for data integration.
  • Proficient in acquiring and documenting data from various sources.
  • Demonstrable experience with data visualisation tools, ideally Tableau.


The other stuff we are looking for

We'd also love you to bring;

  • Commercial experience with dbt.
  • Hands on experience using BigQuery.


What's in it for you

Our goal is to celebrate our people, their lives and everything in-between. We aim to create a culture that empowers everyone to bring the best versions of themselves to work each and every day. We believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a brighter world.

Working at Virgin Media O2, you get a bumper reward package bursting with benefits, and loads of extras you can add if you‚Äôd like to. These are designed to support both you and your loved ones, making sure that you‚Äôre covered no matter what life throws your way.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you as a person and your experience to date. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a two stage interview process.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.

Please note: Applications will be reviewed, and interviews conducted throughout the duration of this advert, therefore we may bring the closing date forward. We encourage all interested applicants to apply as soon as possible. Thanks for your patience and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Analyst - Customer Flexibility

Location: Castleford

Directorate: Energy Systems

Job Ref No: R6646




Do you have what it takes to play a key role in shaping the electricity distribution network of the future and be at the heart of achieving net zero?




We are Northern Powergrid, and we are responsible for powering everyday life for 8 million people across the North East, Yorkshire and northern Lincolnshire. We are a diverse team, creating a smarter, more flexible electricity distribution network that will enable our region to decarbonise and meet the needs of our customers now, and in the future.




Distribution System Operation (DSO) involves us delivering an increasingly smart and flexible energy system for our customers that delivers a greener grid, with maximum resilience at minimal overall cost.




This is an exciting opportunity at a time of significant and fascinating change within the energy sector. As an Analyst reporting into the Head of System Flexibility, you will be part of the System Flexibility team involved with delivering customer and network flexibility solutions to help develop and operate our network more efficiently.




Along with a competitive salary up to ¬£35,000 we also offer great benefits such as;




‚Ä¢Enrolment into our double-matched pension scheme

‚Ä¢25 days holiday plus bank holidays

‚Ä¢Bonus scheme ‚Äì up to 10%

‚Ä¢Agile working arrangements




We are excited to hear from candidates with a passion for our company and the energy industry and a desire to succeed. Apply now and we‚Äôll be in touch.




Key Responsibilities




The successful candidate will:




‚Ä¢Working across the organisation to gather information

‚Ä¢Producing reports and data for internal and external audiences

‚Ä¢Prepare documents (presentations and outline written documents) and develop in line with colleagues‚Äô input.

‚Ä¢Maintain effective communication and working relationships with key internal and external stakeholders

‚Ä¢Supporting the wider team with general administration to ensure the achievement of monthly deadlines and department performance

‚Ä¢Contribute to industry wide market development with other DNOs by representing Northern Powergrid on ENA Open Network working groups.




Does this sound like you?




‚Ä¢Team working is essential in this role to develop and implement new solutions. You will be part of a high-performing team, leading change

‚Ä¢Confident decision-making skills

‚Ä¢Problem solving is a must when faced with the scale and pace of change facing us, not to mention the number of exciting challenges

‚Ä¢Deliver quality outputs to required deadlines, accuracy and attention to detail with the ability to research, digest, analyse and present material clearly and concisely

‚Ä¢Excellent verbal and written skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders from across the business and wider industry

‚Ä¢Analytical and data driven, using your skills to drive forward our analytical capability and data management




What qualifications and experience should you have?




‚Ä¢Educated to degree level in a relevant subject

‚Ä¢2 A Levels or NVQ Level 4 or HNC

‚Ä¢IT and Analytical experience

‚Ä¢Ideally some experience working in the energy sector (but not essential)

‚Ä¢Ability to use appropriate IT applications effectively (including Outlook, SharePoint, Word, PowerPoint and Excel




Visit northernpowergrid.com/careers to find out more about this and other career opportunities.




Closing date for applications: 2 August 2024

Title: Business Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial
Business Data Analyst required for a dynamic Specialist Insurer, who are committed to leveraging data & analytics to drive their underwriting function. This is a multi-faceted role where you will support the actuarial reserving & finance team, contributing to improving data analysis & data quality capabilities.

Coming from the London Markets, you will have a deep understanding of business processes coupled with strong Data Analytical skills. You will have experience supporting large datasets and excellent knowledge of Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks.

This is an ideal role for a business focused Data Analyst who is motivated by a data-first environment.


Responsibilities:

Collaborate with actuarial & finance function to support business needs & translate into data solutions
Utilize Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across data cleansing, collection and analysis
Identifying gaps and opportunities in Data findings, correcting data errors and improving data quality processes
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


Requirements:

London Markets Insurance experience is required
Demonstrated experience working with Power BI and Alteryx
Experience supporting large amounts of data
Understanding of Data Quality procedures & processes
Ability to work with cross-functional departments i.e. finance, actuarial, underwriting etc


Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst üì∞ Digital News Media







üí∞ Salary: up to ¬£35,000

üè† Work Arrangement: Hybrid ‚Äì 2 days per week in the office

üìçOffice: Central London







We are thrilled to partner with a prestigious digital news media company. They are seeking a Data Analyst to join their innovative Analytics Team.







üöÄ This role is ideal for you if:

You want to kickstart your career in data analytics or move to an analytics role within media and would be excited to join one of the biggest media analytics teams in the UK.
You are passionate about combining maths and data.
You appreciate working in an environment that values independent thought, innovation, and diversity.
You have an interest in media and journalism







üîç What are we looking for in the ideal candidate?

Experience using digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Looker (Or Tableau)
Proficient in maths and Excel.
A people person, willing to learn and able to thrive under pressure.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with various internal teams.







üìà Here‚Äôs what your role will entail:

You will run, improve and deliver weekly, monthly and ad-hoc reports for the internal team
Analyse data related to digital media, such as SEO, Social Media, Social Listening, Video Analytics, and Digital Analytics.
Work with the internal teams to brief them on digital performance and the latest trends.
You will represent the data team with non-technical teams.







üå± Opportunity for growth

You can work within a large analytics team and will have opportunities to move up in role and seniority.
You can learn technical skills from other people in the team, with the opportunity to practice them in your role
You can work directly with the Head and Director of analytics and will have a chance to communicate with senior leaders.
You will have access to the latest technologies and platforms in the digital space.







üì® Are you ready to embark on a career path that blends data analytics with the fast-paced world of digital media?







Apply here!







‚öñÔ∏è Equal Opportunities

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. In accordance with the Equality Act 2010, we aim to create an environment where everyone can utilize their skills fully, free from discrimination or harassment, and where decisions are based solely on merit. We ensure no individual is treated less favorably on any discriminatory grounds, including age, disability, gender reassignment, marital status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - InsurTech Scale-up - London (hybrid) - Up to ¬£90,000 + bonus




numi has partnered with a game-changing InsurTech scale-up to hire a Senior Data Analyst for their high-performing analytics team!




This is an exciting opportunity to join a data-driven company that's revolutionising the insurance industry for underserved customers with cutting-edge technology. As their newest Senior Data Analyst, you'll be diving deep into customer data, uncovering insights that drive retention strategies, and helping to provide fair car insurance to underserved customers.




We're looking for a data whiz to join cross-functional teams in a low-ego, high-performance culture that offers amazing career growth opportunities.




You'll need...

Several years of experience as a Senior Data Analyst
Excellent DBT skills with 2+ years hands-on experience (this is a must!)
Strong SQL and Looker expertise
Experience in start-ups/scale-ups and agile environments
Proven track record in stakeholder management
Deep understanding of customer lifetime value and retention strategies
Comfort with fast-paced environments and a "fail fast, no blame" mentality




Bonus points for...

Background in subscription-based companies
Experience in the InsurTech sector




What's in it for you?

Salary up to ¬£90,000 for the right candidate
Bonus and excellent benefits package
Hybrid working (2 days/week in office)
Chance to be part of an InsurTech revolution!




Interested? Apply now or reach out to daisy@wearenumi.com for more details and a chat about this exciting role!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Uncover your potential within Kantar's Profiles division, which houses the largest audience network worldwide. Our team comprises 600 professionals located across 27 countries. Through the use of advanced technology, we provide our clients with seamless access to authentic individuals and unrivaled insights. Our Profiles Audience Network, reinforced by leading anti-fraud technology, encompasses over 170 million individuals in more than 100 markets across the globe. Join us and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of panel market research while achieving impactful outcomes for brands worldwide!




What you need to know about this job?

Join our Data Science team at Kantar Profiles as a Mid-Level Data Analyst! If you are enthusiastic about transforming data into actionable insights and have a strong programming background (Python and SQL), we encourage you to apply. This role offers a distinctive chance to collaborate with our Senior Data Scientists and contribute significantly to our innovative projects.




What you‚Äôll do...

Lead all aspects of alerts to ensure the ecosystem's functionality, working with existing models for day-to-day operations and performance.
Analyze user acquisition and retention data, identifying weaknesses and bugs in existing models for resolution.
Run analytics to extract statistics, patterns, and design machine learning models to improve existing technologies.
Contribute to data/statistics tasks for improving user engagement, working closely with the development team.
Work together with different team members to offer valuable insights and analyses that contribute to decision-making processes.
Communicate technical information with both technical and non-technical team members and collaborators.
Transform data using ETL tools like DBT to make it more accessible to the broader business.
Build visualizations, monitor trends, and identify patterns using time series graphing services like Grafana.
Define critical metrics to drive improvements in user acquisition and engagement performance.




What you‚Äôll bring...

Experience with database queries, programming, data mining/wrangling, analysis, and reporting.
Strong proficiency in SQL, with the ability to read, write, and query optimally.
A keen curiosity about data, statistics, machine learning, and data science.
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development, logical thinking, and critical analysis.
Experience with statistical computer languages such as Python, Scala, R, MATLAB.
Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts, including regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, and accurate usage.
Experience using web services and languages, including AWS, EC2, S3, Redshift, DigitalOcean, etc.
Meticulous and committed, with a good work ethic and the capacity to collaborate effectively with diverse teams.
Experience in Excel and Power BI is a plus.




Benefits include 25 days annual leave (increasing with tenure), private medical health cash plan, income protection, life assurance, enhanced employer pension contribution; plus award-winning voluntary flexible benefits (lifestyle, health, wealth, wellbeing). We offer a hybrid working arrangement with an office presence of at least 2 days a week in Reading.




At Kantar Profiles, we are committed to creating an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment. We value diversity and inclusion and believe that a diverse team brings exceptional talent and perspective. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds.




Reasonable Accommodation/Adjustment Statement: We strive to provide a fair and supportive working environment where all individuals feel included, accepted, and are allowed to flourish. If you require reasonable accommodations or adjustments to participate in the recruitment process, please let us know. We will work with you to meet your needs.




Please note that we are not able to offer visa sponsorship or assist with relocation support for this role. Applicants must have the right to work in the country where this role is located before applying.

Title: Data Analyst (Finance) - UK
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren't kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They're some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to deliver rock star solutions ü§ò

We're looking for a superstar Data Analyst with a strong understanding of finance who doesn't believe there's a data task that can be too hard ü¶¨

From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ‚ú®

Up for the challenge? Get in touch üöÄ

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge
Previous experience in the financial/banking industry


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming
Experience in Accounting


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

  • Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
  • Experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++‚Ä¶)
  • School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming
  • Experience in Accounting

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer ‚Äì Bradford, ‚Äì Circa ¬£46,000 + Bonus + Excellent Pension + Bens




Location: Bradford, West Yorkshire with Hybrid Work Arrangements




Our client, a leading organisation in the region, is looking for a talented Data Engineer to join their dynamic team.




Our Data Engineer will work as part of a team who define and implement PAAS and IAAS data services. These are delivered with high availability, high throughput, data redundancy, data loss prevention and resilience in mind.




They will ensure sustainable & cost-effective consumption of data services working within agile squads. Working as part of a wider Azure, cloud and data practice they will drive cloud adoption in the right ways working closely with data science, software engineering, architecture, and support teams.




The Data Engineer is an embedded team member of our ARTs, developing digital products with agile squads and educating on the use of cloud to ensure there is appropriate focus and alignment on best practice.




Where You Fit In:

As our Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in our team by:

CI/CD Application Development: Working closely with developers to own the continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) application development within Azure and Azure DevOps. You will build and manage Azure DevOps pipelines for CI/CD and release management workflows.
Security Collaboration: Collaborating with security architecture teams to ensure data security both at rest and in transit. You will provide input on application security, key management, identity management, authentication, and authorization.
Cloud Governance: Contributing your insights to our cloud governance model and helping shape and define how we deploy and manage the platform.
Observability Patterns: Implementing observability patterns using Azure Application Insights and Log Analytics Workspace.
Leadership: Leading our internal Data Engineering capability with the support of a third-party partner.




What Skills & Qualifications You Will Need:

Experience delivering a modern data stack in the cloud
Working knowledge of the Azure portal and basic pipeline components
Experience in data modeling and analytics
Proficiency in data visualization
Experience building structured data models and analytical solutions
Self-starter with strong problem-solving skills
Ability to understand business needs and translate them into technical designs
Capability to own and estimate a backlog of work




Desirable Skills & Experience:

Proficiency in SQL, GIT, Spark, and DBT
Experience with Databricks and integration technologies such as SSIS, Data Factory, and BizTalk
Familiarity with Azure DevOps build and release pipelines
Knowledge of Python and PowerBI

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job description:

Data Engineer¬†

¬†

Salary & Benefits: ¬£39,264 - ¬£49,080 per annum dependant on experience, annual bonus, attractive pension scheme (Up to 10% company contribution), life assurance cover of 4 times pensionable salary and 25 days annual leave, bank holidays plus a wellness day and development opportunities in line with the Data Engineer ¬†progression plan. We also offer a fantastic flexible benefits package, where you can choose from benefits such as health cash plan scheme, critical illness insurance, dental insurance, life assurance flex and partner cover. ¬†Colleagues also have access to a retail savings scheme, online GP service, cycle to work scheme, gym membership discounts and many more!Location: Bradford ¬†/ Hybrid Working¬†

¬†

Work type: Permanent. 37 hours per week, Monday ‚Äì Friday.¬†

¬†

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer ¬†to join the Technology , Enterprise and Change Team at Yorkshire Water and be a part of helping Yorkshire Water to provide the best service to our customers. Could this be you?

¬†

What we do:

Everyone has an idea of what a water company does. Here in Yorkshire, we make sure that over 5.4 million people living in the region and the millions of people who visit our region each year, can rely on our services, and have clean and safe drinking water on tap and that their wastewater is taken away. But for us, it‚Äôs so much more than this.

We look after communities, protect the environment, and plan to look after Yorkshire‚Äôs water, today, tomorrow 24/7, 365 days a year. We provide essential water and wastewater services to every corner of the Yorkshire region, and play a key role in the region‚Äôs health, wellbeing, and prosperity.¬†

New environmental legislation, unprecedented levels of investment and changing expectations from customers means that this is an exciting time to discover opportunities within the water industry. Technology , Enterprise and Change ¬†are a key part of how we plan to meet the changing expectations of customers and regulators. ¬†

Our Data Engineer will work as part of a team who define and implement PAAS and IAAS data services. These are delivered with high availability, high throughput, data redundancy, data loss prevention and resilience in mind.

They will ensure sustainable & cost-effective consumption of data services working within agile squads. Working as part of a wider Azure, cloud and data practice they will drive cloud adoption in the right ways working closely with data science, software engineering, architecture, and support teams. ¬†

The Data Engineer is an embedded team member of our ARTs, developing digital products with agile squads and educating on the use of cloud to ensure there is appropriate focus and alignment on best practice.¬†¬†Where you fit in:

As our Data Engineer ¬†you will

¬†

Work closely with developers to own the CI/CD application development within Azure and Azure DevOps to be able to build and Manage Azure DevOps pipelines for CI CD and Release Management workflows.¬†
Collaborate with security architecture to ensure data security at rest and in transit. Input into application security, key management, identity management, authentication, and authorization.¬†
Feed your views into the YW cloud governance model and help shape and define how YW deploys and manages the platform.
Implement observability patterns using Azure Application Insights and Log Analytics Workspace.
Lead the Yorkshire Water internal Data Engineering capability with the support of a 3rd party partner.¬†

¬†

What skills & qualifications you will need:

¬†

Experience of delivering a modern data stack in the Cloud ¬†
Working knowledge of Azure portal and basic pipeline components ¬†
Experience of Data modelling and analytics ¬†
Data visualisation ¬†
Experience of building structured data models and analytical solutions¬†
To be a self-starter with strong problem-solving skills¬†
The ability to understand business needs and translate to technical designs¬†
Ability to own and estimate a backlog of work¬†

You will also benefit from having experience in the following :

¬†

SQL , GIT, Spark, DBT
Databricks ¬†and Integration Technology (SSIS, Data Factory, Biztalk) ¬†
Azure DevOps Build & Release pipelines ¬†
Python ¬†and PowerBI

¬†

Although our assets are operational 24 hours a day, 365 days a year the company is committed to support flexible work patterns and job share options, where possible, to give you more control over your time and responsibilities. Whether you have child-care responsibilities or are looking for the ideal work-life balance our flexible options can offer work patterns that suit your needs.

If you‚Äôre an experienced Data Engineer and want to help us deliver exceptional service for our customers whilst protecting the environment, then apply today to find out what a career with Yorkshire Water can offer for you.

¬†

¬†

We are proud to serve the Yorkshire region and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment that is reflective of the communities we serve. We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds to apply.¬†¬†If successful for the role, you will be required to undergo pre-employment checks that will include a Basic Disclosure Check, carried out through a Third Party Company, prior to commencing employment. Depending on the role, you may also be required to go through the security vetting process for either a Counter Terrorist Check or Security Check clearance. ¬†

Kelda Group reserve the right to close this position before the published closing date, should the need occur. We therefore advise that you complete and submit your application as soon as possible.¬†¬†

We also offer a fantastic flexible benefits package, where you can choose from benefits such as health cash plan scheme, critical illness insurance, dental insurance, life assurance flex and partner cover.  Colleagues also have access to a retail savings scheme, online GP service, cycle to work scheme, gym membership discounts and many more!Location: Bradford  / Hybrid Working

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Engineer  to join the Technology , Enterprise and Change Team at Yorkshire Water and be a part of helping Yorkshire Water to provide the best service to our customers. Could this be you?

New environmental legislation, unprecedented levels of investment and changing expectations from customers means that this is an exciting time to discover opportunities within the water industry. Technology , Enterprise and Change  are a key part of how we plan to meet the changing expectations of customers and regulators.  

Our Data Engineer will work as part of a team who define and implement PAAS and IAAS data services. These are delivered with high availability, high throughput, data redundancy, data loss prevention and resilience in mind.

They will ensure sustainable & cost-effective consumption of data services working within agile squads. Working as part of a wider Azure, cloud and data practice they will drive cloud adoption in the right ways working closely with data science, software engineering, architecture, and support teams.  

The Data Engineer is an embedded team member of our ARTs, developing digital products with agile squads and educating on the use of cloud to ensure there is appropriate focus and alignment on best practice.  Where you fit in:

As our Data Engineer  you will

 

  • Work closely with developers to own the CI/CD application development within Azure and Azure DevOps to be able to build and Manage Azure DevOps pipelines for CI CD and Release Management workflows. 
  • Collaborate with security architecture to ensure data security at rest and in transit. Input into application security, key management, identity management, authentication, and authorization. 
  • Feed your views into the YW cloud governance model and help shape and define how YW deploys and manages the platform.
  • Implement observability patterns using Azure Application Insights and Log Analytics Workspace.

  • Experience of delivering a modern data stack in the Cloud  
  • Working knowledge of Azure portal and basic pipeline components  
  • Experience of Data modelling and analytics  
  • Data visualisation  
  • Experience of building structured data models and analytical solutions 
  • To be a self-starter with strong problem-solving skills 
  • The ability to understand business needs and translate to technical designs 
  • Ability to own and estimate a backlog of work 

You will also benefit from having experience in the following :

 

  • SQL , GIT, Spark, DBT
  • Databricks  and Integration Technology (SSIS, Data Factory, Biztalk)  
  • Azure DevOps Build & Release pipelines  
  • Python  and PowerBI

 

Although our assets are operational 24 hours a day, 365 days a year the company is committed to support flexible work patterns and job share options, where possible, to give you more control over your time and responsibilities. Whether you have child-care responsibilities or are looking for the ideal work-life balance our flexible options can offer work patterns that suit your needs.

If you‚Äôre an experienced Data Engineer and want to help us deliver exceptional service for our customers whilst protecting the environment, then apply today to find out what a career with Yorkshire Water can offer for you.

 

 

We are proud to serve the Yorkshire region and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment that is reflective of the communities we serve. We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds to apply.  If successful for the role, you will be required to undergo pre-employment checks that will include a Basic Disclosure Check, carried out through a Third Party Company, prior to commencing employment. Depending on the role, you may also be required to go through the security vetting process for either a Counter Terrorist Check or Security Check clearance.  

Kelda Group reserve the right to close this position before the published closing date, should the need occur. We therefore advise that you complete and submit your application as soon as possible.

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Interactive Dashboard
Description:
You'll also provide information reporting and dashboards deliverable to both internal and external stakeholders; external is delivered to service launches/re-launches and on a routine basis, internal is mainly to an ad-hoc/priority basis. These reports are based around measuring the value of work we are delivering towards the NHS and healthcare; and to also measure quality, KPIs, billing measurements for internal purposes.

Principle responsibilities:


Supervise the data analyst team, managing their day-to-day work, their priorities and being a go-to for queries and support
Maintain/strive to improve an understanding of all major areas of analysis and statistics. This includes certain tools: MySQL, Tableau, Excel, VBA, and other BI tools
Work with the IT Operations Manager to improve team processes, to strive to push and use new technologies to improve the usage of the database
Maintain, develop and be responsible for key reporting streams used both internally and externally
Work on the creation and maintenance of a suite of reports, which must be designed to be clinically sound in highlighting patient care delivered by our clinical pharmacists
Assist with identifying / fixing any issues or flaws in the reporting/IT systems
Ensure all data and reporting capabilities adhere to strict information governance guidelines regarding confidentiality and data protection laws
Encourage improved data quality by highlighting areas of concern to appropriate staff, liaising actively with clinical and administrative teams to understand and resolve data quality issues, and alerting managers to possible training needs
To support the provision of training and support to managers and clinicians in the use of information systems and business intelligence tools
Ensure projects are completed within given timelines, taking ownership of the process and the management of the project.



Skills and competencies:

Essential skills:


Good experience with a relational database system (preferably MySQL)
Good experience with an interactive dashboard software (preferably Tableau)
Good experience with using a spreadsheet software tool (such as Excel VBA)
Good verbal and written communication skills
Ability to project manage and prioritize
Strong problem-solving skills
Keen to work in a team and collaborate.



Desirable skills:


Experience of leading a team of data analysts
Experience providing customer support and administration for web-applications
Experience of advanced database functions
Knowledge or experience of the healthcare industry (preferably long-term conditions)
Knowledge or experience of working closely with upper management and business processes.



Please use the below link for job application and quicker response.

https://lifelancer.com/jobs/view/eb8d3d5d1bf0472f32a758ad42ad3b59
