Title: Information Analyst
Description:
Hybrid working - 2-3 days a week onsite |Competitive salary



About Our Client

The client is a Public Sector client whose mission is to improve the nation's health and social care through research. They are based within easy walk of Leeds train station.

Job Description

The purpose of the Information Analyst post is to:


Take day to day responsibility for completion of information requests of schemes and programmes that form part of the training and fellowship portfolio;
Act as an interface between the programme teams and business intelligence function within the client's own Academy to ensure appropriate evaluation and analysis of programme outcomes;
Lead on the evaluation and analysis of awards and programmes supported by the Academy through the monitoring of awards, and review of outcomes;
Support Academy executive on ensuring adherence of data standards and quality including accurate coding and classification of academy awards and compliance with agreed Data Standards across the business including management of organisation validations within the Standard Application Form;
Working with the Assistant Director for Evaluation and Impact, support on defining, analysing and communicating the impact of investment in research capacity develop;
Support members of the Academy Executive Board in their role of having oversight of the various funding streams.



The Successful Applicant


Previous experience as an Information Analyst
Experience in use of data analysis and visualisation tools such as Qlikview or Excel
An understanding of public sector health research and its management
Extensive experience using databases and spreadsheets holding complex information.
NHS experience is desirable but not essential
Advanced skills in producing and communicating complex written, tabular and graphical information
A proven track record in successfully planning and organising yourself, others and projects
Experience prioritising, scheduling and managing delivery of a complex, wide-ranging, time-critical and unpredictable workload


What's on Offer

On offer is a 9 month fixed term contract which allows for flexible working. This would suit someone who is prepared to be on-site in Leeds (close to the train station) at least 2 days a week.

Contact: Steve Brown

Quote job ref: JN-062024-6466706

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer

Location ‚Äì Leeds

4 days from home ‚Äì 1 day in the office.




Change-Digital are working with a forward-thinking, modern approach Financial Services Client based in Leeds. The have a fast paced, energetic environment like a start-up but also have the financial security of a larger bank. They are a technology first business and have lots happening in tech.




This is a great opportunity to become a part of a growing Data Engineering team and play a vital role in executing our clients Technology strategy by guaranteeing data precision, uniformity, and dependability.




Role Responsibilities:




Ensuring the upkeep of current data pipelines by anticipating problems and promptly addressing any incidents with professionalism.
Creating new pipelines to meet business needs or to enhance the stability of the current system.
Collaborating with different departments within the business to establish the necessary criteria for upcoming projects, including requests for pipelines and ETL processes.
Taking charge of monitoring crucial operations and processes.




Desired qualifications & experience:




The ideal candidate will have extensive experience within Data Engineering and have a high level of knowledge in AWS and SQL.




Skilled in utilizing SQL databases like Postgres and Athena Presto SQL, with a strong proficiency in Python to construct, manage, and coordinate data pipelines throughout the organization.
Documentation and deployment - Capable of delivering changes in a structured way to guarantee that they undergo testing, approval, and deployment following established business procedures (using GitHub). Documentation needs to be both coherent and accessible to a broad range of audiences, including those with technical and non-technical backgrounds.







If you are looking for your next career move and have some of the skills listed above, please forward your latest CV for immediate consideration.

Title: Digital Performance Analyst (Web) - NHS.UK
Description:
Advertising Start Date: 03 Jul 2024

Vacancy: 3529

Salary Details: Band 8A - ¬£50,952 - ¬£57,349

Location: Leeds

Vacancy Type: Permanent

Hours Per Week: 37.5

Working Pattern: Full-time, flexible working options considered

Closing Date: 21 Jul 2024







NHS England‚Äôs Transformation Directorate has a mandate to deliver a very broad and complex set of new products, platforms, services, and capabilities over the coming years to support the transformation of health and care. The scale and maturity of digital health is now central to the delivery of health and care goals. Technology and digital innovation has never been so important for the continued improvement of health outcomes for patients.




We now have an opportunity for an experienced Digital Performance Analyst to join our Digital Citizen team to work across the NHS.UK web estate.




Digital Citizen delivers citizen-facing national digital channels and services - including nhs.uk, the NHS App, and NHS Login.




NHS.UK is the UK's biggest health website, with more than 80 million visits every month. It provides thousands of clinically validated articles, videos and tools, and millions of people also access our content through partner websites, apps & internet-connected devices. More than 2,000 organisations share our content, including other NHS websites, local authorities, charities and commercial organisations. Social media is also an important part of the NHS website service and we reach millions of people a month through Facebook, Twitter & YouTube.




We believe it's important that people engage with their health, care and wellbeing so they can stay healthy and help manage any long-term health conditions.




As a Digital Performance Analyst you role will include:




Reviewing, analysing and reporting web analytics data for NHS.uk (Adobe Analytics)




Providing effective and ongoing and actionable insight into user journeys across NHS.uk




Setting and tracking relevant performance KPIs




Using web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics) and reporting through data visualisation tools e.g. Power Bi to analyse the end-to-end user journey




Communicating complex data clearly across the programme and key external stakeholders including Department of Health & Social Care and NHS England




Exploring and investigating new tools and technology to assist with web analytics and insight







Some of the skills and experience we‚Äôre looking for:




Experience and in-depth knowledge of one or more digital analytics products, such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytic s or Webtrends




Experience in the end-to-end tagging of web pages with analytics code and utilising tag management techniques




Experience of taking web analytics data and creating actionable insights into user journeys that support improvements in UJ and UX




Experience in one or more data visualisation tools, such as Power BI or Tableau




Excellent communication skills and comfortable working with a range of internal and external stakeholders




Experience of leading on a range of projects, prioritising workloads to meet deadlines, including the allocation of work to other colleagues, to deliver quality outcomes

  • Providing effective and ongoing and actionable insight into user journeys across NHS.uk


  • Setting and tracking relevant performance KPIs


  • Using web analytics tools (Adobe Analytics) and reporting through data visualisation tools e.g. Power Bi to analyse the end-to-end user journey


  • Communicating complex data clearly across the programme and key external stakeholders including Department of Health & Social Care and NHS England


  • Exploring and investigating new tools and technology to assist with web analytics and insight



Some of the skills and experience we‚Äôre looking for:


  • Experience and in-depth knowledge of one or more digital analytics products, such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytic s or Webtrends


  • Experience in the end-to-end tagging of web pages with analytics code and utilising tag management techniques


  • Experience of taking web analytics data and creating actionable insights into user journeys that support improvements in UJ and UX


  • Experience in one or more data visualisation tools, such as Power BI or Tableau


  • Excellent communication skills and comfortable working with a range of internal and external stakeholders


  • Experience of leading on a range of projects, prioritising workloads to meet deadlines, including the allocation of work to other colleagues, to deliver quality outcomes

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
JOB TITLE: Data Engineer

SALARY: ¬£68,202.00 - ¬£75,780.00

LOCATION: Leeds

HOURS: Full-time

WORKING PATTERN: Our work style is hybrid, which involves spending at least two days per week, or 40% of our time, at our office site




About this opportunity




We're looking for a Data Engineer to join the Finance Platform; a team in place to implement and design trusted, secure, stable products which service customers in Group Corporate Treasury and Finance reporting. We're focused on redefining the experiences throughout the end-to-end colleague lifecycle enabled by technology.




You'll be at the heart of designing and maintaining our data solutions in a way that unlocks and builds opportunities to digitise and deliver excellent colleague journeys and business outcomes, as well as meeting the Group's strategic goals to simplify and redefine the technology landscape.




Why Lloyds Banking Group




Like the modern Britain we serve, we're evolving. Investing billions in our people, data and tech to transform the way we meet the ever-changing needs of our 26 million customers. We're growing with purpose. Join us on our journey and you will too‚Ä¶




What you'll need




Proven knowledge of the software development lifecycle and experience in end-to-end delivery of software products
Previous experience in a Technical Business Analysis role
Strong experience in system analysis & proficient across the data lifecycle
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience in the various test phases, especially system, integration and user testing




And any experience of these would be really useful




Experience of sophisticated financial services system integrations involving treasury, risk, finance and payments data would be helpful
An understanding of Treasury asset classes, products and their associated trade lifecycles
An awareness of regulatory reporting regimes and their compliance mechanisms
Experience of working in an Agile platform environment




About working for us




Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms.




We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture.




We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative.




And it's why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups.




We also offer a wide-ranging benefits package, which includes:




A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
An annual performance-related bonus
Share schemes including free shares
Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping
30 days' holiday, with bank holidays on top
A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies




If you're excited by the thought of becoming part of our team, get in touch. We'd love to hear from you.

Title: Digital Analyst
Description:
Digital Product Officer

A leading UK children's reading charity is on a mission to make children happier, healthier, and more creative through the power of reading. With a reach extending to over 3 million families annually, they collaborate with local authorities, schools, children's centres, health visitors, and libraries across the country.




If you're passionate about digital, hungry to develop your career and want to make a difference in children's lives through the power of reading, this could be the perfect role for you.




The Role

As part of their digital transformation journey, they're seeking a Digital Product Officer to join their dynamic team. This role will be instrumental in planning, maintaining, tracking, reporting on, optimising, and evaluating the performance of their website product. You'll analyse and report on performance data, including user behaviour insights, and work collaboratively to ensure all digital activities are insight-driven and audience-focused.




This hands-on position involves working closely with cross-functional teams, supporting the Digital team in development, UX, and content design work. You'll be at the forefront of their website relaunch project, contributing to the charity's evolving digital approach.




What experience do I need?

You'll need a background in digital analytics (1-2 years). Key skills include proficiency in Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and SEO tools. Experience in setting digital KPIs, tracking, reporting, and evaluating outcomes is crucial. You should be comfortable with data analysis, and user-centred design methodologies, and have a good understanding of content management systems.




Excellent communication skills are essential, as you'll be interacting with stakeholders at all levels, translating complex data into actionable insights. Experience in UX activities, content design, and managing small digital projects would be advantageous.




What's in it for me?

The role offers a salary of ¬£33,000, with a hybrid working model based in Leeds. You'll enjoy 28 days' holiday plus public holidays, a generous 7% employer pension contribution, and additional benefits including life assurance and an Employee Assistance Programme.




This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a meaningful cause while developing your skills in an evolving digital landscape




What's the interview process?

The process typically involves two stages:

A panel interview with the Head of Digital and two team members.
An informal chat with the Department Director.

Title: Parttime Developer
Description:
Power Platform Developer (Part Time)




Remuneration: Dependant on part time hours, based on ¬£50,000 per annum full time equivalent.

Two days (14 hours a week) ¬£20,000 per annum. Three days (21 hours a week) ¬£30,000 per annum.




Contract Length: 12 month fixed term contract.




Hours:¬†Part time ‚Äì two to three days a week (14 to 21 hours a week).




Location: Hybrid Working, with a minimum of one day a week in the Head Office located in Harrogate, North Yorkshire.




Who we are: LINK is a not-for-profit company governed by an independent Board and is the UK's largest cash machine network, connecting virtually all the UK‚Äôs ATMs and providing communities with access to cash through services such as cashback at retailers‚Äô tills and Banking Hubs.¬†While many consumers are now embracing digital payments, there are still millions of people who rely on cash every day.¬†At LINK, we are passionate about protecting access to cash on the UK‚Äôs High Streets and ensuring it is maintained for as long as it is needed through the operation of our well-established Financial Inclusion Programme. LINK is regulated by the Payments Systems Regulator and the Bank of England and have a great track record of delivering results for communities.




What does the role involve?¬†

LINK has a long track record of producing accurate data to support its access to cash role. It holds extensive data about cash access in the UK, through the ATM network and bank branches.

LINK has seen significant growth in recent years and is extending its usage of the Microsoft Power Platform to support business processes and insight driven from its extensive data. The Power Apps Developer role will support the rollout of relevant Power Apps to support LINK‚Äôs continued growth and role in financial services sector.

Duties will support the rollout and development of a core model driven app designed to support LINK‚Äôs work as a designated co-ordinating body under the FCA‚Äôs supervision assessing cash access needs in communities across the country. The role will ensure that the app is fit for purpose and meets regulatory requirements.

The role holder will also support in developing other relevant apps to support LINK‚Äôs work and improve its reporting and efficiency. Duties will include:




Building out a model-driven app to support LINK‚Äôs work as co-ordinating body
Collaborating with teams across LINK to understand business requirements and convert them into technical specifications
Supporting the rollout of the app to relevant users
Building workflows within the tool to support emerging requirements
Working with the commercial team to build insight via Power BI
Developing custom Power Apps solutions, including both canvas and model-driven apps, to support business functions.
Integrating Power Apps with other Microsoft functions and LINK‚Äôs SQL database
Improving the performance of and troubleshooting issues with Power Platform solutions.
Monitoring of data connections to ensure continuous performance and managing relevant upgrades in the environment.
Staying up to date with the latest features in the Power Platform and suggesting technical solutions to meet business needs.

¬†

What will I need to know?

Minimum 2 years‚Äô experience working with Microsoft Power Apps.
Experience providing troubleshooting and technical support in the platform.
Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate.
Familiarity with Azure/Dataverse.
Power Platform Certification.
Ability to convert business requirements into technical solutions.
Knowledge of functions, environments and database integrations for Power Apps.
Excellent communication, collaboration and time management.
Ability to solve complex problems and design effective solutions.




What is in it for me?

You will be joining a not-for-profit business that has seen consistent growth over the last five years. We have big plans for the future of LINK and you‚Äôll be part of a working environment where you know the work you do has an impact, and feel that you are genuinely helping the business reach its objectives.¬†We have a lovely working culture, and our employees are at the centre of our focus.

In addition to the base salary, LINK operates a bonus scheme and offers a wide range of employee benefits including group life and income protection, company pension scheme, private medical and dental insurance, hybrid working and learning opportunities. Our Harrogate office has an on-site caf√©, gym, free car parking including electric charging points¬†¬†and bike parking facilities as well.




We will be interviewing as we receive CVs so if you are interested in this role, please apply as soon as possible.

Duties will support the rollout and development of a core model driven app designed to support LINK‚Äôs work as a designated co-ordinating body under the FCA‚Äôs supervision assessing cash access needs in communities across the country.   • Familiarity with Azure/Dataverse.
  • Power Platform Certification.

  • Knowledge of functions, environments and database integrations for Power Apps.
  • Excellent communication, collaboration and time management.

You will be joining a not-for-profit business that has seen consistent growth over the last five years. We have big plans for the future of LINK and you‚Äôll be part of a working environment where you know the work you do has an impact, and feel that you are genuinely helping the business reach its objectives. We have a lovely working culture, and our employees are at the centre of our focus.

In addition to the base salary, LINK operates a bonus scheme and offers a wide range of employee benefits including group life and income protection, company pension scheme, private medical and dental insurance, hybrid working and learning opportunities. Our Harrogate office has an on-site caf√©, gym, free car parking including electric charging points  and bike parking facilities as well.


We will be interviewing as we receive CVs so if you are interested in this role, please apply as soon as possible.

Title: Data Visualisation Developer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Data Visualisation Developer to join us in Bradford.

This is hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days in the office, 3 days remote.

As part of the continued growth and diversification of Liberty Shared Services (LSS), which acts as a centre of excellence with specialisms in Finance, Accounting, People and Legal, we are looking to hire the role of Data Visualisation Developer, to support Google Cloud Platform (GCP) activity across various OpCo brands, such as Virgin Media O2 and Atlas Edge.

As an ambitious, dynamic and experienced Data Visualisation Developer, you will fully utilise your experience in GCP, Python and dbt to develop and maintain scalable Looker dashboards and reports, that integrate with various data sources. You will collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Analysts, and various stakeholders to deliver actionable insights that drive business decisions and enhance our data capabilities.

As we become world leaders in redefining the shared services market through our technology-led transformation, there has never been a better time to join Liberty Global, where as a Data Visualisation Developer you would be ideally suited with proven experience in a similar role with a desire to develop your career with a global market leader.

What will you be doing?



You will leverage your expertise in data visualisation to design and implement data models, create and manage LookML projects, where your experience with GCP will be crucial in managing and optimizing our cloud infrastructure.
Fully utilising your skills in Python and dbt, you will build robust data transformation workflows, develop and maintain Looker dashboards and reports, and design and implement efficient and scalable data models.
You will integrate Looker with various data sources and ensure the consistency, quality and reliability of data across all reports and dashboards, as well as troubleshoot and resolve issues related to pipelines and implementations.
Staying updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analytics and visualization, you will implement new ways of working across your areas of responsibility.


We Tend To Look For People With



Proven experience as a Data Visualisation Developer, Data Visualisation Engineer, BI Developer, or similar.
Strong proficiency in Looker and LookML, although PowerBI and Tableau specialists with the appetite to learn Looker and LookML will also be considered.
A solid understanding of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and its services.
Proficient in Python for data manipulation and scripting.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
The ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and communicate effectively with stakeholders.
Familiarity with version control systems like Git.


What‚Äôs in it for you?



Competitive salary
25 days annual leave with the option to purchase 5 more
Access to well-being and mental health benefits such as the Calm app, personal medical, critical illness cover and dental insurance
Matched pension contribution up to 10%
Access to our car benefit scheme
Access to our online learning platform to continue to develop and grow your career with us
The chance to join an innovative, fast-paced and passionate team


Who We Are

We‚Äôre building Tomorrow‚Äôs Connections Today, bringing people together through the power of our technology.

Liberty Global is a world leader in converged broadband, video and mobile communications and an active investor in cutting-edge infrastructure, content and technology ventures.

With our investments in fibre-based and 5G networks, we play a vital role in society, currently providing over 85 million fixed and mobile connections and rolling out the next generation of products and services, while readying our networks for 10 Gbps and beyond.

We‚Äôre creating national champions, combining the best broadband and mobile networks under brands such as Virgin Media-02 in the UK, VodafoneZiggo in The Netherlands, Telenet in Belgium, Sunrise in Switzerland, Virgin Media in Ireland and UPC in Slovakia.

Liberty Global Ventures, our global investment arm, has a portfolio of more than 75 companies and funds across content, technology and infrastructure, including strategic stakes in ITV, Univision, Plume, Lionsgate and the Formula E racing series.

Our scale enables us to transfer knowledge and expertise across our operations and investments, creating a dynamic family of brands united in the pursuit of innovation and excellence.

And we‚Äôre prioritising diversity, equity and inclusion in our workplace and communities while reducing our impact on the environment. We are using technology as a force for good, for our people, our partners and the planet.

Liberty Global is an equal-opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process.

We‚Äôre 100% committed to having a workforce that represents every part of our society. So, we‚Äôre keen to hear from candidates of all backgrounds and circumstances.

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check, which will be performed by a 3rd party provider (Sterling), on behalf of Liberty Global. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, qualifications, contact information, right to work, and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.

You can read more about how we process your data here Privacy & Security Policy - Liberty Global, and If you wish to exercise your privacy rights please contact: Peopleservices@Libertyglobal.com

Title: Business Systems Support Analyst
Description:
Location - Dewsbury

On-site, Permanent

We are a leading temporary works specialist and have been at the forefront of our industry for over 60 years, with a reputation built on engineering and service excellence. We deliver the right temporary works solution for our customers, whatever the scale or complexity of the project. Our customers include civil engineering and construction contractors, asset owners, and consulting engineering firms through to small builders.

We are currently looking for a Business Systems Support Analyst to support our growing IT team, this is a fantastic role that will allow the successful candidate to upskill and develop through the company, you will find more details below.

Benefits


A competitive basic salary
Company bonus scheme
Great health and well-being packages
A fantastic pension scheme


Key Responsibilities


Investigate, analyse and provide solutions to issues identified within software and ensure issue is managed through to conclusion.
Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent future occurrences of technical issues.
Provide technical support to end-users.
Define and Prioritise development tasks and pipeline.
Configuration and administration of core systems.
Ensure Incident, Problem and Change Management processes are followed to ensure efficient and effective resolution of technical issues and provide a first class service to the business and its customers.
Conduct systems testing and ensure the quality of business systems, including testing new software releases and patches.
Develop and maintain technical documentation, knowledgebase articles and training materials.
Help with technical solution designs and integrations.


What You Need


Minimum of 2 years supporting ERP and/or CRM systems
Advanced SQL (Structured Query Language)
Microsoft Office applications
Attention to detail
Written and Verbal communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team


Interview Process


Initial telephone / Microsoft Teams call, the line manager or Human Resources may conduct this
Interview ‚Äì In person, held by the line manager
Final Stage ‚Äì JOB OFFER!


Environmental Social & Governance

Our ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) strategy is brought to life through our ESG Champions situated throughout the company, our champions create solutions for the hottest topics in each area of our strategy. We are always looking for more recruits, if successful in securing a role at Mabey Hire Ltd, you could be a future ESG Champion‚Ä¶

Mabey Hire STEM Education Programme

In 90 minute after-school clubs, our team of STEM Ambassadors help children aged 10-13 improve their awareness and perceptions of the engineering and construction sectors. Using LEGO¬Æ Education materials and our bespoke ‚Äòmission mat,‚Äô students explore six core topics which challenge their mathematical, problem solving and strategic thinking skills.

Now you know what‚Äôs on offer, if you are interested in this position or require more information, please contact Sean Kildunne at Mabey Hire Ltd - recruitment@mabeyhire.co.uk

We are a leading temporary works specialist and have been at the forefront of our industry for over 60 years, with a reputation built on engineering and service excellence. We deliver the right temporary works solution for our customers, whatever the scale or complexity of the project. Our customers include civil engineering and construction contractors, asset owners, and consulting engineering firms through to small builders.

We are currently looking for a Business Systems Support Analyst to support our growing IT team, this is a fantastic role that will allow the successful candidate to upskill and develop through the company, you will find more details below.

Benefits

  • A competitive basic salary
  • Company bonus scheme
  • Great health and well-being packages
  • A fantastic pension scheme

Key Responsibilities

  • Investigate, analyse and provide solutions to issues identified within software and ensure issue is managed through to conclusion.
  • Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to prevent future occurrences of technical issues.
  • Provide technical support to end-users.
  • Define and Prioritise development tasks and pipeline.
  • Configuration and administration of core systems.
  • Ensure Incident, Problem and Change Management processes are followed to ensure efficient and effective resolution of technical issues and provide a first class service to the business and its customers.
  • Conduct systems testing and ensure the quality of business systems, including testing new software releases and patches.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation, knowledgebase articles and training materials.
  • Help with technical solution designs and integrations.

What You Need

  • Minimum of 2 years supporting ERP and/or CRM systems
  • Advanced SQL (Structured Query Language)
  • Microsoft Office applications
  • Attention to detail
  • Written and Verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Interview Process

  • Initial telephone / Microsoft Teams call, the line manager or Human Resources may conduct this
  • Interview ‚Äì In person, held by the line manager
  • Final Stage ‚Äì JOB OFFER!

Environmental Social & Governance

Our ESG (Environmental, Social and Governance) strategy is brought to life through our ESG Champions situated throughout the company, our champions create solutions for the hottest topics in each area of our strategy. We are always looking for more recruits, if successful in securing a role at Mabey Hire Ltd, you could be a future ESG Champion‚Ä¶

Mabey Hire STEM Education Programme

In 90 minute after-school clubs, our team of STEM Ambassadors help children aged 10-13 improve their awareness and perceptions of the engineering and construction sectors. Using LEGO¬Æ Education materials and our bespoke ‚Äòmission mat,‚Äô students explore six core topics which challenge their mathematical, problem solving and strategic thinking skills.

Now you know what‚Äôs on offer, if you are interested in this position or require more information, please contact Sean Kildunne at Mabey Hire Ltd - recruitment@mabeyhire.co.uk

Title: Data and Development Lead (band 7)
Description:
Job Overview

The post holder is key technical & specialist leadership role with responsibility for leading data and analytics systems development capability for Airedale NHS Foundation Trust and Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust.

They will provide highly-specialist advice and guidance in the identification of appropriate technologies to allow both organisations to collect, process and visualize data. This includes the use of analytical techniques to d propose and design solutions for reporting, including but not limited to architecture, business logic and visualisation layers.

They will work collaboratively with stakeholders across business and clinical domains at both organisations ensuring that solutions identified are unified and consistent whilst still providing bespoke functionality as required.

Leading on new ways of working the role will enhance the current service provision and lead on the transformation of reporting delivery across clinical and professional teams.

The post-holder will work as part of the team to maintain existing data extract processes from operational system which populate Trust Data Warehouses, ensuring clear and accurate documentation covering all processes is in place and supplemented with routine data integrity audit and checking procedures.

They will work to agreed objectives and be guided by national policy with the freedom to interpret and implement these for the organisation.

Main duties of the job

Leads on requirements gathering and scoping of new information systems, web application and report providing high-level oversight of the requirements moving into development and then business as usual reporting. Requires close working with the Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse colleagues as well as multi-disciplinary across the Trusts.

Act as the lead technical specialist on the design, development, documentation, implementation, and maintenance of web-based developments using core Microsoft technologies such as C# .NET.

Take a leading role in the systematic review, monitoring, and improvement of data integrity through automated validation processes. This will require judgement in assessing highly complex technical information to lead the Trust data warehouse.

Support dashboard and report development by working with the analyst colleagues to develop the required datasets and manage any technical processes.

Be proactive in ensuring Information Systems are prepared for changes in local and national guidelines.

Working for our organisation

We are delighted to offer a wide range of benefits to employees including:


Cycle to Work
Travel Scheme
Childcare Vouchers with Salary Sacrifice
Onsite Nursery
Buying and Selling Annual Leave
Car Leasing
Employee Assistance Programme
Employee Health and Wellbeing
Extensive Reward Scheme
Counselling Service
Financial packages including Vivup and Wagestream
Staff Networks, Enable, Rainbow, Gender, Race Equality Ecoaware & Admin Network.


Our Values

We understand that it‚Äôs down to the hard work, effort and dedication of our staff that makes a difference for our patients. Our people really do make our Airedale experience ‚Äì we take pride in fostering a friendly, effective and caring work environment. Our values are part of our DNA, which are:


Committed to Quality of Care
Compassion
Working together for patients
Improving Lives
Everyone Counts
Respect and Dignity


Got questions before you apply, please contact the recruiting manager to find out more.

Detailed Job Description And Main Responsibilities

For further information and full details of the job role please see the attached job description and person specification.

Person specification

Qualifications

Essential criteria


Educated to degree level or substantial relevant /equivalent experience


Desirable criteria


Project Management qualification/experience


Knowledge

Essential Criteria


Expertise in data analysis and data architecture design techniques
Experience of systems development approaches and the technical application of these
Expertise in information management techniques coupled with good understanding of the operational aspects of an acute Trust & how Information can support clinical, business & management decision-making.
Excellent understanding of strategic issues affecting the Trust, both local and national


Desirable criteria


Knowledge of project management methodologies and techniques for planning, monitoring and controlling projects including risk management.


Skills

Essential criteria


Advanced skills in the manipulation of data through the use of Microsoft technologies including SQL Server Management Studio, SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server Analysis Service and SQL Server Reporting Services
Strong experience with front-end technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
Good knowledge of C# and .NET
Good knowledge of using APIs and web services to integrate applications.
Excellent leadership and influencing skills, ability to enthuse, motivate and involve individuals and teams.
Excellent people management skills, proven ability to engage, coach, mentor and motivate others.
Highly advanced data presentation skills using PowerBI / SSRS


Desirable criteria


Data discovery experience
Experience of advanced analytics tools such as R


Experience

Essential criteria


Proven high level analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to think beyond boundaries, and using own expert knowledge, consider different approaches and solutions to Information requirements from the Trust, resolving conflicting approaches.
Clear understanding of NHS patient activity information, statutory data requirements, data definitions and performance measures including commissioning and RTT
An in-depth understanding of the NHS Information Agenda. NHS information flows, the NHS data model and using its data sets, NHS structure and strategic drivers.


Desirable criteria


Track record of working on full software development lifecycle projects
Show more
